loans.name: Warningsih

texts.en: Warningsih is a student of Vocational High School Diponegoro Banyuputih. She lives in Batang Center Java of Indonesia. She describes herself as a diligent and smart student. She is specializing in accounting at her school. Her parents works hard to pay her education but she faces lack of money. Her parents have not paid for 3 years of school, which are necessary for graduation. She is thankful for this loan which will enable her to graduate and achieve her dream to be a bank teller.

loans.use: to pay for school fees including monthly fees, exams, and building costs for 3 years

loans.name: Danniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 31 years old. He is married with 2 children aged 4 and 6 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 4 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 53 years old, married and has four children.

Wilma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Wilma has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a very active and responsible woman. She needed to support her husband, whose salary is small. Four years ago she decided to start a small business, a small grocery store. This business has allowed her family to have a better income and as such, a better quality of life, which is why she struggles to make her business grow.

Now she requires a loan in the amount of$550, that she will use for the purchase of more merchandise to offer her clients, and in this way increase her income. You, with your generosity, can be a great support to Juana. Do not wait. She and her family will forever thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es una mujer muy activa y responsable, por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo, puesto que el salario que recibe es muy poco, hace 4 años ella decidió iniciar con pequeño negocio propio, una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Esta actividad ha servido para que su familia pueda tener una mejor nivel de ingresos y por ende una mayor calidad de vida, por ello lucha por hacer crecer su proyecto

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $550 DLLS , mismos que destinará en la compra de más mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta forma aumentar sus ingresos. Tú, con tu generosidad, puedes ser un gran apoyo para Juana, no lo dudes, ella y su familia te lo agradecederan por siempre.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is a young entrepreneur selling shoes and used clothing in the city of Berdyansk, as well as in the towns of Primorsk and Volodarskoye. Elmira owns a fully-stocked kiosk and matches her different markets with various quantities and qualities of clothing. Jeans clothing, shirts, pants and sportswear in all types and styles attract many customers to her business. Elmira is a very energetic and active person and faces her challenges with optimism. Married with a 4-year-old son, she knows how to balance work and family. Elmira is also a very responsible client with “Nadiya Ukraine”. She has received and repaid all loans with no defaults. She realizes that lending services have promoted stable growth for her business. Currently, Elmira has about $4,000 in inventory. Her monthly gross income amounts to $2,000, and her net profit is about $800. Elmira has requested a loan for $1,000 to invest in the further expansion of her trade. She believes that financial assistance will help boost her sales and generate additional profits which will help her spend more on her family and improve their living standard.

Ельміра – молодий підприємець, вона торгує взуттям та одягом секонд-хенд в Бердянську, а також в м. Приморськ та Володарське. В кіоску Ельміри завжди можна знайти широкий асортимент одягу, різних розмірів та якості. Різноманітний джинсовий одяг, сорочки, повсякденний та спортивний одяг приваблюють багато покупців. Ельміра – дуже енергійна та активна, вона з легкістю та оптимізмом долає будь-які випробування. Ельміра – одружена, в неї є чотирирічний син. Вона навчилася поєднувати роботу та родинні обов’язки. Ельміра – дуже відповідальна клієнтка „Надії України”. Вона отримала та сплатила усі позики без жодних прострочень. Вона розуміє, що кредитні послуги сприяли стабільному зростанню її бізнесу. Зараз в Ельміри в товар вкладено приблизно 4000 доларів. Її щомісячний дохід складає 2000 доларів, чистий прибуток становить 800 доларів. Ельміра просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб вкласти кошти в подальший розвиток торгівлі. Вона вважає, що фінансова допомога сприятиме росту продажів та допоможе їй отримати додатковий прибуток, а отже, витратити більше на власну родину та покращити їхній рівень життя.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in clothing merchandise

loans.name: Polad

texts.en: Polad B. is a 46-year-old married man who lives with his two children in Khoshchobanli village in southern Azerbaijan. Polad went into business in the year 2000, when he bought his first cow and buffalo. Polad carefully raised both animals, and today the cow produces generous amounts of milk. Now he has decided to expand his business and better provide for his family by buying one grown milk cow, one calf  and enough fodder to feed the calf while it is growing up. Polad estimates that the cost of the cow is $700, the calf $300 and the fodder $200.

loans.use: To purchase one cow for $700, one calf for $300 and fodder for $200

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. is a young, 31 year-old mother of three children. She also cares for three other children. Three of her children are in secondary school and three are in “baby class”. She is bright, very kind and carries a natural and welcoming smile.

Fatuma is married and operates a retail store on the edge of Rubaga. She sells eggs, soda, soap, rice, sugar and items for personal hygiene. Since Fatuma's store is located on a busy street, she also has a wireless phone that people can pay to use. In addition, she resells the empty soda bottles.

Her business was located just a few hundred feet away, but the building was demolished two years ago. Her business suffered for a year after she moved, but now it is in decent condition.

She needs a loan to start to sell some items wholesale. Because she is on a busy street, she feels that sugar, salt, and rice could be sold to others who would then resell it. This could occur through a second loan.

(If you would like to learn more, please check out the Fellows Blog: The Women of Rubaga)

loans.use: To use her loan to start selling some items wholesale,i.e. sugar, salt, rice.

loans.name: Santa Javier

texts.en:
Santa is twenty-eight years old, and she and her husband have two young girls, ages five and seven. Santa has recently begun selling women’s clothing and fashionable shoes to members of her community. Santa plans to use her loan to buy more clothing at bulk rates, improving her profit margin and limiting the number of trips she will have to make to purchase the clothing she sells outside of her community.

Santa envisions her business becoming a “grand store” with a large selection of chic attire. She explains that the income from her business will help support her studies at the local university and help her to safeguard her children’s health.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothing products in bulk

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Parween

texts.en: I am Parween B., resident of Lahore, a historical city known for its gardens.  I am a mother of three children, two girls and a boy.  My husband operates a steel scrap business and I stitch and embroider clothes on order. I need a loan of $250 for my husband to expand his business. We want to increase our income so that our children can continue with their education.

loans.use: Buy scrap objects in bulk

loans.name: Nabingo 3 (C) Group

texts.en: Mary is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Mary and Agnes have retail shop businesses. Mary wants to increase the stock in her retail shop with the loan. Teo and Clairet have market stalls and sell raw foods. Margret runs a beauty salon and wants to buy hairdryers with the loan.

loans.use: To invest in her retail shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a woman in her late thirties; she and her husband have two children, a boy and a girl, both of whom attend school. Her husband works from home as a carpenter. To supplement the family’s income, Juana sells beauty products to the women in her community. She usually visits friends and other women of the community to sell her goods. Juana explains that her children are still young and they need all the support she can provide them.

Juana plans on using her loan to buy more products so that she can increase her sales volume and thus her income. Juana says she will keep working for the sake of her family.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 39 -ear-old father of two. Ahmad lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He is a dry cleaner. He is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua in order to help him buy a car to assist him with his business trips. Ahmad is striving to sustain and develop his work.

loans.use: to help him buy a car for the business

loans.name: Rosa Marilu

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Marilú R. D. O. is 34 years old and finished school up to the sixth graD.. She has four children, three of whom still depend on her. She lives in Chongoyape in the Paijan district of the Trujillo province, in La Libertad, Perú.

Her business began with the raising of small animals such as pigs, roosters and chickens, and she later incorporated into her enterprise the sale of beauty products ordered by her friends and acquaintances. Currently, she sells animals at the Paijan market and she also offers her catalog products.

With her first loan of S/. 300.00 obtained from the communal bank “Manos Unidas” she bought well-balanced feed for her animals.

With the loan of S/. 1000.00, to be repaid in six months, she will buy beauty products to have in stock and to pay for her orders.

Her biggest dream is to open a store from which she could offer her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa Marilú R. D. O. tiene 34 años D. edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado D. primaria. Tiene cuatro hijos pero tres aun dependen D. ella. Vive en Chongoyape en el distrito D. Paijan en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Su negocio se inicio con la crianza D. animales menores como chanchos, gallinas y pollos, posteriormente se incorporo al negocio D. la venta D. productos D. belleza le hacen pedio sus amigos y conocidos. Actualmente venD. animales por el mercado D. Paijan así también ofrece sus productos D. catálogo. Con su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que obtuvo en el Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” compro alimento balanceado como alimento D. sus animales. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará productos D. belleza para tener en stock y para pagar sus pedidos. Su mayor sueño es poner una tienda en la que allí pueda ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Trinh Thi T., 33 years old, is a 4th-year member of TYM. Her primary job is selling birds and she has been doing well due to her trustworthy and good communication skills. Each month, Ms T. earn about $130. In addition to that she also raise pigs and chickens to increase her family's income in order to pay for her children's education. She currently live with her husband and 2 children (a 9 years old and another 5 years old). This loan cycle, she would like to borrow 825 USD to buy more birds for he business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trịnh Thị Tình, 33 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Công việc hàng ngày của chị là buôn bán chim cảnh. Nhờ có khiếu ăn nói và luôn tạo được sự tin tưởng nơi khách hàng nên số lượng chim của gia đình bán ra ngày càng nhiều, thu nhập cũng cao. Bình quân một tháng chị Tình thu khoảng 130USD/tháng. Ngoài ra chị còn chăn nuôi để có thêm thu nhập, đời sống gia đình khá giả, có điều kiện đầu tư cho con cái ăn học. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con, 9 và 5 tuổi. Vòng vốn này chị Tình làm đơn xin vay 825USD để mua chim về bán.

loans.use: Buy birds

loans.name: Chreach

texts.en:
Mrs. Chreach C. (shown in the picture with her daughter), 57, and her husband, Mr. Sokhim Chey, 64, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1972 and have three daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home and the youngest one sells cloth and beauty products in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chreach and her husband have been growing rice since 1979. Beside the farming business, Mr. Sokhim has been motor taxi driver for eight years. He is in his early of 60s but is still strong enough to work.

Now Chreach is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase cloth and beauty products for her youngest daughter (who shown in the picture with her) to sell.

loans.use: For her daughter to purchase cloth and beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Mr. Komla A. was born in 1962, in Boga in the Zio Prefecture. A farmer by trade, he grows teak, which is highly sought after, as well as other crops. He has been able to meet his family’s needs thanks to the revenue he earns from farming. He has proven to be good at managing money and paid back his first loan in full, with no problems. He is requesting another loan which will allow him to purchase more teak plains so he can increase the size of his plantation. This will help him to work old plantations, allowing him to increase his revenue and thus improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Komla est né à Boga en 1962 dans la préfecture de Zio. Agriculture de profession, il cultive le teck qui est très convoité dans le pays en plus de quelques vivriers. Il arrive à subvenir aux besoins du foyer grâce au revenu de ses activités. Il fait preuve de bon gestionnaire et a bien remboursé son premier crédit sans incident. De nouveau il sollicite un financement qui lui servira d’acheter de nouveaux plans de teck afin d’agrandir sa plantation. Ceci pourra l’aider à exploiter les anciennes plantations pour avoir de revenu et contribuer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of new teak plains

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en:
Hadia is 39 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 15, 13, 11 and 7. She has been a food (rice & fish) seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Hadia has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Hadia now hopes for a loan to buy more rice and fish for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more rice and fish

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Zuhra baji is the wife of M. Iqbal and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. They own a two-room brick house that they have been living in for the last 15 years. She is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. All of her sons are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Zuhra baji's husband is a milk seller with twenty years of experience in the business.

Zuhra baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 26 años, es madre soltera de un pequeño niño de 2 años llamado Juan Carlos.  Se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurante desde hace 5 años, trabaja mucho para mantener a su pequeño hijo, que al estar creciendo requiere de mayores cuidados.  Usualmente empieza su labor diaria desde las 6 de la mañana, para preparar  el desayuno que vende  hasta aproximadamente las 9, desde esa hora empieza con la preparación del almuerzo, el cual ofrece hasta las 2 de la tarde, horas después inicia la preparación de la cena, que vende hasta las 7 u 8 de la noche dependiendo de cómo vaya la venta.  Lo más difícil del trabajo de Ana es tener que abastecerse en atender a la clientela, a veces es mucha y demanda atención, pero lo bueno es que le gusta su trabajo y eso compensa cualquier inconveniente.    Trabaja en bien de su pequeño Juan Carlos, el cual es la luz de su vida y desea brindarle un prospero futuro.  Con el dinero del préstamo comprará algunos muebles, para brindar una mejor atención a la clientela y así expandir su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ana is a 26 year old single mother of a two year old son named Juan Carlos. For the last five years, Ana has managed a restaurant, with the goal of improving the well being of her son, who needs more care as he gets older. Usually she begins working at 6 AM to prepare breakfast which she sell until 9 AM. At that hour, she begins working on lunch which will be served at 2 PM. A few hours later she begins working on dinner which will begin at around 7 or 8 PM depending on how sales are going. The most difficult part of the work is that clients demand a lot of her time and attention, but overall Ana likes her job and that compensates for any inconvenience. She is working with the well being of her son, who is the light of her life, in mind and would like to give him a brighter future. With the money from this loan, she will buy new furniture for the restaurant to better attend to her clientele, expand her business, and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying new furniture to improve the comfort of her restaurant for customers

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan S. is a Tanzanian woman and SELFINA client who is 36 years old. She is divorced with two children aged 11 and 15.

Since 2006, Joan has been buying crops from farmers to sell in town at higher prices. She is currently making a monthly profit of 300 USD. Joan is requesting a loan of 825 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of crops, such as maize, rice, beans, and ground nuts. In the future she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of crops such as maize, rice, beans, and ground nuts.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: Alex tiene 25 años, vive solo en un cuarto que alquiló. Se dedica a la venta de artefactos de segundo uso, hace ya10 años, para solventar los gastos que implica vivir solo, el aún no ha conformado una familia, ya que primero quiere forjarse un futuro y disponer de una buena estabilidad económica para poder brindarle a su familia un buen porvenir. Alex siempre ha trabajado desde muy joven, y además de trabajar con al venta de artefactos también le dedica tiempo a un equipo de fútbol con el cual adquiere algunos ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alex is 25 years old, and he lives alone in a room that he rented. He has been involved in the business of selling second-hand goods for 10 years now in order to offset the expenses that come with living alone. He still has not started a family, since he wants to forge a future first and have good economic stability in order to give his family a good future. Alex has always worked ever since he was very young, and besides his work with selling goods, he devotes his time to a football team, which supplements his income. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. With the money requested, he will buy a greater amount of merchandise in order to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of merchandise he sells

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Noeurn C., 48, lives in Ta Sen Village in Kampong Cham Province where she sells Khmer noodles door-to-door. Her husband, Mr. Vong Ny, is a construction foreman lacking sufficient funds to buy construction equipment to support his career, so Noeurn is requesting a loan for that purpose. They are the parents of three children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others are enrolled in local school.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment for her husband's business.

loans.name: Biola

texts.en:
Biola S. is 38 years old and married with two children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells wine and gift items and needs a loan of 80,000 naira (USD$550) to purchase more wine and gift items to sell.

Biola wishes to thank all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more wine and gift items.

loans.name: Rahmat Elahi M. Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
Rahmat Elahi baji is a 44-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 20 years. She is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses due to their meager financial resources. She is married to a man whose name is M. M., and he is a delivery man by profession. He delivers various items, specially fruits & vegetables, from one place to another.

Rahmat baji is the mother of six children: three boys and three girls. Her first two sons work in a workshop where they repair motorbikes and earn money on a monthly basis. Her younger son is a mason by trade. Her daughters stay home and don’t have jobs.

Rahmat baji is a very responsible lady. She shares the financial burden of her husband by preparing embroidered dresses. She collects order from her relatives and her neighbors. She charges US$ 3 per embroidered dress. She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because their old cart has become worn out.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Sheema baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal-selling business. Shakeela Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy electric wire to sell. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shamim Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.en:
Abdujalil is 60 years old. He lives with his wife and a son. For more than 6 years, he has been involved in agricultural activities. He hires workers to work the land and gets help from his family with handling the money produced from the sales. 

Lately, Abdujalil has expanded into raising livestock, which he also sells. He buys young cattle and cows, and when they are grown and heavy, he sells them. This is the first time that Abdujalil has requested a loan from IMON International. He has good references from his neighbors who consider him a responsible person. He requests this amount to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow wheat and onions on his land.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice Y. is single with four children and has received an education through senior high school.

She sells gari, beans and groundnuts in Moree market near Cape Coast, which she has done since 2005. The sacks she is standing beside contain some of the items she trades.

Beatrice uses her income to pay for school fees and will use the loan to purchase more gari, beans and groundnuts, from Techiman for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Buy more food to expand her business.

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married with two children. She sells women's clothing and has been in this business for seven years. She enjoys selling women's clothing and chooses good clothing that her clients like to wear. Olena has affordable prices and good variety, which allows her to attract and retain many clients.

Olena would like to borrow 7,000 UAH to add to the assortment of her goods. She would like to spend additional income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of women's clothing for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. is thirty years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. He says his son is yet to start school while the girl is currently in primary school. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Daniel is a hard-working young man. His wife is currently not working. He is a carpenter by profession. He makes furniture such as beds, stuffed chairs, wardrobes, etc. He has a shop in his community where he works. Daniel buys wood from the local sawmills and sometimes from the timber market. Daniel has been in business for five years now. He wants a loan to buy wood and other materials such as upholstery in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy materials for woodworking

loans.name: Essi Félicité

texts.fr:
Dame A. Essi Félicité est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Depuis 1982, elle a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits pharmaceutiques à Lomé. Ce commerce lui procure assez de revenu ce qui lui permet d’aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé. Ayant son lieu d’approvisionnement à Accra au Ghana, elle souhaite faire le ravitaillement afin de pouvoir bien vendre et ouvrir d’autres point de vente.
A cet effet, ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 3 cartons des produits antibiotiques et 2 cartons de vitamines et 1 carton de différents produits pharmaceutiques.
texts.en:
Ms A. Essi Félicité, age 33, is married and the mother of two. In 1982, she opened a store selling pharmaceutical products in Lomé. This business brings in enough income to enable her to help her husband cover family expenses. She once benefited from a WAGES loan and has repaid it. Her source of supplies is in Accra in Ghana, and she would like to stock up again in order to be able to do better in her sales and to open another sales outlet. In this regard, this second loan she's requesting will enable her to buy three boxes of antibiotics, two boxes of vitamins, and a box of different products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of goods

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a eu la bonne idée de commencer en 2007 le commerce des insecticides, herbicides et divers. Ce commerce marche bien pour lui et il vend beaucoup surtout en cette période de pluie, où les insectes et les moustiques dérangent énormément. La demande de ses clients est élevée, il voudrait agrandir son stock pour mieux vendre, il demande à WAGES un crédit pour acheter des insecticides, herbicides et d’autres  produits.
Il est marié et père de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2007, this gentleman had the good idea of beginning selling insecticides, herbicides, etc. The business is going well and he sells a lot, especially during the rainy season, where insects and flies are enormously bothersome. The demand of his customers is high, so he would like to expand his inventory to make more sales. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy insecticides, herbicides, and other products.

He is married and has 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of insecticides, herbicides and such

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada R. is currently in the business of selling various types of items at her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to sell. She is 22 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has one child and her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
43-year-old Nilo S. is a rice grower from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato Mindanao. He has three children. He started farming in 1988 using a three-hectare farm that he owned. According to him, his hopes and plans for the future are to buy farm equipment and send all his children to school. He likes the services of Community Economic Ventures Inc. because they are not just providing loans but training and insurance to people.

He is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI because he needs to buy sacks of fertilizers and chemicals. He is hoping that he will have a better yield compared to his previous experience.

Now, he enjoys joining in the CEVI cluster meetings and meeting other micro-entrepreneurs who wish to change their lives as well by having a business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna D., 57 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de BELFORT depuis 7 ans et demis. C'est une femme très dynamique et très travailleuse. Elle a bénéficié de 15 prêts au niveau de son Banc Villageois et les a toujours remboursés sans problème. Avec son crédit elle commercialise du miel et de l'huile de palme. Les bénéfices qui découlent de son activité lui permettent de participer aux dépenses quotidiennes et soins médicaux de la famille et d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: Renforcer son activité de commerce

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia S. is a 63-year-old single woman who lives in the town of Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental. She has a nephew who lives with her and helps her, and she has accepted the responsibility of sending him to school. Her most cherished dream is have her business earn enough so that she will be able to afford to send her nephew to college.

Emilia has always had an entrepreneurial spirit and an independent outlook on life. She is willing to invest her time, effort and money in a business, when she is sure that she will profit from it. She started earning a living by putting up a small carinderia, or luncheonette, adjacent to her house to serve meals to the locals. It became so popular that she was inspired to expand her services and began to offer coffee and snacks between meal times. In 2002, she became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could have access to additional capital to expand her business because, as she explains, "If you have a bigger investment [and] if you manage your business well, you will surely get a bigger return also." Over time, Emilia has saved up and bought properties as an investment to secure her future.

Aside from her luncheonette and cafeteria, Emilia earns additional income from two houses that she rents out. The smaller house is being rented by two students, while her bigger house is rented by a religious group. Emilia has been operating her carinderia and cafeteria for 32 years and she has been a landlord for only two. Her business nets her a profit of 4,000 pesos per month, which is enough for her living expenses, and she's been able to keep a good credit record with NWTF-Project Dungganon for the seven years that she's been a member. Her previous loan of 19,500 pesos for her 11th loan was fully repaid on time without any delays in any of her weekly installments.

Now for her 12th loan cycle, Emilia is again borrowing 19,500 pesos to add to her working capital to ensure the sustainability of her business.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Additonal capital for her business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina P. desde hace dieciocho años  trabaja en costura la cual es una herencia ya que su madre tenía su propio taller y al morir, ella continúo con el negocio. Ella desea mejorar el taller y seguir prosperando para ello invertirá el crédito en la compra de telas, hilos, zíper, botones entre otros materiales.

loans.use: comprar telas, hilos, botones....etc

loans.name: Salawu

texts.en:
Salawu is 50 years old and married with 6 children. He lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

Salawu owns a printing press where he does printing work. He is requesting for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more printing materials. He says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more printing materials

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 25-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon. Walid owns a barbershop. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Walid has requested a loan.
Walid is special in his work because he is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He is dependent on himself and does his best to improve his work. Walid decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. She sells porridge and groundnuts in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread. With her large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to raise a good income to support her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Berta Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora BERTA ALEJANDRINA V. D. R. tiene 65 años, vive en el distrito D. El Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS.
Ella  cuenta con estudios primarios completos, refiere que por motivos económicos empezó a trabajar desD. pequeña en el campo; tiene 5 hijos quienes no dependen económicamente D. ella.
BERTA se dedica a  la venta D. arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, gaseosas, golosinas, etc. en la tienda que tiene en su casa.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò arroz, azúcar, papas, menestras, leche, gaseosas, cerveza, golosinas, etc. para abastecer su tienda.
Actualmente con su próximo crèdito D. 1,800.00 nuevos soles comprará cajas D. gaseosas y cerveza al por mayor, arroz, azúcar , aceite, papas, menestras, fideos, golosinas, etc.  para abastecer sus tienda y así poder tenerla bien surtida.
Ella sueña con ampliar su tienda y tener un bar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Berta Alejandrina V. D. Rodriguez is 65 and lives in the El Porvenir district of Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Community Bank Semillitas Creativas [Creative Little Seeds]. She studied through primary school, but relates that for economic reasons she began to work in the fields from a young age. She has 5 children, who do not depend on her financially. Berta works selling rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks and candies in the store that she runs from her home. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles, she bought rice, sugar, potatoes, beans, noodles, candies and other items. Now, with her next loan of 1800 Peruvian soles she will buy wholesale cases of soft drinks and beer, rice, sugar, cooking oils, potatoes, beans, noodles, candies and more to proviD. for her store and have it well-stocked. Her dream is to expand her store and have a bar.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy wholesale cases of soft drinks and beer, rice, sugar, cooking oils, potatoes, beans, noodles, candies, etc.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros S. is 44 years old. She owns a medium-sized piece of land, which she inherited from her grandparents. She earns a living from this land, on which she grows rice and vegetable crops to sell. Her husband helps her with the planting of the crops. He is also skilled in building wooden houses. Recently, someone has hired him to construct a house, but her husband does not have the tools and materials to provide this service. Ros S. has applied for a loan to buy these necessary articles for her husband's work. She will use the rest of the loan to grow her crops.

Ros S. has four children, two of whom are married while the others are single. One grown daughter works, sewing clothes.

loans.use: To buy tools and materials.

loans.name: Tusuubira Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en: Yayeli K. is the leader of her loan group in Lugazi. She is divorced from her husband, with five children all still in school as she takes care of her other siblings. She is a business lady dealing in the sale of agricultural produce, although sometimes she is faced with the scarcity of the produce to sell due to the ever changing seasons. She says that she has found great value in her loans because they have enabled her to have enough stock as well as having quality produce to sell. She hopes to become a wholesaler in future so that she can supply to fellow traders as well as build a house for her children for comfort. Yayeli needs a loan to be able to buy more matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes, and greens for resale.

loans.use: To buy more matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes and greens for resale.

loans.name: Radika

texts.en:
Mrs. Radhika N. is a grocery storekeeper in the village of Khokhana-Dobato. She opened her grocery shop a few years ago to improve the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods in her shop. She spends her income on household expenses. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 20,000 to invest in her shop.
Mrs. N. lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Gobardhan N., went to a foreign country to work. Both her sons are now working.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods

loans.name: Pit

texts.en: Pit D., aged 26, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has two children, one of whom studies at the local primary school. Since 2007, D. has had a business sewing traditional clothes, and earns approximately $2 USD in revenue per day. Her husband is a farmer. He plants various kinds of vegetables to sell to new and existing customers at the market, and earns an income of $3 USD per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have started these businesses, so they are now requesting a loan to expand their businesses. D. is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more vegetables for sale. This is her first loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to grow more vegetables

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma, 50, requested a loan of 15,000 PHP for her bakery business. She has been a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., since 2008. Now she has requested additional capital to operate her business. She has businesses also in rice farming and motorcycle transport for passengers. She is the mother of two children. The loan will be used to buy ingredients for the bread and fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for baking bread, and also to purchase fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Amanda Cristina

texts.es:
Amanda tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo menor de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el sector Matriz Comunidad del distrito de Pacora, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la compra y venta de cerdos y aves de corral. Ella compra los animales para criarlos y engordarlos, luego los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde vive. Este negocio le provee de ingresos económicos que utiliza en la educación y mantenimiento de su hijo, además de apoyar en los gastos familiares.

Amanda desea ampliar su negocio para captar mas ingresos y seguir sacando adelante a su menor hijo, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en la compra de alimento balanceado para mejorar la calidad de los animales que comercializa.

Amanda es una mujer luchadora y que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de su condición de madre soltera. Sus familiares y conocidos la consideran una persona de confianza y muy entregada a las labores que realiza.
texts.en:
Amanda, age 34, is a single mother with a young son. She lives with her parents in the Matriz Comunidad sector of the Pacora district, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For two years, she has been engaged in the purchase and sale of pigs and poultry. She buys the animals in order to raise and fatten them, and then she offers them for sale to merchants who come into the area where she lives. This business has provided her with income which she uses for the education and care of her son. In addition, she helps with the family expenses.

Amanda wants to enlarge her business in order to obtain more income and continue moving forward for her young son. That’s why she is applying for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 600 new soles that she plans to use to purchase balanced feed for improving the quality of the animals that she sells.

Amanda is a hardworking woman who has been able to get ahead in spite of her status as a single mother. Her family and friends consider her a trustworthy person who is very dedicated to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of balanced feed  for imrpoving the condition of animals she sells.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura R. is 41 years old and widowed. She has four children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling tea on the street in the evening, and is requesting a loan to stock more sugar and milk to make tea to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more sugar and milk to make tea to sell

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Nazareth  se caracteriza porque esta integrado por personas que buscan la superación de su núcleo familiar así como también forman parte de comitivas que realizan proyectos en pro-desarrollo de la comunidad, los integrantes del grupo solidario Nazareth en su mayoría se dedican al comercio tales como venta de ropa, venta de granos básicos y venta de verduras. Dos de ellas se dedican a la compra y venta de ganado.

Han solicitado un crédito en ASDIR para poder Recapitalizar sus negocios, solicitaron montos deacuerdo a su capacidad de pago. En el grupo se puede distinguir la cordialidad y la solidaridad para con cada uno de los integrantes. Son personas del área rural de Momostenango y que gracias al entusiasmo y optimismo han mejorado sus condiciones, cuentan con luz, agua potable, carreteras en buen estado, centros de Espiritualidad, escuelas, puesto de salud, lo ideal y necesario para conformar un grupo solidario.
texts.en:
The individuals that make up the Nazareth Solidarity Group are known for their desire to succeed on behalf of their families. They also participate in committees that oversee development projects in their community. The members of the Nazareth Solidarity Group are involved in businesses selling products such as clothing, basic grains, and vegetables. Two of the members engage in buying and selling livestock.

They have requested a loan from Asociación ASDIR so that they can recapitalize their businesses. The amounts they have requested are based on their ability to repay. This group has distinguished itself for its cordiality and the solidarity among each of the members. They are from the rural area of Momostenango and have improved their conditions thanks to their enthusiasm and optimism. Their community now has electricity, potable water, roads in good condition, spiritual centers, schools, and health clinics. The members have everything they need to form their solidarity group.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es: Obdulia tiene 63 años, ella vive sola en su casa propia, tiene dos hijos, que ya son mayores e independientes, pero de vez en cuando la visitan. Ella tiene un Bazar y librería a la vez, negocio al que se dedica desde hace 9 años, resultándole muy productivo para ella. El no tener competencia cercana, le dio mucha ventaja para captar clientes. Disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza, ya que es muy tranquilo y puede realizarlo desde la comodidad de su hogar pudiéndose dedicar también a las labores de su hogar.  Hay momentos en que el trabajo les es pesado, debido a que tiene que abastecerse de mercadería y tiene que ir a uno de los mercados mayor concurrido para comprar al por mayor sus productos, lo que al final debe cargar grandes bolsas y cajas. Pero las ganas de sacar adelante su negocio hace que le de fuerzas para seguir trabajando. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y asegura que será muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su bazar y librería.
texts.en:
Obdulia is 63 years old, and lives alone in her own house. She has 2 children; they are adult and independent but at times they visit her. She has a shop/bookstore, a business that she has been working in for 9 years, and which has been very productive for her. She does not have competition close by, which gives her a good advantage in attracting customers. She enjoys her work very much, since it is tranquil, and she can carry it out from the comfort of her home. This allows her also to take care of the household chores. There are moments when the work is difficult, due to the fact that to restock her store with merchandise she must go to one of the very busy wholesale markets to buy her products, and then carry them back in large bags and boxes. But her desire to get ahead with her business gives her the strength to continue working. This is her first loan with MFP, and she assures us that she will be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan that she requests she will buy a larger quantity of merchandise to stock her shop and bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: Luis Humberto D. F. de 50 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a su único hijo. Luis se dedica a la elaboración de ollas hechas de aluminio, las cuales elabora en su casa y vende de forma ambulante por el parque Central de Cojutepeque y en el mercado, así mismo elabora un número determinado el cual elaborar con pedidos previos, esta es una forma muy artesanal de elaborar ollas, ya que Luis las elabora y las pinta.  Desde hace 20 años que se dedica al mismo oficio lo que ha logrado convertirlo en todo un experto en el trabajo que realiza por lo que cuenta con varios clientes quienes hace pedidos de varias unidades para comercializar en otros puestos. Luis solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de aluminio y pintura con el fin de poder elaborar más ollas y cubrir más la demanda que posee. La venta de este productos ha sido muy estable durante todos esto años lo que ha permitido salir adelante y que incentiva a Luis a querer invertir aún más el.
texts.en:
Luis Humberto D. is 50 years old and resides in Cojutepeque, which is located in the Department of Cuscatlán. He lives with his wife, who is in charge of the household chores, and their only child. Luis manufactures aluminum pots at his house and sells them as a street vendor in the central park of Cojutepeque and at the market. He produces a set number of pots based on previous orders. His process for making pots is labor intensive because he has to produce them by hand and then paint them.

Luis has been dedicated to his business for 20 years and has managed to become an expert at his job. He has several customers who place orders for multiple units to sell at other locations. Luis is requesting a loan so that he can buy a large quantity of aluminum and paint so that he can produce more pots and meet the increasing demand. The sales of his products have been very stable throughout the years, which has permitted him to get ahead and encouraged him to invest further in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase aluminum & paint for making pots

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Amaan Mai's Group

texts.en:
Amaan Mai is a resident of a small city in Pakistan called Vehari where she lives in a brick house with her husband and four children. Her family’s financial condition was not good and that’s why her older son had to leave his studies and start work. This helped his younger sisters to continue their education.

Amaan Mai’s husband owns a grocery store and Amaan Mai works with him there. The two of them work in shifts: Amaan Mai does her duty in the morning and her husband works the rest of the day. In this way both work very hard to earn a living for their family.

Amaan Mai and her husband want to expand their business by adding more grocery items to their shop. This will help them increase their sales and their income.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her grocery store

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie was born in 1957 and is married with five children. She owns a business selling milk and cakes.   Before having this business, Venantie was a farmer but she could not earn much money doing that. Venantie employs two people from her community. Venantie works every day from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening. 

Venantie is now requesting a loan from Kiva Lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing a lot of milk and other products needed by her customers. With this loan she will be able to earn more profit which will be used in the expansion of her business.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Mataiumu

texts.en:
Mataiumu L. is 42 years old. She is married and has 7 children (ages 8 - 25).  She owns a business planting, harvesting, and selling a variety of vegetables. Mataiumu has 4 years of experience in this business.  

Mataiumu needs a loan of 2000 WST to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2007, Mataiumu joined SPBD. This is her 7th loan from SPBD. SPBD's loans are Mataiumu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. To receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD, please join SPBD's lending team at  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Ma. Luisa M. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has two children, aged 5 and 2. She grows hogs for fattening and sale. She has been doing this for more than six years already. She was also able to put up a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells sugar, soy sauce and other items her neighbors usually look for daily. Her family also owns a rice farm that her husband manages. She helps sell their harvest at their store and at their town's market. One of Luisa's goals right now is to save for her children's education.

Ma. Luisa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Luisa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ma. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 8000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Ma. Luisa from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jibarbu

texts.en: Jibarbu I. is a resident of Tashkomur, a small town in the Jalalabad region. She is 55 and a widow with two children: the older one is at school and the second is not yet attending. Seventeen years ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms, Jibarbu began to sell goods at the local market. Then she invested money to start building a big store. Now, half of the building she leases out, and the second half she uses to sell her own goods. She sells a variety of goods, such as clothes, shoes, curtains and dishes. With the money received from the loan Jibarbu wants to purchase different styles of carpet, school uniforms, and other clothes to sell everything that in her store. In the future she wants to expand her business and start reconstruction of her store. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms and different styles of carpet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, peppers, fish, meat, onions, tomatoes, etc

loans.name: Manuel Jesus

texts.es: Juan Manuel es un padre de familia, por lo que a pesar de tener 73 años, todavía tiene el espíritu de salir adelante. Inició desde hace 7 años y desde entonces solo descansa los domingos  y tiene un horario de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general, pues actualmente ha tenido pedidos de gran variedad de productos, pues  en la actualidad solicita su crédito para la compra de ropa, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas entre otras cosas. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is a family man. Although he is 73 years old, he still wishes to make progress in life. He started work when he was seven years old, and even now only takes Sundays off. He works from 7am to 6pm selling a variety of merchandise. Currently he has orders for a wide range of goods so he is seeking a loan to buy clothing, footwear, cosmetics, sheets etc. His greatest wish is to expand his business so that he can improved his family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Put bars on the front of his house

loans.name: Uth

texts.en:
Mrs. Uth L. is 50 years old and her husband, Vorn Srin, is 52. They work from home making furniture which they also sell. Most of their output consists of beds and tables which they accumulate and sell as sets. Their furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. The couple has five children, two of whom are in school and who, when school ends for the day, help their parents make furniture. The three remaining are married and live in their new house. 

Mrs. Uth L. said that she has difficulty in transporting her finished products to her clients when she receives orders.  So Mrs. Uth L. would like to borrow a loan to purchase a horse and cart to deliver items to customers.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart for delivering her items to customers

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin O. is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. She is 18 years old and married. To make a living, Jasmin raises hogs to sell. Jasmin has been engaged in her business for one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jasmin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jasmin is requesting her first loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used for hog raising.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For hog raising

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es un padre D. familia D. 36 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Campiña Compuerta Marcelo del distrito D. Illimo, una distrito agrícoL. que se encuentra situado en L. provincia D. Lambayeque, a cuarenta y cinco minutos D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a L. agricultura desD. que era más joven. Por un lado cría animales menores, especialmente ovejas, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta D. granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan L. zona en donD. resiD.. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícoL. en los diversos campos D. cultivo D. L. zona.

Santiago desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento para ampliar su negocio, adicionalmente desea realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales, para realizar su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1800 nuevos soles.

Santiago es una persona emprendedora y que tiene muchas ganas D. salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y poder otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Santiago is 36 years old, and a father.  He lives with his wife and children in the Campiña Compuerta Marcelo sector, which is part of the Illimo district, an agricultural district in the province of Lambayeque, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has worked in agriculture since a young age.  Currently he raises young animals, especially sheep, in pens located near his home.  He feeds them grain and wild grass until they are grown, at which point he offers them for sell to the dealers who frequent the area where he lives.  He also works as a laborer in local fields.

Santiago would like to expand his business by purchasing more animals and feed.  He would also like to make some improvements to his corrals.  For this reason, he has requested a loan of 1,800 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Santiago is an entrepreneur with a strong desire for success.  His greatest wish is to grow his business and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase young animals and feed for an animal raising and sales business

loans.name: Loma Bonita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama LOMA BONITA, porque así se llama una de las integrantes del grupo. Está ubicado en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por  11  integrantes. 

Teresa García es integrante del grupo. Tiene 61 años, estudió 2° año de primaria, es comerciante y ya no tiene dependientes económicos.  Ella se dedica a vender artículos para el hogar y desayunos. Solicita el préstamo para surtirse más en mercancía. Sus clientes vecinas de la misma comunidad y conocidas. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente ilusionada.   Quiere este crédito para poder hacer crecer sus ventas en esta temporada y tener más ingresos personales.   También espera poder apoyar en los ingresos de su hogar y de manera personal para poder ayudarse a ella.
texts.en:
This group is called Loma Bonita because it is the nickname of one of the members.  It is located in the state of Mexico, and is made up of 11 members.

Teresa García is a member of the group.  She is 61 years old, and finished grade two in elementary school.  She is a merchant, and no longer has any financial dependents.  Teresa works selling domestic goods and breakfast foods.  She is requesting the loan in order to provide herself with more merchandise.  Her clients are neighbours in her community and her acquaintances.  At the time of requesting this loan, she was very hopeful and excited. She would like this loan in order to be able to increase her sales during this season and to have a higher personal income.  She also hopes to be able to support herself by her household income and in her own way, so that she can help herself.

loans.use: To invest in her business during this sales season.

loans.name: Juan Elias

texts.es:
Juan Elias V. N. tiene 39 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo,  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Juan Elias V. N. is 39 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of San Miguel in the province of Bolívar.  He has five children.

The members of the community bank Yagui Grande are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office in the canton of San Miguel.  This group is made up of short-cycle farmers who have a lot of experience growing corn and potatoes.

Juan is a farmer who grows corn and potatoes.  He purchases his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them at the market in San Miguel on Thursdays.

He is asking for this loan to purchase compost and fertilizers for his corn and potato crops.  This loan will make him able to meet his needs financially.  He faces challenges like plagues, sickness, and weather changes.  His dream is to purchase land.

He likes to dance.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for corn and potato crops

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita H. is from the village of Kilikili, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Clarita is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Clarita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Clarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk food & canned goods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Clarita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like junk food & canned goods

loans.name: Dinar Isakova's Group

texts.en:
Dinar I. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 51 and married to a cattle breeder. Together they bring up two sons: the elder is a removal man who earns 5,000 KGS per month and the younger son studies at school. Dinar herself earns money by selling agricultural products. She started this activity five years ago with an initial investment of 8,000 KGS, and now she earns 15,000 KGS per month. With this loan, Dinar wants to purchase carrots, potatoes and onions for sale. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land and build a house there.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SUMAC SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Florentina; ella tiene 39 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias, entre otros más la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo con este negocio y le gusta ya que le trae muchas satisfacciones una de ellas es que puede estar más tiempo con sus hijos sin necesidad de tener un horario, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio y así poder tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SUMAC SONCCO Communal Bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

She is Mrs. Florentina. She is 39, married, and has 2 children. She sells beauty products such as creams, perfumes and cologne, among other items. She has had this business for some time now and she likes it because there are many good things about it. For one, she gets to spend more time with her children without having a schedule. She is a very happy person with a great desire to succeed.

Florentina is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh T. D. is 53 years old with 2 children. She is a farmer who grows rice, vegetables, and flowers in a paddy of 2,800 square meters. Her agricultural products are of good quality so they are sold at the best price. This provides her with a good income to cover her family's living expenses.

She joined Seda credit program in 2004, and has really made full use of the loans to expand her business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy more kinds of small trees and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy more kind of trees and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mob

texts.en:
Mob S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells food, earning an income of $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $20 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario es socia del banco comunal Carmen Cabrejos del Distrito calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos tiene con sus respectivas familias.
Hace diez años que pertenece a la familia de Manuela Ramos y tiene su negocio de venta de productos por catálogo, tiene una vitrina donde exhibe todos sus productos y puede estar a la vista de todos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza como cosméticos y perfumes; 2 rímel para pestaña, 3 cuartetos de sombra, 2 rubor compacto, 2 lociones, 1 champú, 1 enjuague, 2 cremas para peinar, 1 coloración en crema permanente, 2 protectores solares, 4 colonias para niños, 2 jabones liquido, 2 talcos 3 lápiz delineadores para ojos.2 brillo labial, 2delineadores retráctil para ojos, 2 mascarillas purificantes cutis mixto, 2 desmaquillador, 2 gel desmaquillador para ojos y labios, gel anti-bolsas y ojeras.
Sus préstamos son invertidos en su negocio porque es la fuente de ingreso y por eso tiene que estar bien surtido, generalmente tiene clientes a quienes vende a crédito y que van pagándole semanalmente, mensual o diario, según el acuerdo al que lleguen.
Manuela Ramos le dio la oportunidad y la está aprovechando bien, quiere seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario is a member of the "Carmen Cabrejos" communal bank in the Calleria District in the department of Ucayali.  She is 66 years old, married and has four children who all have their own families.

For ten years she has belonged to the Manuela Ramos group, selling products through catalogue.  She also has a display case to exhibit her products for all to see.

With the new 3,000 PEN loan she plans to buy beauty products such as cosmetics and perfume: 2 mascaras, 3 eyeshadow sets, 2 compact blush-ons, 2 lotions, 1 shampoo, 1 conditioner, 2 hair creams, 1 permanent hair color, 2 sunscreens, 4 children's cologne, 2 liquid soaps, 2 talcum powders, 3 eyeliners, 2 lip glosses, 2 retractile eyeliners, 2 purifying facial masks for mixed skin, 2 makeup removers, 2 eye and lip makeup remover gel, anti-puffiness eye gel.

She invests her loans in her business since this is her source of income and she needs to keep it well stocked.  Generally she sells to customers on a credit basis and they pay her weekly, monthly or daily, depending on the terms of agreement.

Manuela Ramos gave her this opportunity and she is taking full advantage of it.  She wants to conintue working to help her family.

loans.use: To buy beauty products such as cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy S. is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 4 each per day. Her husband is a tuk-tuk driver, earning an income of USD 7 each per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend USD 90 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband, to improve his business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 45 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Enrique de 54 años, quien es agricultor, y de su última hija, menor de edad, de 5 hijos que tiene pues el resto ya son mayores y viven independientes. Desde muy joven se dedica a las labores agrícolas, y en la actualidad siembra junto a su esposo papas, arvejas, y flores de gladiolos. Dice que las faenas agrícolas son tediosas, pues es una constante vigilancia a cada planta para que la plaga de insectos no perjudique a sus plantaciones. Julia sabe que si se le brinda el cuidado adecuado a los cultivos echándoles fertilizantes y abono se puede esperar una buena producción; además el tiempo que tiene sembrando le ha hecho aprender las técnicas necesarias para que toda la cosecha sea recogida sin problemas. Además le gusta mucho su labor pues la realiza en compañía de su esposo y siempre juntos se esfuerzan por sembrar, para luego de unos meses vender todo a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad, y de las ventas obtienen regulares ganancias que les permiten vivir cómodamente con su hija.
