He is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 000 Francs CFA to buy and repair vehicles and to resell them. This would increase his buying power and allow him to better meet his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicles to fix and resale.

loans.name: Glenou Kossi

texts.en: Mr. Glenou A. is 53 years old and married to a hairdresser. They have one child. He works as an electrician visiting his clients as they need him, which he’s done since 2003. He is a skilled electrician with experience taking loans from WAGES. This will be his fourth loan, this time in the amount of 400,000 CFA that he’ll use to purchase materials he uses to fix electronics.

loans.use: materials for electronics repair

loans.name: Fetuao

texts.en:
Fetuao S. is 41 and married with seven children.  She owns a business baking bread, scones and buns.  Fetuao has three years of experience in this business.  Fetuao needs a loan of WST$1300 to purchase additional cooking ingredients.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $42 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Fetuao joined SPBD.  This is her third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fetuao's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii and to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn E., 45 years old and married, is from the town of Banga where she owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for fattening and sale. Engaged in her business for over three years, she also helps her husband maintain their farm and sell their harvest. She says she always prays for good health for her and her husband.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new one, her second, of 6000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and additional piglets. Jocelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Aibek

texts.en:
Aibek M. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town in southern Kyrgyzstan.  He is 26 years old and married. Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 1,000 KGS, he started to breed cattle. Selling some cattle after fattening, he makes 5,000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for him to save money and celebrate his wedding.  

With money received from the loan Aibek wants to purchase six farm animals to resell them after fattening. In the future he plans to increase the number of cattle and start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only micro-finance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase six farm animals

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet has a mixed farm that produces maize, beans, sorghum, milk and eggs, all of which she sells at a local market. She has been practising mixed farming  in Nyamira, Western Kenya for the last 18 years. She is a full-time farmer and depends on the income from her farming to provide for her family's basic needs.

Linet has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She plans to use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees and build a house. Her biggest challenges have been diseases which attack her poultry and too much rainfall which destroys her crops. She hopes to open a wholesale store in the future. 

Linet is 38 years old. She is a widowed mother of 4 children who are between the ages of 6 and 20. Two of the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de venta de artesanías en las ferias que se realizan en los diferentes distritos de Urubamba, por medio de este pequeño negocio puede sacar adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere tener un local para vender la. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  artesanía como sombreros, mantas y muñecas. 

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to the “Mainique” communal bank. The bank is located in the Mainique district in the Urubamba province and Cusco department. Hilda is a 30 year old single mother with one son. She alternates her daily activities with her work selling handicrafts at fairs in the different districts of Urubamba. Through this small business she can help her son get ahead. She wants to have a store to sell the handicrafts. Hilda requests the loan to purchase handicrafts such as sombreros, blankets, and dolls. Hilda is thankful to those who form part of this dream through the loan, and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts such as sombreros, blankets, and dolls

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del carmen, es soltera solo vive con su mama, ella mantiene los gastos de la casa, ella trabaja en una tienda, en el departamento de ventas. Con las lluvias que han caído aquí en la cuidad se daño el techo de su vivienda, es por eso que esta solicitando este crédito para mandarlo reparar, ya que se pronostican lluvias muy intensas y teme por la seguridad de ella y su madre.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is single and lives only with her mother. She takes care of the household expenses. She works in the sales department of a store. The roof of her home has been damaged by the rains that have fallen here in the city. So, she is requesting a loan to have it repaired, as very heavy rains are predicted to fall and she fears for her and her mother's safety.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair the roof on her home

loans.name: Dellie

texts.en:
Dellie P. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 48 years old. Dellie is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Dellie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling junk & other waste material for local businesses and community members. Dellie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Dellie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dellie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Dellie is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Dellie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida B. is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Minlasag, a part of the municipality of Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte province on the western Mindanao islands. Lida raises hogs to sell. She has been in business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lida joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC that was used as additional working capital for the business. Lida is requesting a new loan, her eighth from PMPC, of 7,000 PHP that will be used to purchase pig feed.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Michille

texts.en:
Michille U. is from the city of Sta Cruz, Tangub City. She is 23 years old. Michille is single. To make a living, Michille owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily snacks. Michille has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Michille joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michille is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be Michille's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Madaid

texts.es: Madaid tiene 20 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la propiedad de sus padres. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, negocio que acondiciono en su casa y cuyo capital que tenía lo invirtió en los productos para implementar su tienda, además se asocio con su mama y juntas se turnan el trabajo, siendo el medio día en que Madaid atiende a sus clientes, para luego irse a sus clases. Con el pasar del tiempo ha visto que su negocio ha ido creciendo, porque  siempre trata de ofrecer productos con precios módicos al alcance de la economía del cliente y aunque  no genera muchas ganancias siempre trata de asegurarse  lo ingresos  surtiendo sus productos en variedad. Por tal razón su deseo a futuro es tener su propia tienda de abarrotes en una zona céntrica. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo, pues sabe que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería, así como pagar la compra de una computadora portátil que le servirá en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Madaid is 20 years old and lives with her parents and siblings in a house they own. For the past year she has been in the business of selling essential groceries from home, an activity she started with her own money. In order to be able to attend school, she takes turn with her mother tending to the store. With her clientele's needs in mind, she has been able to grow her business by offering a great variety of products at reasonable prices.

She hopes to be able to move her grocery store to a more central location one day. This is her first loan with MFP and she's thankful for the financial support. She is also grateful to all the people who will be funding her loan, since it will be very useful in the further development of her business. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of more merchandise for her store as well as a laptop computer to help with her studies.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell at her home-based store and a laptop computer for school work

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely, de 49 años, está casada con José, de 54 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos; todos ellos mayores de edad. Ahora ella vive sola con su esposo en unión familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. En la localidad de San Pedro, donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la artesanía, encontramos a Nely, una mujer emprendedora, que hace 20 años que se dedica a la elaboración de tapices, mantas de lana, ponchos y demás tejidos a base de lana sintética y de algodón. Con el tiempo, dedicación y trabajo, logró abrir un puesto en la casa del artesano, que queda en la zona céntrica de la ciudad de Huancayo, punto de encuentro de los turistas que visitan el valle del Mantaro. Pero como mujer emprendedora ella, también tiene un carro, que hace trasporte público en las rutas de Tarma – Lima. Ahora Nely, está planeando viajar a diferentes ferias del país, donde puede expander su negocio. Esté es el primer crédito con MFP, y espera no defraudar el apoyo y confianza que le brinda su banco comunal, por ello se compromete en seguir adelante con los pagos puntuales. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de artesanía, para surtir su tienda en la ciudad de Huancayo.
texts.en:
Nely, 49, is married to  José, 54, and they have 3 adult children.  She now lives alone with her husband in their own house, located in the area of San Pedro de Cajas.  In this area of San Pedro, where most of the people work in handicrafts, we find Nely, an enterprising woman who has for the last 20 years worked making mats, wool capes, ponchos and other knit products using synthetic wool and cotton.
With time, dedication, and work, she has been able to open a stand in the “Casa del artesano” (Arts and crafts center) located in central Huancayo.  This is where many tourists come who visit the valley of Mantaro.
But since she's an entrepreneur, she also has a car which she uses to transport people on the route Tarma-Lima.  Now Nely is planning to travel to different markets in the country where she will be able to expand her business.  This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes not to disappoint the support and confidence offered her by the communal bank and that is why she promises to be punctual with the payments.  She will buy handicrafts to supply her store in the city of Huancayo with the loan.

loans.use: To buy handicraft items to supply her store

loans.name: Djiguiya   (L’Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les fruits et légumes, les habillements,  les céréales, la petite restauration etc. 
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 6 ans. Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Fatoumata S. est un membre du groupe Djiguiya qui vend des sandwiches.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, chaque jour des miches de pain, de la viande et tous les ingrédients nécessaires pour la préparation du sandwich. Elle achète son pain à la boulangerie, la viande et les ingrédients sont achetés au grand marché de Koutiala. Elle vend le sandwich en face de l’école du quartier Koko, au comptant sur une table bien propre qui attire les élèves à la recréation et bien d’autres gens du voisinage. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguiya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Fatoumata S. compte réaliser 130 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group of women who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. On average they are 40 years old, are married and have at least 5 children.

This group of women sells various products such as fruits and vegetables, clothes, cereals, snacks, etc. To increase their activity, 6 years ago they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their fourteenth group loan and all previous loans have been properly repaid. 

Fatoumata S. is a member of the Djiguiya group and sells sandwiches. She plans to use her loan to buy bread, meat and other ingredients needed for sandwiches each day. She buys her bread from the bakery, meat and other ingredients are purchased at the grand market in Koutiala. Fatoumata sells her sandwiches for cash opposite the Koko neighborhood school, using a clean table to attract students at recess as well as many other people form the area. 

While other members of the Djiguiya group plan to make an average profit of 115,000 CFA francs each during this period, Fatoumata plans to make 130,000 CFA francs. Besides repaying loans, the women use part of the income to meet their current household expenses.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for sandwiches

loans.name: Peter Mwangi

texts.en:
Peter has been operating his food stall in Naivasha town for the last six years.  He is 25 years old and is married to Milka Wanjiku. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend.   This will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 20,000 in full and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy cooking oil and flour in bulk.

In the future, Peter hopes to expand his food stall so he can serve many customers at the same time.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and flour in bulk

loans.name: Eshrat's Group

texts.en:
Eshrat comes from Pakpattan, a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for over 5 years. She is a working lady and is involved in making artificial flowers. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She takes orders from different gift shops and supplies them with finished goods to earn a good income for her family.  

Her husband’s name is M. I. and he operates a grocery shop in the market. His shop is located in the busiest market where he deals with a good number of customers every day. Eshrat is the mother of three sons and two daughters. All of them are illiterate and stay at home. Eshrat couldn’t provide them with education due to poor financial conditions. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put in his shop to increase his sales. Eshrat is hopeful that after putting more stock in his shop, her husband will be able to offer a greater variety of products to his customers and make more income which will result in a better standard of living for her family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In her previous loan year, she established a good credit record and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady  raising her hand is Eshrat.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa M. is 68 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the town of Tagbilaran. Generosa has a small sari-sari store where she sells chorizo and other products. She also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them in the market. Generosa does her best to improve her business.

Generosa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Generosa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Generosa is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase pig feed and additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and additional products to sell

loans.name: Baya

texts.en:
Baya is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past one year, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Baya faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of fish, cooking oil and salts. She decided to work with Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fish, cooking oil and salts

loans.name: Mariposas De Barrio Alto Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Mariposas de barrio alto y tiene este nombre porque son grandes artistas de la supervivencia tras sus espectaculares colores, formas, y esconden talentos insospechados; barrio alto por  el lugar de donde se reúnen, se ubica en el Estado de Hidalgo. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes es la primera vez que realiza un crédito. La señora Rosa Aide S. T. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 36 años, estudio el la secundaria, y tiene en total 2 hijas mujeres. Ella vende ropa que inicio desde hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mercancía para agrandar su  negocio. Los clientes dicen que les agrada comprar con ella porque  la ropa es de buena calidad y barata, la señora es amable y muy alegre. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta y con muchas ganas de trabajar, ya que solicito el crédito para comprar más mercancia y sus clientes tengan de donde escoger y para seguir brindando un buen servicio, y a su vez lograr su sueño de poner un local y así apoyar a los gastos de su familia pra brindarles una mejor vida de calidad.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Mariposas de Barrio Alto' (Butterflies of Barrio Alto).  The 'butterflies' part of the name was chosen because the group's members are great survival artists behind their spectacular colors and shapes, and they hide unexpected talents.  'Barrio Alto' is the name of the place where the group meets.  The group is located in the State of Hidalgo.

This group has 11 members and this is the first time that they have taken out a loan.  Rosa Aide S. T. is a member of the group.  She is 36 years old, has a high school level of education, and has two daughters.  She started selling clothes two years ago.

Rosa is requesting this loan to buy merchandise in order to expand her business.  Her customers say that they like to buy from her because the clothes she offers are good quality and also cheap.  Rosa is a kind and very cheerful lady.  At the moment of requesting this loan, she is feeling happy and very keen to work.  She requested her loan to buy more merchandise so that her customers would have more choice and so that she could continue providing them with a good service.  She also wants to fulfil her dream of setting up her own premises and supporting her family's expenses in order to provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Rat

texts.en:
Rat S. is a 61-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province. She is married to Mr. Sokchea, age 41, who works with her in the farming business. She inherited the farmland from her grandmother, where she and her husband grow different kinds of crops. This is the time for plowing the dry-season rice field, but she doesn’t have the funds to plow her farmland yet. 

Because of this reason, Rat S. will use the loan to hire a few domestic laborers to plow on their farmland so she can start to grow her rice crop on time. 

The couple is blessed with six children, three of whom are single and work at a garment industry, while the other three are married and live in their own houses.

loans.use: to hire a few domestic laborers to plow their farmland.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: En la ciudad de Managua, El   Sr. Antonio González M., se dedica  arduamente a laborar como oficinista  dedicándose a esta labor desde hace quince años, es casado y con dos hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. Una de las necesidades que el  Sr. Antonio  atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que a tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora. Es por ese motivo que acude nuevamente a  ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento y hierro, Para realizar la mejora de  la vivienda por lo que va a construir un porche en su casa de habitación. Por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos. Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra, le proporcionara a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en: Antonio González M. has been an office worker in  Managua for the past fifteen years.  He is married and has two children that he needs to support and help develop.  One of his needs is to improve their living conditions since their house is in bad shape. He decided to start improving it and that is why he has again gone to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement and iron. Antonio is going to build a porch on his house as a means of improving it so that he can give his children better living conditions.  It’s important to note that by making these  improvements he will give his family a dignified home to live in and all the necessary conditions for their growth.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement and iron.

loans.name: Galo Alfredo

texts.es:
Galo de 59 años, es un hombre trabajador que vende y confecciona sandalias y zapatillas. Desde muy joven él comenzó con la confección de zapatillas para independizarse. Poco a poco a comercializado las zapatillas. 

Ahora trabaja como comerciante informal vendiendo las zapatillas y confeccionando las zapatillas. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con sus ventas y con elaboración de otros modelos de zapatillas. Para continuar con su negocio él quiere comprar materias para hacer mas zapatillas como pegamento, cuero, suelas etc.
texts.en: Galo, 59, is a hardworking man who makes and sells sandals and shoes. When he was very young he began making shoes to become independent. Little by little he has marketed his shoes. Now he works as an informal businessman making and selling shoes. He has many dreams with his sales and with making other shoe designs. In order to continue with his business, he wants to buy material such as glue, leather, and soles, to make more shoes.

loans.use: to purchase glue, leather, and soles.

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Mrs. Seun M. (pictured with her mother) is a widow. She has one son and two daughters. Two are in school and another one is still young. She produces soya milk and sells it in her village.

Seun lives with her mother on an Island in the Mekong River, about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She now wants to live in separate home, so she is asking for her first loan of $500 to add to her own money to put up the building.

loans.use: To add to her own money to build her own house to live in.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has three children.

Rahim has had a shop for selling furniture and household items since 2004. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting $2,500 to renovate his shop and to increase its purchase. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 40 years old. She is married and has four children. She sells charcoal to earn a living. She has been in the business for eight years.  She is able to provide for her family with the income she gets from her business. She hopes to expand her family in the future. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Bertha; tiene 54 años de edad; la socia es viuda y tiene 9 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comidas caseras típicas de esta región;  la asocia elabora sus comidas típicas y los vende en la plaza principal del poblado de Ocongate, la socia trabaja con otras compañeras socias del banco comunal y vecinas de trabajo;  la socia  suele preparar las comiditas caseras con previa anticipación para dar los últimos toques en la plaza principal, ellas coordinan los diferentes  platos con sus compañeras para que no tengan competencia, ellas se ponen de acuerdo y varían sus menús diarios; la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos tales como arroz, aceite, sal y otros ingredientes.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Sr. De Tayancani' Community Bank. The member lives in the Ocongate district in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.

The member, Bertha, is 54 years old. She is a widow and has nine children and she alternates her activities at home with the sale of typical home-cooked food of the region. The member makes her typical dishes and sells them in the main square of the Ocongate village. The member works with other women who are members of the community bank and working neighbors. The member prepares her dishes with prior notice and gives the final touches in the main square. She coordinates the different dishes with her colleagues so that they're not competing. They agree and vary their daily menus. The member wants the loan to invest in the purchase of inputs such as rice, oil, salt and other ingredients.

The member values and is infinitely thankful for the loan granted since it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. At the same time, she promises to make her payments at the stipulated deadlines.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of inputs like rice, oil, salt and other ingredients.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.  Cuenta con educación hasta 3ro de secundaria. 
Su préstamo anterior de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales domestico como ovinos, vacunos, etc., especialmente compró tres ovejas.  Desde hace un año que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000 soles comprará dos toritos para su engorde por dos meses  y su posterior venta en la localidad de Totorani e Ilave.
Su sueño es ser tejedora de chalinas, chullos, mantas y mejorar el ganado.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, el ahorro y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the community bank Virgen de Concepción, located in C.P. Ayrumas Carumas in the Acora district, in the province and department of Puno.  She is 42 years old, married, and has a school-aged child.  She went to school until the 3rd year of secondary school.

Her last loan was for 500 nuevos soles, and she invested it in her business buying and selling domestic animals, such as sheep, cattle, and others by purchasing three sheep.  She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year.

With this loan of 2000 nuevos soles, she will purchase two bulls that she will fatten for two months and then sell in Totorani and Ilave.

Her dream is to weave scarves, woolen hats, blankets, and improve her livestock.

The things she likes about the community bank are the ease of getting loans, the savings, and her profits.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls.

loans.name: Mavlon

texts.en: Mavlon owns a comfortable minivan and offers transportation services in Pendjikent city. Mavlon is a very careful, professional driver. He has rich experience working as a driver and has been working in the sphere of transportation services for five years. Mavlon is requesting a loan of 9,000 somoni to purchase new tire covers and other spare parts which he believes will provide extra safety for his passengers and will help him lessen his fuel costs. There are many passengers who travel on his itinerary and this makes his business very profitable and brings in a stable income. Mavlon is thinking about possibly buying a second van and starting a new scheduled route. We believe the reliability and responsibility that have characterized Mavlon will ensure the timely repayment of this loan. Mavlon is married with two children. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his minivan.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.ru:
Ярослав женат, у него есть сын Артем. Вся семья живет в небольшом городе Хуст, Западная Украина. Ярослав торгует запчастями к мопедам. Он к тому же сам устанавливает эти запчасти на мопеды по необходимости, а также ремонтирует скутеры. В своем бизнесе у Ярослава нет  конкуренции как таковой. Качественный товар пользуется спросом у определенной категории покупателей, есть своя клиентская база. Ярослав занимается бизнесом уже около 6 лет. Прибыль составляет около 5.000 гривен.   

Ярослав строит торговую точку на территории склада при входе на местный рынок. Он планирует использовать кредит КИВА в 10.000 гривен, чтобы открыть там новое торговое место и пополнить оборотные средства. Ярослав – искренний, открытый. Он финансово сознательный и всегда просчитывает расходы наперед. Ярослав планирует и дальше развивать свой бизнес и улучшать жилищные условия семьи на полученную прибыль. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Yaroslav is married and has a son named Artyom. The entire family lives in the small city of Hust in the Western Ukraine. Yaroslav trades in spare parts for mopeds. He installs these spare parts on mopeds himself, and he also repairs scooters. Yaroslav does not have any competition. A certain type of buyer, his client base, demands a quality product. Yaroslav has been in business for about six years. He makes about 5,000 hryvnias.   

Yaroslav is building a shop in a warehouse at the entrance to the local market.  He plans to use his Kiva credit of 10,000 hryvnia to open a new shop and fill it with inventory.  Yaroslav is a sincere, open man. He is financially conscious and always counts his expenses beforehand. Yaroslav plans to further develop his business and to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to open a new shop and fill it with inventory.

loans.name: Avelardo

texts.es: El joven Avelardo vive en un pueblo que se caracteriza por ser de clima frio templado donde hay muchas montañas con muchos arboles frutales,el tiene 20 años de edad, el es soltero, vende plantas de aguacate, el solicito su préstamo para comprar bolsas, abono y fertilizantes para sus plantas de aguacate, el inicio su negocio hace un año el terreno es propio aprendió entrando a trabajar en los viveros ahí le enseñaron a cultivar las plantas, le hecho muchas ganas a su trabajo para aprender todo lo relacionado a sembrar plantas en especial el aguacate, estas plantas se venden mucho ya que hay varias personas que tienen sus huertas de aguacate, su negocio es importante por las ganancias que le deja le permite seguir invirtiendo, el se siente orgulloso cuando vende todas sus plantas son de buena  la calidad, el trabaja con muchas ganas pone todo corazón y empeño en la siembra de las plantas su hermano le ayuda en el cultivo de las plantas de aguacate, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son las plagas, el clima, las eladadas de diciembre queman las plantas, sus sueños y esperanzas son vivir bien y que tenga mucha producción de plantas. El quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos y que sigan ayudando a las personas que quieren crecer en sus negocios y vivir mejor con sus familias".
texts.en: Young Avelardo lives in a town characterized by its cold temperate climate where there are many mountains with many fruit trees. He is 20 years old, single and sells avocado plants. He is requesting this loan to buy bags, manure and fertilizers for his avocado plants. He started his business a year ago on his own land. He learned by starting to work in nurseries, where he learned to cultivate the plants. He worked eagerly in order to learn everything related to growing plants, especially avocados. These plants sell a lot since there are various people that have avocado orchards. His business is important because of the profits that allow him to continue investing. He feels proud selling; all his plants are of good quality.  He works with much enthusiasm, putting his whole heart and all his effort into the cultivation of the plants. His brother helps him with the cultivation of the avocado plans. The challenges his business faces are the pests, climate and December frosts that burn the plants. His dreams and hopes are to live well and to have high production of his plants. He wants to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad “Thank you for your loans, and continue helping people that want to grow their business and live better with their families.”

loans.use: to buy bags, manure and fertilizers for his cultivation of avocado plants.

loans.name: Maria Clemencia

texts.es: Maria Clemencia.de 25 años ella se dedica a la crainza de cerdos y al cultivo de frijol,desde hace 4 años,ella nos cuenta que gracias a Dioa le a ido bien y sus siembras prosperan,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de abono para el cultivo de frijol y para la compra de animales y de la misma manera aunetar sus ganancias y prosperar en sus ventas tanto de frijol como de cerdos.
texts.en: Maria Clemencia.de 25 años ella se dedica a la crainza de cerdos y al cultivo de frijol,desde hace 4 años,ella nos cuenta que gracias a Dioa le a ido bien y sus siembras prosperan,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de abono para el cultivo de frijol y para la compra de animales y de la misma manera aunetar sus ganancias y prosperar en sus ventas tanto de frijol como de cerdos.

loans.use: Compra de abono para el cultivo de frijol y compra de cerdos para crianza.

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es:
Maritza, vive con sus padres, está soltera y se dedica a la administración de una tienda, en su negocio ofrece a los clientes artículos de primera necesidad, tiene un año de experiencia y lo atiende a tiempo completo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de la canasta básicas como frijol, azúcar, arroz, aceite, huevos y jabón, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar las ventas a los clientes, ya que tendrá surtido el negocio.
El objetivo de Maritza es crecer con su tienda, surtirla y algún día culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maritza lives with her parents.  She is single, and works managing a store.  Her business offers customers everyday items.  She has one year of experiences, and works here full-time.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of basic pantry items, such as beans, sugar, rice, oil, eggs and soap.  This purchase will help her improves sales to her customers, as she will have stocked up the business.

Maritza's goal is to grow her store, keep it stocked, and some day to finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, oil, eggs and soap for her store.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
Simeona nació en la provincia de La Convención en la ciudad de Quillabamba por la selva del Perú. Actualmente, Simeona tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y fruto de esta unión tiene un hijo. 

Simeona radica desde hace 19 años en la ciudad de Calca y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es ama de casa y vive de la pensión de su esposo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para la colegiatura de su hijo Wilfredo que es profesional en economía. 

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Simeona was born in the city of Quillabamba in La Convención Province, which is in the Peruvian jungle. She is 62 years old, widowed, and has one child.

Simeona moved to the city of Calca at the age of 19 and this is where she conducts all of her financial activities. She is a homemaker and lives off of her husband’s pension. Simeona is taking this opportunity to request a loan to pay for her son Wilfredo’s tuition since he is studying for a professional degree in economics.

The Communal Bank “Milenium III” meets every 30 days in the city of Calca in the Department of Cusco in Peru. Cusco is recognized for being an area for tourism and business. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a resident of Nkubu, Central Kenya, and has been in farming for the last 10 years. He is 27, married, and has two children, age 4 and 3 years. He currently employs three farmhands and produces maize, tobacco, beans, milk and groundnuts for the local markets.

Samuel has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes. He expects his production to improve significantly with the availability of water for the dairy animals and irrigation system. He adds that this will enable him to educate his children as well.

Samuel laments of the poor roads network and the insufficiency in animal feeds as the greatest limitations he faces.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Penina owns and operates a business selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has two years of experience in this business. Penina needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Penina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Penina's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Smas

texts.en:
Mrs. Smas lives in a common law relationship and has six children. Three of them are married and live independently in new homes. She and her husband are in the same business. They work together selling household supplies in a local market of Phnom Penh. 

They sell items like plates, dishes, large bowls, plastic baskets, frying pans, pots, casseroles, etc. They have operated this business for 11 years and it produces a good profit for their family. They normally earn approximately $8 US per day to satisfy the family's needs. 

Smas is seeking a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase additional merchandise to sell in the market. This loan will sustain and improve her business in the future. She hopes that she'll be able to make more profit and gain a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell in the market.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a single man who is 26 years old. He has been running a grocery business for the last two years to make a living. Peter has been able to retain his business because of a good reputation with his customers. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Peter has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy carrots, onions and fruits for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy carrots, onions and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Munhochir

texts.en: Munhochir is 33 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and their daughter is in kindergarden. As his brother suggested, he started to work as an carrier in 2007. After two years he began a driving course and started his own business of transportation. Personally, he is a clever and conversable man. He earnestly says "Road between Ulaanbaatar and Uvurhangai is source of our family's income." His business will grow faster if he repairs his car, therefore he is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to do so.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ей 43 года. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Ее дети учатся в школе. Сама Наргис у себя дома занимается выпечкой булочек и их реализации через сеть продуктовых магазинов. Таким образом она зарабатывает деньги и обеспечивает семью. Кредит берет для покупки муки, масла, яиц и сахара.
texts.en: Nargis lives in the Qumsangir region. She is 43 years old. She is divorced. She has two children, both in school. Nargis bakes rolls at home and sell them through a network of grocery stores. This is how she earns her living and supports her family. She is taking out a loan to buy flour, butter, eggs and sugar.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, eggs and sugar

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.ru: Абдулазиз занимается выращивание овощей и посевом зерновых культур. Этим видом деятельности он занимается три года. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Кредит берет для посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Abdulaziz grows vegetables and grains. He has been farming for three years. Abdulaziz is 34 years old, married and has four children. He is taking out this loan to plant winter wheat.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is 30 year old a married woman with four children; three of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei South Sudan for three years.

Peres is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Julieta helps her husband manage their corn farming business to ensure a high production. She is now 54 years old and has four adult-age children. Through their patience and hard work, they educated their children and most of them are now married and have their own family. Despite this, Julieta aims to continue managing their business to earn and save for their basic necessities and for future emergencies.

To work out her plan, Julieta is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed for her corn farming business. Despite the hardship in farming, they believe that they can increase their yields through their patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Osborn

texts.en:
Osborn is thirty-five years old and married to Mary; they have 3 children. He has operated a butchery in Kimilili town in western Kenya for the last five years.
 
He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd of KES 30,000, which he will use to buy pork to sell. He will plow the profits back into the business.

His dream is to open other branches of butcheries to supplement the current branch.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of pork.

loans.name: Vida Nueva Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité Vida Nueva son personas muy sacrificadas pero con mucha fuerza y por esa razón decidieron sumarse a la gran familia de la Fundación Paraguaya por las oportunidades  y sobre todo acceder a las capacitaciones que son de mucha ayuda  para que sepan utilizar esos recursos.
Norma es una de las miembros de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de lencería, tanto de hombre como de mujeres, comenta que empezó con unos pocos clientes, pero que gracias a su buena onda y a su carisma en las ventas ha podido crecer y hoy en día ya tiene una buena clientela, lo que le genera muy buenos ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lencerías para hombres y mujeres y de esa forma tener mayor variedad para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women of the Vida Nueva committee are persons who make many sacrifices yet who are very strong. For that reason they decided to join the great family of the Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunities and above all to access the trainings that are so helpful in showing them how to utilize those resources. 

Norma is one of the members of the group. She earns a living selling lingerie for men as well as women. She comments that she began with only a few customers but, thanks to her good vibes and charisma, she has been able to increase her sales. These days she has a good customer base which generates a good income for her. 

She is seeking the loan in order to purchase lingerie for men and women and thus to have greater variety for fulfilling her customers' requests.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie for sale.

loans.name: Untie  Christina

texts.en: Untie Christina cooks yams to sell. She serves them with vegetable sauce at Jukwa near Abura. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a security officer.  Christina has been into this business for 8 years now.  She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their children.  She will use her loan to purchase large quantities of yams, fish and vegetables which she will use to prepare her cooked yams. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her cooked yams.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of yams, fish and vegetables which she will use to prepare her cooked yams for sale.

loans.name: May

texts.en: May is 26 years old with two children and lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. She is a market vendor, selling second-hand clothes. Her business is located in the heart of the town thus attracting many customers. Stiff competition and price fluctuations hinder her business while her dream is to expand to new areas. May is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Regalo De Dios Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Regalo de Dios está conformada por once integrantes nueve mujeres y dos hombres, padres y madres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Achuapa, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Rafaela y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, mantequilla, frijoles cosidos, jugos, gaseosas, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta  de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Regalo de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.

loans.use: para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles como:  arroz, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, mantequilla, frijoles cosidos, jugos, gaseosas, fósforos.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 34 years old and widowed. She has four children. 

She has been farming for several years and it has been profitable.

Salome has requested for a loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya which she will be using to to expand her business by purchasing farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds for planting.

With the generated profits, Salome will be able to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the near future are to expand her farming business as well as educate her children for life.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is 55 years old, widowed with ten children.

Candida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, candies, bread and other snack foods.

Candida has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Candida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, candies, bread and other snack foods

loans.name: Rosa Yadira

texts.en:
My name is Rosa P. and I sell daily consumer products. I have had my business for 5 years and I have the help of my son to attend to customers. My business produces enough income to support my family and I have a good clientel because I am located near a private school. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to have more variety and higher quality goods. With the additional income I will remodel my home and continue to support my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi nombre es Rosa P. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la atencion de mis clientes, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi clientela es muy buena ya que estoy ubicada cerca de una escuela privada, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mejor variedad y calidad en mis productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y mantener a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase:sodas, beans, sugar, bread, tortillas, cheese, juices, milk, butter, margarine, oil, sweets, thread, needles, eggs, soups, sweet bread, sanitary napkins, tomatoe sauce, powdered drinks.

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en: Madam Theresah (the lady pictured in red) sells porridge. She is a client of the Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH programme. She is seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva for working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Loi

texts.en: Mrs. Loi is 33 years old. Her husband, who is a day laborer, is 36 years old. Because of no land, they focus on selling groceries. Additionally they began raising eels at home. They have a son and daughter. The son is a student at primary school, the daughter doesn’t go to school yet. The family income is $10 per person/month. Mrs. Loi hopes to receive a loan of $75 to supply her grocery store. She will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To supply the grocery store.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
"I would like to invest in my business for there are many items I do not have and this has caused sales to go down significantly. My customers are requesting many things I do not have. I request US$1,000.00 to invest in my business".

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

“Me gustaría invertir en mi negocio ya que hay muchas cosas que me faltan y debido a eso mis ventas han bajado mucho, mis clientes me piden muchas cosas que no tengo. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Mafalda Chambuleluan

texts.pt:
Mafalda is a single mother of 4 children. She joined the credit program this year. She plans on using this loan to invest in her business. She hopes that her business does well, so she can improve her family's diet and send her children to school without struggling as she does now. In the future she also hopes to improve her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Mafalda e mae solteira e tem 4 filhos. Ela esta entrando pela primeira vez no programa de credito. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para reforcar o seu negocio para poder angariar mais clientes.Ela pensa que se o negocio correr bem ela podera no futuro melhorar a sua dieta alimentar, os seus filhos poderao estudar sem grandes dificuldades como tem sido ate agora.mais tarde ira pensar em melhorar tambem a sua residencia que ja e muito velha e e feita de colmo.

loans.use: Increase invetory

loans.name: Sajor

texts.en:
Sajor is 50 years old and married with 6 children. He has the only rickshaw in Sierra Leone and his business provides good transport services to the community in Kabala town and especially the surrounding villages. He worked as a blacksmith before this business.

Sajor got several micro loans from SMT, with which he purchased a motorbike. With his last loan and some savings, he went to Guinea and built the bike into a rickshaw. The rickshaw can carry 6 passengers. He is requesting a loan to complete and improve the equipment. He would like to fix the windows and purchase spare tires.

loans.use: Improve the rickshaw by purchasing new windows and tires.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: I live in Multan, a medium-sized city famous in Pakistan for its shrines. I have three children: one boy and two daughters. Thankfully my children attend school, except the youngest who is not of school age yet. I am requesting a loan for my husband, who is a scrap dealer. With this loan he intends to buy scrap items, including plastic bottles and old iron, in bulk. Please help us uplift our economic status.

loans.use: Buy scrap items in bulk

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fizuli region located in the southwest part of Azerbaijan. He and his family were relocated to Lokbatan settlement in the Baku suburbs as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. He rents a shop and sells mobile phones. As mobile phones are very popular now, the business is going well. But the number and variety of mobile phones is low, so he wants to increase the volume of his business. As he has little of his own funds, he applies to Normicro Baku branch for a loan in amount of $1000 to invest in his business. He will repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To buy new varieties of phones

loans.name: Ruth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ruth is a 26-year-old merchant who is running her own shop. She has two young sons, and her husband is a bus driver. Her shop has been established for 6 years. She sells rice, beans, oil, and firewood, among other products. Her clients are mostly comprised of her neighbors, friends, and acquaintances. By selling these groceries, Ruth fulfills the demands of the residents of the town of Ticuantepe. You can help Ruth in her business by providing her with a loan that will be invested toward supplying the basic grains and perishable goods at reasonable prices. As a result, this will help the customers of the store get the best offers.

Translated from Spanish by Lily Fu, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Ruth es una joven comerciante de 26 años de edad, tiene dos hijos pequeños y su esposo trabajaba como conductor, des de hace 6 años tiene su negocio, en el cual vende arroz, frijoles, aceite, leña entre otros, sus clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Con la venta de granos básicos y productos alimenticios, subsana cierta demanda de los pobladores del municipio de Ticuantepe, ya que el negocio requiere abastecerse de una variedad de productos, es por eso que solicita el préstamos para invertir en su negocio comprando granos básicos y productos perecederos, para así darles una mejor oferta a las personas que la visitan diariamente.

loans.use: To buy staple grains and perishable goods

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kokoè G. was born on November 11, 1964 in Aného, a town about 30 miles east of Lomé. Her husband, whose name is Agbéko Djamessi, is a carpenter. Mrs. G. has five children and sells food products. She began this business in 1984. With the income she makes from it, she is able to take care of the family expenses. The loan of FCFA 150,000 that she is requesting will allow her to buy a dozen bags of corn while supplies are good and be able to continue her business in between times. With the income from this activity she is able to take care of her children’s education and provide for their needs.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Kokoè est née le 11 novembre 1964 à Aného, ville située à 50 km à l’Est de Lomé. Son mari qui s’appelle DJAMESSI Agbéko est un menuisier. Madame G. a cinq enfants et est revendeuse de produits alimentaires. Elle a commencé cette activité en 1984. Avec le revenu de cette activité elle arrive à supporter les charges de sa famille. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 150.000FCFA lui permettra d’acheter douze sacs de maïs en ce temps d’abondance et de pouvoir continuer son activité en temps de soudure. Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle arrive à prendre en charge l’éducation de ses enfants et subvenir à leurs besoins.

loans.use: To increase her stock of corn

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
From a young age Veronica has dedicated herself to making handcrafts. She was introduced into this business through her parents who taught her and helped her develop her abilities. She now sees the results of her work and her dedication in making weavings has given her the opportunity to contribute to her home and thus to improve the quality of life of her family members. To maintain this, her continuous work is necessary which is why she is asking for a loan in order to purchase a more prime material to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

VERÓNICA, desde muy joven se dedica a la artesanía, actividad que heredó de sus padres, quienes le enseñaron lo necesario y quienes le ayudaron a desarrollar sus habilidades en torno a esta actividad.Su desempeño ahora tiene resultados y su dedicación para la elaboración de telares le ha otorgado la posibilidad de contribuir con su hogar con la mejora de la calidad de vida de sus miembros. Para mantener este hecho cada vez es más necesario su desempeño continuo por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima para elevar su producción.

loans.use: Capital to purchase more prime material

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phan Thi H., 51 years old, joined TYM FUND (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 2003. She has a husband and a grown-up son. She used her first loan of 70 USD to breed pigs. At the end of that year she earned 50 USD in profit. From that time on, she continues to use her loan to breed pigs, and she is able to increase the size of her loan each year. Mrs. H. uses the profit from her farm to pay for the living expenses and for her son's schooling. Her income is about 150 USD per month. This time she applies for a loan of 450USD to buy breeding pigs and their food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phan Thị Hịu, 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 1 con trai đã trưởng thành. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị xin vay 70USD để chăn nuôi lợn. Cuối năm chị thu lãi 50USD. Từ đó đến nay số vốn đầu tư cho việc chăn nuôi tăng dần lên qua các năm. Tiền lãi thu được, chị Hịu dùng trang trải chi phí sinh hoạt hàng ngày và cho con ăn học. Thu nhập bình quân của chị hiện nay khoảng 150USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 450USD để mua lợn và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Abdul Sami

texts.en: Abdul Sami lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, where he has a restaurant. His restaurant has lots of customers, but he would like to expand his business and needs funds to complete his stock. Therefore, he would like to take out an individual loan to buy stock for his restaurant and make it even more popular. He is pleased with this loan.

loans.use: To complete his stock.

loans.name: Heidens

texts.es:
Heidens worked at a garage and that is how he learned the trade. Therefore, seven years ago he decided to establish his own garage at his house. Moreover, Heidens also has a taxi which he lets on a daily basis.

He has used the loans he has received so far to buy material and tools. Now, he would like to expand his garage and buy more tools.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Heidens trabajaba como asistente en un taller de mecánica, por lo que aprendió este oficio. Fue así que hace 7 años decidió independizarse y abrir su propio taller de planchado de autos en su casa.

Igualmente, Heidens tiene un carro que lo alquila diariamente como taxi. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar sus materiales y herramientas de mecánica. A él le gustaría ampliar su taller y comprar más herramientas.

loans.use: To expand his garage and buy more tools

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta baji*, the wife of E. I., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She has one daughter who is 4 years old and in kindergarten. Shagufta baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. Her husband doesn't do anything. So, Shagufta baji is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo, which will be the start of a milk business for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by four other women. Bilquis baji and Sajida baji also want loans to buy a buffalo for their milk businesses. Latifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries (lentils, rice, sugar) for her grocery shop. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle, like a "tuk-tuk").

In a group loan, the loan funds are distributed among the group members, each of whom invests in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

*Baji, which literally means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Ida Ayu Putu Maskun

texts.id:
Ida Ayu Putu Maskun diusia yang sudah tua masih tetap ulet bekerja dan tekun menjalani usahanya berjualan segala macam keperluan sehari-hari seperti, ikan,  sayur, tahu, tempe, bumbu dapur dan keperluan dapur lainnya. Dibantu oleh anak dan suaminya, Ida Ayu Putu Maskun berjualan keliling disekitar desa tempat tinggalnya. Jam 05.00 pagi, Ida Ayu Putu Maskun kepasar untuk membeli segala macam keperluan untuk dagangannya. Sepulang dari pasar Ida Ayu Putu Maskun langsung berjualan hingga menjelang siang hari. Jika dagangan tidak habis maka Ida Ayu Putu Maskun akan menjualnya lagi pada sore hari. Dengan modal  Rp. 300.000.- Ida Ayu Putu Maskun bisa memperoleh keuntungan bersih Rp.60.000.- jika daganganya laku terjual semua. Besarnya modal yang diperlukan membuat Ida Ayu Putu Maskun sangat  berharap bisa mendapatkan pinjaman dari Dinari yang disalurkan melalui lembaga didesanya. Ida Ayu Putu Maskun tinggal disebuah rumah semi permanen bersama anak bungsunya dan suaminya, sedangkan anak yang lainnya semua sudah menikah. Ida Ayu Putu Maskun mempunyai 4 orang anak, 3 orang sudah menikah. 
Sisa hasil berjualannya ditabungnya untuk masa tuanya jika nanti Ida Ayu Putu Maskun sudah tidak bisa berjualan keliling lagi.
texts.en:
Ida Ayu Putu Maskun sells daily food necessities such as fish, veggie, tofu, soy bean cake, etc. She gets helps from her husband and her children in this business. She starts her day at 5 am to go to the market to buy her inventories and then she travels around her neighborhood to sell the goods. With a capital of IDR 300 thousand (around USD 30) she can earn a profit of USD 6.5 if she is able to sell all of the goods. Therefore she is hoping to get a loan money to enable her to add her capital to get more goods to sell.

Ida Ayu Putu Maskun lives in a semi permanent house with her husband and their youngest son. The other 3 sons are already married and live with their own family. She wants to be able to save her profit so she can have enough pension money when she is no longer able to work.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add working capital (Menambah modal usaha)

loans.name: Julia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Julia inició su negocio desde adolescente vendiendo cosméticos de la marca AVON y de la ZERMAT, ella oferta este producto en su barrio y en las empresas cercanas, sus ventas son al crédito y por encargos. Este negocio le permite atender los deberes de su casa y la atención de sus 2 hijos que asisten al colegio. Tiene su casa propia donde vive con su esposo que trabaja de albañil y él la apoya  con  los gastos de la casa, Sueña con realizarles mejoras a su casa de habitación lo que dice que lo va a lograr con la ayuda de adim.
texts.en:
Julia started her business as a teenager selling Avon and Zermat cosmetics. She offers these products in her neighborhood and to companies nearby. Her sales are by credit and by order. This business allows her to attend to her household duties and to spend time with her 2 children who are in school. She owns her own home where she lives with her husband. He works as a mason and helps her with household expenses. She dreams of making improvements to her house which is what she will be able to achieve with help from ADIM.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira tiene 34 años, ella y su esposo trabajan en la chacra para la educación de sus 4 hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura, desde niña, tiene plantaciones de cítricos de dos hectáreas y hace 2 años ha  plantado también plátanos en otras dos hectáreas.  En horas de la mañana prepara conjuntamente con el desayuno, el almuerzo, y así le da tiempo para ir de a comprar mercadería para su mini bodega, donde se ocupa en tiempos cuando la chacra no requiera mayores cuidados. Lo que le agrada es el tiempo de cosechar los plátanos, que es cada 15 días, ya que es fácil y no necesita emplear mucho tiempo. Y a la vez lo más difícil es que no tiene como transportarlos al mercado, entonces tiene que adecuarse al precio que le pueden dar los compradores que van hasta sus plantaciones. Este es su primer préstamo. Con este dinero contratará peones para que sacan las todas las yerbas de sus tierras, por hectárea le cobran 270 soles.
texts.en:
Elvira is 34 years old. She and her husband work on their small farm for the education of their 4 children. She is dedicated to agriculture. From girlhood, she has had two hectares of citrus plantations and 2 years ago she planted bananas also in two other hectares. In the morning hours she prepares both breakfast and lunch, and thus gives herself time to go to buy merchandise for her small convenience store, where she is occupied in times when the small farm does not require as much attention. What pleases her is harvest time for the bananas, which is every 15 days, since it is easy and does not take a lot of time. And at the same time the most difficult thing is that she does not have a means to transport them to the market, so she has to accept the price that the buyers that come to the plantation will give her. This is her first loan. With this money she will hire laborers so that she can remove all the grass from her lands. They charge her 270 soles per hectare.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay laborers to remove the grasses from her lands

loans.name: Mayra Delia

texts.es:
La señora Mayra Delia tiene 23 años años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Poder y vive en la calle José de la Riva Agüero 261 B, distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y continuó estudios de Computación, pero ahora vive con su pareja y aún no tiene niños.
Su negocio consiste en la elaboración de manualidades, en sociedad con su cuñada,  elabora sorpresas para cumpleaños y para el colegio.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará materiales como pegamento, corrospun, tela de seda, etc.
Mayra sueña con tener un gran taller que abastezca la venta de sus materiales que confecciona.
texts.en:
Mayra Delia is 23 years old and is a member of the Communal Bank "Women In Power". She lives at 261 B José de la Riva Agüero of the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru.

She graduated from high school and then studied computers. She now lives with her partner and don't yet have children. Her business entails making arts and crafts with her mother-in-law. She makes birthday gifts and items for school.

With this loan of 300 Soles (1 $US = 3 Soles), which she will repay in 4 instalments, she'll buy materials such as glue, corrospun (sheets of plastic), silk, etc. Mayra dreams of owning her own workshop where she can sell the arts and crafts she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy glue, corrospun (plastic sheets), silk, etc.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta D., mariée est membre du banc villageois de Bayakh 1 depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du riz, de l’huile, du savon et autres  pour  renforcer sa  boutique. Binta fait aussi de l’aviculture.  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Binta D. is married and has been a member of the village association of Bayakh 1 for seven and a half years. She wants to buy rice, oil, soap, and more to provide a boost to her shop. Binta also raises poultry. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop with rice, oil, soap, etc., and to bolster her poultry business

loans.name: Sisis

texts.es:
SISIS C. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad”, tiene 43 años de edad, dos hijos, el trabajo que desempeña su esposo es independiente.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró telas, elásticos, hilos, confeccionó sábanas, vestidos para niños, vendió ambulatoriamente, la cliente crecía habían más pedidos.
