La señora Sisis vive en un Asentamiento Humano llamado “Víctor Maldonado Vegazo” Mz. 11, Lt. 2 de la C.F.B. km. 7.200 del Distrito de Callería.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara 16 metros de tela. Hilos (01 docena de cada color) elásticos 20 metros, hilos para remallar (02 docenas).

Está muy contenta, agradecida de Manuela Ramos, por la confianza que tienen con ella, ahora su familia esta muy unida.
texts.en:
Sisis C. M. belongs to the Community Bank “La Amistad” (Friendship). She is 43 years old and has 2 children. Her husband is self-employed. The first loan that she received was for 300.00 Nuevos Soles, which she used to buy fabric, elastic and thread to make linens and children’s clothes. She sold them as a street vendor and her customer base grew and she received more orders. Sisis lives in a settlement called “Victor Maldonado Vegazo” Mz. 11, Lot 2 of C.F.B. at kilometer 7.200 in the District of Calleria. With this loan of 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy 16 meters of fabric, 1 dozen spools of each color of thread, 20 meters of elastic and 2 dozen spools of thread for mending. She is very happy and grateful for Manuela Ramos, for trusting her and bringing her family together.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread and elastic

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth Alfan runs a café at Buguruni ward. She is a micro entrepreneur, Tanzanian married woman. Business income generated is used to meet her daily family demand and paying school fees and partly for capitalization. She managed to buy a building site in Dar es Salaam. She has been in the business for four years. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to boost up her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Watu Hodari Group

texts.en:
Fatuma S., age 30, is married with two children, ages 2 and 6. She sells clothing wholesale. She started this business two years ago and works daily from 6:30am until 11pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $150. 

This will be Shakila’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock and improve her shop and has repaid the loan successfully. She now hopes for a second loan to open a pharmacy. 

Shakila will share this loan with her loan group, Watu Hodari (Swahili for "strong people"), which totals 13 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Fatuma S. is in the back far right in a black dress.

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La señora Nelida R. P. tiene 42 años, es tesorera de su Banco Comunal, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito de Trujillo,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió contabilidad Técnica, carrera que ejerció durante 5 años y que abandonó debido a que se casó. Tiene 3 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Nelida se dedica a la venta de perfumería, juguetería y Librería, inicio su negocio vendiendo productos de belleza hace 10 años y ropa casi 7 años, los cuales abandono por un tiempo debido a que salio embarazada, luego decidió abrir un puesto en el mercado, en donde actualmente trabaja hace 5 años, con las ganancias obtenidas logro construir su puesto y ampliar su negocio a la venta de útiles escolares. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el mercado El Cortijo. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en aumentar su capital comprando productos de belleza para su stock.
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de útiles escolares para campaña.
Nelida tiene el gran sueño de tener una tienda grande de Productos de Belleza donde pueda enseñar maquillaje.
texts.en:
Nelida R. P. is 42 years old and is treasurer of her community bank. She lives in Urb. El Cortijo in the Trujillo district and province, in La Libertad, Peru. She studied technical accounting, a career that she followed for five years and she abandoned when she married. She has three children that depend on her completely. Nelida is dedicated to selling perfume, toys and books. She began her business selling beauty products ten years ago and clothing seven years ago, which she abandoned for a time when she became pregnant. Then she decided to open a stall in the market where she has worked for five years. With the earnings she has made, she has been able to construct a stall and expand her business into selling school supplies. Her business is developing in the El Cortijo market. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her community bank, Nuevo Peru, she invested in increasing her capital purchasing beauty products for her stock. With the loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will invest in the purchase of school supplies. Nelida has a great dream of having a large shop of beauty products where she may teach makeup application.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Mrs. Juanita G. is 64 years old and married to Mauresio G.. They have four children who have all been married already. She looks after the care of her grandchild while her daughter is abroad. Their source of income relies on her business: fruit and vegetable vending. They sell their products during market day in their town and the neighboring municipality and cities. Both husband and wife manage their business well and, in fact, it is still making ongoing progress now. She needs capital, so she is borrowing the amount of PHP 20,000.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: La señora  EMMA C. Q. y su esposo Mauro Saavedra, tienen tres pequeños hijos a quienes educan con su trabajo,  Ellos viven en su domicilio que es anticrítico de la calle: Panamá # 336  en la zona Alto Lima 2da sección, la ciudad de El Alto. La señora Emma se dedica a la venta de aceite de cocinar  es ambulante vende por las cercanias de su domicilio, ella se acomoda en el lugar que puede. La pareja actualmente viven en anticrítico ellos quieren comprar una casa para mas adelante. La señora es nueva en la institución este es su primer crédito, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de 3 túrriles para la venta al raleo (por menor) y por mayor, su esposo es chofer asalariado, esta  afiliado al sindicato San Cristóbal trabaja todos los días para colaborar a su familia, ellos comparten los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Emma C. Q. and her husband Mauro Saavedra work hard to raise their three small children. They live in the Alto Lima zone in the city of El Alto. Emma sells cooking oil in the neighboring areas. She does not have a permanent location and sells her products wherever she finds available space. Emma and her husband hope to one day purchase their own home.

Emma is new to the organization and this is her first loan. This loan will be used to purchase 3 drums of oil. They plan to sell the oil in small quantities and wholesale. Her husband is a salaried driver and is a member of the San Cristóbal Union. He works everyday to earn money for his family. Emma and her husband share the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drums of cooking oil

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: La emprendedora Orbelina R. S. tiene 50 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Orbelina tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Orbelina es la costura. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Orbelina inicio por cuenta propia, por lo que tenia que mantener a una familia y además seguir con este negocio. Hasta los momentos ha manejado muchos créditos con Fundación León 2000 y en su mayoría han sido para su negocio. El financiamiento es para la inversión de su negocio como tela, agujas y repuestos para su maquina de coser. Los sueños de Orbelina son de seguir con esta actividad ya que ahí dependen sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The enterprising Orbelina R. S. is 50 and single. Orbelina has three children who all work. Orbelina is a seamstress. She has been in this business for over ten years. She started working for herself because she had to take care of her family and continue with this business. Up until now she has had many loans from Fundación León 2000, and the majority of them have been for her business. The loan is for investment in her business like buying fabric, needles, and replacement parts for her sewing machine. Orbelina dreams of continuing this business because she depends upon its income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
N. Đỗ Thị (435970112) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has three school-aged children.

N. owns and operates a business raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 1998, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

N. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy A. is 30 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, one son and one daughter. Both are currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer. Lucy is also a trader. She trades in foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, etc. She wants a loan to buy foodstuffs in bulk. Lucy supplies to other retailers and food vendors. She buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for five years. Lucy aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Henry is forty-three years old. He is married and has three children. He is a professional photographer. Henry is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘God is Able’. He is the only man in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well.

The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the heartfelt desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: to expand their businesses

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda R. of Prk. Duensitin, La Castellana, is 60 years old and married with five adult children.

For the past thirty-seven years she has owned and operated a general store that sells a variety of food products and other goods to the local community. Before she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, her store was very small, constructed with bamboo and light materials, and it barely provided for her needs. After she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, she was able to expand her business and the income she earned also helped a lot in helping her afford the education of her children, all of whom were able to finish school.

Now that all of her children are either gainfully employed or have their own sources of income, Nilda invested her profits and loans in other business activities - she bought a motorcycle and a multi-cab van that gives her a wider distribution range for her products.

For her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nilda is borrowing PHP 25,000 which she to fund the expanding business activities of her general store.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Itidal

texts.en: Itidal is a 36-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She has been working as a tailor for the past 17 years to earn income to help satisfy the needs of her family. Today, Itidal is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a sewing machine in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia D. is married and has one child. She has received senior high school education. Emilia makes and sells palm oil and palm kernel oil. She goes to the farmers to buy palm nuts and process them into oils at Elmina near Ntsinman, which she has been doing since 2006. Her husband is a petty trader.

Emilia uses her income to help her husband with the payment of fees and utility bills. Emilia will use the loan to purchase more palm fruit for her oil production. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emilia plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: purchase more palm fruit for her oil production

loans.name: Julio Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Julio C. Cuenta con 19 años de edad, es Casado	 y con oficios  Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su Esposa, él y su Esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 3 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Tzansiguan, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Artesania (compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Neida Martina

texts.es: Martina que cuenta con 36 años vive en su propia casa ubicada en una comunidad de Warnes. Martina vive junto a su esposo de 41 años de edad y sus 5 hijos de 4-8-16-18 y 20 años de edad.  Martina trabaja como agente municipal de dicha comunidad y su esposo el codeudor esta como portero en una empresa Agropecuaria. Martina además ha vuelto a reactivar su pequeña panadería. No hay competencia porque ambos son empleados fijos y seguros; uno público y el otro privado, donde perciben salarios mensuales. Pero si respecto a la panadería, que por la calidad de sus productos tiene mucha clientela. Martina invirtió todo su crédito en la compra de materia prima para su panadería al por mayor, como ser; harina, manteca aceite, azúcar, etc. Lo que le sobro lo invirtió en la compra de materiales de construcción. Este préstamo seria el sexto préstamo de Martina y todos los anteriores los a cancelado puntualmente. Ella no tiene deuda en ninguna otra financiera.
texts.en:
Martina is 36 years old and lives in her own home in the community of Warnes. She lives with her husband of 41 years of age and their 5 children who are 4, 8, 16, 18 and 20 years old. Martina works as a municipal agent in her community and her husband, the co-debtor, is a caretaker of an agricultural company. Martina has once more started her small bakery. There is no competition between her and her husband, because both receive monthly incomes and have steady and secure jobs, one is public, and the other private. The bakery has many customers because of the quality of the baked goods. She will use the loan to buy raw material wholesale for her bakery such as flour, butter, oil, sugar, etc. The rest she will invest in buying construction materials. This will be Martina’s sixth loan and the previous ones, she has paid punctually. She does not have any other debts with any other financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital in a bakery and other.

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: Madame Fama  M. evolue depuis trois ans dans le commerce de de boubous et de tissus.Elle est mariee et mere d un enfant.C est son premier crédit sollicite car elle souhaiterait renforcer ses marchandises pour prevoir l augmentation de la demande  a l approche de la fete de tabaski.AAinsi elle pourra voir ses benefices augmenter de 20 000 frs mensuellement.Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des Madame Fama M. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Ms. Fama M. has been developing a business selling boubous (wide-sleeved West African robes) and fabrics for three years. She is seeking her first loan because she hopes to increase her stock of merchandise to anticipate the rise in demand with the approaching festival of Tabaski (Eid-al-Adha). In this way, she will be able to see her profits rise by 20,000 francs per month. Ms. Fama M. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC (one of Kiva's field partners) and the Program for the Development of Children and Families (PDEF in French) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community, and especially to protect children who come from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can benefit from loans having more flexible terms, as compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement's inception in December 2008, 120 parents have received financing in amounts varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Akwei Allah Group

texts.en:
Stephen is 48 years old. He is single and lives in his family house in the community where he lives. He works hard to support himself and business.

Stephen is a supplier of local palm fruits and palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish and pastries, as well as local soaps. He supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. He also sells the palm fruits to those who need them for further processing. He wants to use this loan to buy more bags of palm fruits. He believes the loan will enable him make more profit as we enter the Christmas festivities.

Stephen is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Akwei Allah’, which literary means Except Allah. He is the one standing in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan. The group would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of palm oil and palm nuts fruits.

loans.name: Maria Coralia

texts.es: MARIA CORALIA DE 45 AÑOS CASADA, TIENE 3 HIJOS , NESECITA UN CREDITO DE Q.8,000.00 PARA PODER SURTIR SU TIENDA DE VENTA DE CONSUMO DIARIO YA EN ESTOS MESES TIENE MUCHA VENTA, SU SUEÑO ES TENER UN NEGOCIO MAS GRANDE Y QUE SUS HIJOS UN BUEN FUTURO Y QUE TENGAN LOS RECURSOS NECESARIOS.
texts.en:
Maria Coralia is 45 years old and married, and she has three children. She needs a loan of Q.8,000 to be able to supply her general store, because in these months, she has a lot of sales. Her dream is to have a bigger business and for her children to have a good future, with access to everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General store supplies

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Nuestra socia MARIELA, tiene 22 años, es conviviente y esta embarazada de 8 meses. Ella es natural de la ciudad de Quillabamba. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “DURABANK” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ella vive en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene su negocio de transporte de carga pesada que lleva de la ciudad de Quillabamba a la ciudad de Lima. Ya son dos años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento de los carros de transportes y también desea comprar llantas.         
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
MARIELA, 22, lives with her life partner and is 8-months pregnant. She is from the city of Quillabamba and is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "DURABANK" communal bank. She lives in the imperial city of Cusco. She has a heavy cargo transportation service which transports form Quillabamba to Lima. She has been in this line of work for 2 years and has done well, thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She is a young, hard-working, enterprising woman who wishes to see her family get ahead in life. The funds will be used to service the trucks and to buy tires. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To service her trucks and buy tires.

loans.name: Sakirat

texts.en: Sakirat is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 12 years old. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband sells clothes to make a living. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more sales and profits. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
A. Ilhomjon is 45 years old and married with four children. He raises and sells cattle for a living. He purchases small cattle at the central market, feeds them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. Ilhomjon has been in this business for eight years and is experienced at choosing the animals, breeding them, and looking after them. He gets up early in the morning in order to feed the animals and look after them. His knowledge and skills have made his business successful and generated a considerable and stable income for his large family. 
Currently, Ilhomjon is planning to expand his business and purchase more cattle. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting $1500 USD. You could become an important part in Ilhomjon's family's life – he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.  

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: God's Goodness Group

texts.en: Rachel S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Goodness. She is 54 years old and married with five children, aged 18 to 30 with educational levels ranging from 8th grade to university. Rachel and her family live and work in the Pipeline Road Community in Paynesville near Liberia's capital, Monrovia. Rachel herself could not continue past 6th grade in school due to poverty. Rachel’s business is the sale of vegetables. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail from a table to residents of the Pipeline Paynesville community. She has been running this business for more than four years and hopes to own a shop in the near future. Rachel started selling with a very low amount of capital and now faces difficulty with funding her business -- the money she has is too small to grow her business well. Rachel says she sells good products in order to encourage her customers to continue buying from her. Rachel needs this loan to purchase more vegetables for resale and as working capital for her business. She dreams of being able to improve her family's living conditions. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Rachel is the one holding the sign. Joe W. is in the inset photo in the lower right corner. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
54-year-old Marjorie D.’s dream in life is to support her three children, despite the fact that her two eldest children already have families of their own. She wants to be a good grandmother to her grandchildren and be someone they can run to when their parents do not have enough money for their needs. With that, Marjorie wants to grow her small “sari-sari” (variety) store using the loan she is requesting through ASHI.

“Sari-sari” is a Filipino term for variety, and “sari-sari” stores are variety stores that sell items to meet the basic needs of people in the village everyday. This offers convenience, especially to those who live far away from the main town, just like in Marjorie’s village. Marjorie wishes for her store to someday grow into a grocery store, which sells more inventory and can make more profits to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of a "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia, de 54 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 3 hijos de 23, 18 y 13 años, en una populosa zona de la sierra del Perú.

Desde que tenía 14 años, esta carismática mujer, aprendió las técnicas del bordado en fustanes, primero veía a su madre y luego ella misma empezó a bordar. Ya han pasado 40 años desde entonces y siente que cada vez lo hace mejor. En el camino ha aprendido mucho y lo ha sabido plasmar con dedicación en cada uno de sus bordados en los vestuarios de los danzantes de las fiestas patronales de la zona donde vive, además es una actividad que le entretiene. En la actualidad debe cubrir sola los gastos de sus hijos, ya que estudian y los mantiene con el bordado de fustanes y chalecos. Cuando tiene muchos pedidos contrata el servicio de dos jóvenes que le ayudan a avanzar más rápido, labor que realiza en su casa. Emilia es una mujer que no puede vivir sin hacer nada, pues mientras conversa va armando su ovillo de lana.  Para el futuro tiene pensado instalar un pequeño taller de bordado en su vivienda y para trabajar con cantidades mayores.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito para seguir trabajando. Emilia tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de lanas e hilos de diversos colores para continuar bordando, ya que quiere cumplir con un pedido grande de fustanes y chalecos para un grupo de baile de danzas de la zona.
texts.en:
Emilia, 54, lives in her own house with her three children, who are 23, 18 and 13 years old, in a densely populated mountain area of Perú. Since she was 14 years old, this charismatic woman learned to embroider fustanes (woman’s white skirt), first by watching her mother and then on her own. Forty years have gone by since then and each time she does it bettter. Along the way, she has learned much and her knowledge is refelcted in each of the embroideries she does on the costumes that area feast day dancers wear. Besides, this is an activity that keeps her entertained. Currently, she must see to her children's needs by herself. They are in school and she must support them with earnings from her embroidery on fustanes and vests. When she has a lot of orders, she hires two young people to help her get the work done faster; the work is done in her home. Emilia is a woman that doesn't know how to be idle; even when she's chatting her hands are busy assembling her ball of wool. For the future, she plans to set up a small embroidery shop in her home so that she can manage larger work orders. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people that make it possible for her to receive credit to continue working. Emilia plans to use the money to buy wool and thread in various colors to continue embroidering because she wants to finish a large order of fustanes and vests for a dance group in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and thread.

loans.name: Gilberto David

texts.es: El Sr. Gilberto G. es casado tiene una familia numerosa son 8 hijas ya tres de ellas casada ya tienen 2 bebe cada una de él solo depende su esposa y dos hijas menores, la actividad de él es venta de productos de limpieza para el hogar como desinfectante para el piso bayclin, pinesol, petróleo, creolina. y productos químicos como acido muriático, el dinero lo solicita para compra de un terreno. Ya es el noveno crédito con nosotros y si le han servido ya que ha crecido su negocio por que cuando empezó a vender producto empezó con dos productos y ahora tiene 8 prductos y vende ambulante en la zona de san Rafael, masachapa, el salto son comunidades cercanas al municipio y ha podido mejorar su casa y espera seguir trabajando con ceprodel.
texts.en:
Mr Gilberto G. is married and has a large family. he has 8 daughters and three of them are already married, with two babies each. His wife and his two youngest daughters are the only ones who depend on him. His activity is selling cleaning products for the home, such as floor disinfectant. Some of these are Bayclin, Pinesol, petroleum, creolin, and chemical products such as muriatic acid. The money he is asking for is to buy a land lot. This is the ninth loan he has had with us and they have helped him. He has grown his business because when he started to sell products he started with 2 and now he has 8. He sells as a street vendor in the San Rafael, Masachapa, and El Salto area. These are communities close to town. He has been able to to improve his house and he hopes to keep working with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a land lot

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan tiene 33 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el caserío El Pueblito, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi. El empezó a desarrollarse en esta actividad alquilando unidades para trabajar y luego, con los ahorros de su trabajo, puedo comprar la propia, actualmente se vale de ella para brindar sus servicios tanto en la ciudad Olmos como en los caseríos aledaños.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad movil y el estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que su mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por ese motivo Adan se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi.

El es una persona responsable y que dia a dia da lo mejor de si para lograr el bienestar de los suyos. Su sueño es seguir creciendo como empresario de transporte y hacerse conocido en el medio.
texts.en:
Adan is 33 years old and lives together with his family in the farming community El Pueblito, a rural zone of the Olmos district, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past five years, he has worked transporting goods and passengers on a moto-taxi. He started in this field by renting vehicles to use, and later, with the savings from his work, he was able to buy his own vehicle. Currently, he uses his moto-taxi to provide his services in the city of Olmos as well as in outlying villages. The constant use of his vehicle and the rough condition of the area's roads have caused his moto-taxi to begin to suffer some mechanical damage. Repairs are urgently needed so that his vehicle will operate properly. For this reason, Adan has come to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time, requesting a loan of 1000 Peruvian new soles, which he plans to invest in the repair and maintenance of his moto-taxi. Adan is a responsible person who does his best each day to provide for the well-being of his loved ones. His dream is to continue growing as a transportation entrepreneur and become well-known in his field.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing and maintaining his vehicle

loans.name: Xiomara Carina

texts.es: Xiomara Carina tiene 32 años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ella dio inicio con fondos propios, con el asesoramiento de sus compañeras de trabajo empezó dando créditos, a trabajadores del centro escolar donde ella laboraba, así fue que empezó a obtener sus propios clientes, por lo que las facilidades de pago son quincenales y es mucho más favorables para sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita actualmente es para la compra de pintura de uña, pintura de labios, vanidad y ropa interior. Su deseo es terminar de construir su vivienda y establecer su propia tienda de cosméticos y ropa.
texts.en:
Xiomara Carina is 32 years old, and she works selling cosmetics. She started her business with her own money and with advice from her co-workers she started selling products on credit to other workers at the school where she works. She started to gain clients allowing them to make payments ever 15 days, which her clients see as favorable terms. The loan that she is currently seeking will be used to buy fingernail polish, lipstick, and underwear. Her goal is to finish building her home and open her own cosmetics and clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Saing

texts.en:
Mrs. Saing R., 40, is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables in her village in the province of Battambang. She has been a farmer since 1989. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. All three of her children go to school and they also help in their parent’s business when they are not studying. Mrs. R.'s husband assists her in her farming activities. Every year, Saing R. depends on farming as her main source of income. Recently, she has been lacking farming supplies. As she does not have the necessary money, she decided to ask for a loan through Kiva to purchase a large amount of fertilizer, crop seed, insecticide and a watering pump for her farm.
Mrs. Saing R. was busy when the photograph was taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of fertilizer, crop seed, insecticide and a watering pump

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.ru:
С. Тюп находится на берегу необычайно красивого, высокогорного оз. Ыссык – Куль. Герои этой истории – жители с. Тюп. Ботоканова Айнура – лидер группы. Айнура нуждается в кредите, который позволил бы ей закупить одну тонну семенного картофеля и ГСМ. Выращивание сельхоз продукции и скотоводство – являются основным делом, которыми занимаются сельчане. Айнуре тридцать девять лет. У неё пятеро замечательных детей: сын и четыре дочери. На протяжении одиннадцати лет Айнура с мужем кормят большую семью за счёт того, что занимаются земледелием, и параллельно держат живность: коров и овец. Помимо этого муж Айнуры занимается ремонтом и покраской автомашин. От продажи молока Айнуре удаётся заработать около двух тысяч сомов. Это не так много, однако, всё же, хоть какой – то заработок. Старшие дети Айнуры по мере возможности помогают родителям сажать, полоть , поливать и собирать урожай. Перед Айнурой стоят задачи, которые она планирует выполнить в течение ближайших нескольких лет. Прежде всего, Айнура хочет, чтобы её дети выросли образованными детьми. Она готова не жалеть никаких средств и усилий, чтобы открыть детям дорогу в будущее.  Айнура верит, что при умелом использовании собственных возможностей, можно добиться всего. А также она уже давно собирается произвести ремонт хозяйственных построек возле её дома. Это всё требует времени и средств, однако Айнура будет действовать последовательно. 

Партнёры Айнуры по группе:

Сатаровой Нургул сорок лет. Она с недавних пор вдова и одна воспитывает двоих детей – близнецов: сына и дочь. Чтобы прокормить себя и детей Нургул приходится заниматься одновременно земледелием и скотоводством. Она очень надеется получить этот кредит, чтобы купить пять голов мелко – рогатого скота. Её мечта – построить большой дом со всеми удобствами. 

Исмаиловой Эрмек тридцать семь лет. Муж Эрмек работает на птицефабрике «Шумкар» в г. Бишкек. Эрмек – мать пятерых детей. Дома вместе с детьми, она занимается выращиванием сельхоз продукции, а также предоставляет услуги швеи. Эрмек нуждается в кредите. Она намерена купить 500 кг семенного картофеля.

Иманакуновой Замире тридцать семь лет. Муж Замиры работает таксистом. Сама Замира усердно помогает мужу кормить и обеспечивать семью. У них трое детей. Самой младшей дочери всего три года. Она выращивает различные зерновые культуры или овощи на собственном участке земли. Замира очень надеется получить этот кредит, который позволит ей провести оросительные работы. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
he Tup village is situated by the incredibly beautiful mountain lake Issyk Kul. The protagonists of this story are inhabitants of the village. Ainura B. needs loan which would allow her to purchase one ton [2200 lbs]of seed potatoes as well as fuel. Farming and livestock are the main occupations of the villagers. Ainura is 39 years old. She has five wonderful children: one son and four daughters. For many years Ainura and her husband have been able to support their large family thanks to farming work as well as to keeping livestock: cows and sheep. In addition, Ainura’s husbands repairs and paints cars. Milk sales bring Ainura about 2,000 soms. This is not a huge amount, yet it helps. The older children, as much as possible, help their parents with, weeding, watering and harvesting. Ainura has a number of goals to reach in the next few years. First of all, she would like her children to get an education. She will not to spare any money and effort to provide a future for her children. She believes that using one’s abilities wisely makes it possible to achieve anything. Also, she has been planning to renovate the sheds near the house for a long time. All this requires time and financial means, but Ainura will keep working at it little by little. Other group members: Nurgul S. is 40 years old. She is a recent widow, raising her twins, a son and a daughter. In order to support herself, she is forced to do both farming and livestock keeping. She is really hoping to obtain this credit in order to buy five smallstock animals. Her dream is to build a big house with all modern facilities. Ermek I. is 37 years old. Ermek’s husband works at the poultry factory farm “Shumkar” in the town of Bishkek. Ermek is the mother of five children. At home, together with her children, she does farming as well as provides the services of a seamstress. She needs a loan to purchase 500 kg [1100 lbs] of seed potatoes. Zamira I. is 37 years old. Her husband is a taxi driver. Zamira herself is very hard-working and helps her husband support the family. They have three children, the youngest daughter being only three years of age. Zamira grows various grains and vegetables on her own land plot. She is really hoping to obtain this credit which will allow her to complete the watering of her crops.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fuel and one ton of seed potatoes

loans.name: Yasmeen Abbas' Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen, 27, is from the area of Babar Chowk, Lahore, Pakistan. She is the leader of a 5-member group.  She is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. Her son is in kindergarten, and the others are not yet old enough to attend school.  

This year, Yasmeen joined Asasah to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. To make a better living for her family, she runs a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. She started this business three years ago. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, and has fifteen years of experience in this profession. He purchased a rickshaw three years ago and is paying for it in installments.  Yasmeen is applying for a loan to pay off the remaining instalments, so that her husband can become the full owner of the rickshaw and get better profits from driving.

loans.use: to pay the remaining installments on her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Fousseni

texts.en: Mr. Fousseni A. is a policeman who sells stamps to make some money. He is 44 years old, married, and they have 3 children. As a policeman, he is charged with giving legal authorization to citizens, which is done by stamping papers or applications with various stamps. Mr. A. sells the stamps themselves on the side to make some extra money to help him care for his young family. He is requesting a loan of 360,000 CFA in order to purchase more stamps.

loans.use: To purchase stamps

loans.name: Faavae Setalisa

texts.en: Faavae M. is 43 and married with three children. She owns a business venture selling fried foods in the local community and has many years of experience in this business. Faavae needs a loan of WST 1,950 to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or approximately USD 213 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2008, Faavae joined SPBD and this is her 3rd loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Kweyamba Womens, Namawojjolo-Lugazi Group

texts.en:
37-year-old N. Zam is an optimist; she prefers looking on the positive side of things even when circumstances are not in her favor. She says this has saved her soft drink business from running into the many stonewall challenges that often strike at the root of small businesses like hers. Fifteen years is the time she has been in this business. Her longevity she says is all due to her zeal, involvement, hard work and determination. 

Zam began this business with savings from her farming business. She bought a refrigerator first. In a week, she makes profits that add up to 100,000 shillings. With these she has been able to cater well for her family's needs. With this loan, she wants to purchase more crates of soda and also buy another refrigerator.

loans.use: The purchase of more crates of soda and a refrigerator

loans.name: Liver Pool Group

texts.en:
These entrepreneurs named their group “Liverpool”, after their favourite football team. They are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feeding and clothing them. 

Fatmata K. K. is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka town thirty-two years ago. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a medical practitioner; two of her children are attending primary school and one in secondary school.  

Fatmata sells dishes, clothes, and shoes. She has been running this business for two years now. With her share of this loan she will buy dishes, clothes and shoes wholesale to add to her business inventory. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: Buy dishes, clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Masikizano

texts.en:
Masikizano has been selling food for 18 years. She is a married woman with five daughters, all of whom have already finished their education. She normally cooks chapatti (flat bread) and beans and sells it in the open-air market to her customers.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan, Masikizano wants to buy more wheat flour and beans. 

One of her greatest challenges is seasonality as she cannot sell her food at the market when it’s raining. Masikizano also gets financial support from her children. 

She owns her home, which has electricity but no piped water. She cites electricity as her greatest monthly expense. In the coming years, Masikizano hopes to operate her own food kiosk (hotel).

loans.use: To purchase more wheat flour and beans

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladis; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de venta de artesanías, ella vende las artesanías en las ferias que se realiza en la provincia de Urubamba, ella quiere tener un local donde vender las artesanías ya que por el momento  está vendiendo en forma ambulatoria. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  artesanía al por mayor.

 
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gladis, 26, is a single mother of two children. She alternates her daily activities with crafts sales. She sells quite a few crafts in the markets that take place in Urubamba province. She wants to have a fixed locale to sell her crafts because for the time being she sells them in an ambulatory manner. She is asking for funds to buy crafts at wholesale. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crafts at wholesale.

loans.name: Martha Luisa

texts.es: Martha Luisa P. tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, reside en la Aldea La Concepción en la Ciudad de Juticalpa, departamento de Olancho. El primer negocio de Martha fue la venta de ropa interior de forma ambulante, pero hace 30 años una de sus amigas le ensenó a confeccionar ropa de cama, cortinas, manteles, uniformes, faldas, blusas, pantalones y ahora ella cuenta con su propio taller de costura que está ubicado adentro de las instalaciones del Hospital San Francisco de Asís en la misma ciudad. Martha solicita el préstamo para comprar una cantidad grande de materia prima como telas, hilos, encajes, y elásticos, etc. de este modo podrá ofrecer a su clientes una variedad de productos a un precio accesible, ya que estos son personas de muy escasos recursos económicos que laboran y visitan el hospital. Una de las dificultades de Martha es que padece de presión alta y tiene que comprar todos los meses pastillas para mantener su presión estable. Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando y que su familia siempre permanezca unida. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por dos ciclos y con los préstamos obtenidos ha podido mantener su negocio y ha podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Martha Luisa P. is 54 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children in the village of La Concepción, which is in the city of Juticalpa, department of Olancho. The first business that Martha had was selling underclothes as an itinerant vendor, but 30 years ago, one of her friends taught her to make bed clothes, curtains, tablecloths, uniforms, skirts, blouses, pants, etc. Now she has her own sewing workshop, which is located in the facilities of the San Francisco de Asís Hospital in the same city where she lives. Martha is requesting this loan to buy a large quantity of raw materials like fabric, thread, lace, elastic, etc. In this way, she will be able to offer her customers a variety of products at accessible prices. Her customers are people of very scarce economic resources who work at or visit the hospital. One of the difficulties that Martha faces is that she suffers from high blood pressure and has to buy pills every month to keep her blood pressure stable. Her dream is that her business will continue to prosper and that her family will always remain together. She has been a client of FAMA for two cycles and the loans she has received have helped her to maintain her business and to be able to help her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Gulniza's Group

texts.en:
Gulniza A. is the leader of the group. She is 22 and single. She makes her living by working as a seller in her sister’s shop. Two years ago they decided to start a shop to sell beverages and foodstuff. Later they cooked and sold national food in the nearer canteen. In order to purchase foodstuff for further resale Gulniza hopes to get a loan. In the future, she is planning to get the manager’s position and to get married. 

Abdurahim L. is 31 and married. His wife is a seamstress. Together the couple has two children, one of whom goes to school. Five years ago his parents gave him a calf and a sheep and since then he has been engaged in cattle breeding. With the profits he purchased a sewing machine for his wife and also made house repairs. Abdurahim wants a loan to buy four livestock animals and to finish the house repairs. In the future, Abdurahim wants to purchase a house in Bishkek City.

Tatyana L. is 55 and married. Her spouse is a farmer. The couple has two daughters who are 36 and 31 years old. The elder one is a  seamstress and the younger one is currently unemployed. Tatyana earns money by working as a guard and a charwoman in a school. Tatyana wants a loan to make household improvements. In future, the family is planning to make house repairs and to separate daughters.

Nazokat T. is 39, married and has two children. Her spouse, who supports the family, is a taxi driver. Nazokat works as a charwoman. Her family needs to a loan in order to make house repairs and to arrange her son’s circumcision. In the future, Nazokat is planning to finish the house repairs, plant roses around the house, and purchase a car.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Norn S., 41, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Nornt grow rice and lotus, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband sells fish, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Norn S. has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to transport fish to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport fish

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco D. is from the village of Brgy. Aurora, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 46 years old. Francisco is married and has 4 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Francisco owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing electrical services to local community members. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisco joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Francisco from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy supplies for electrician business

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl tiene 52 años, vive con su esposa y uno de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 30 años elabora faldas típicas de su región, como las de tipo plisadas y las de milrayas, ya que son lo modelos que más demanda tiene. Su trabajo lo realiza en un pequeño taller que acondiciono en su casa, que junto a su esposa y uno familiares trabajan en esta actividad.  Sin embargo hay tiempo en que tiene más pedidos, por lo que se ve en la necesidad de contratar mano de obra de 2 personas más, llevándose el trabajo a casa, de esa manera evita la incomodidad del pequeño espacio que tiene en su taller. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, ya que desde que era muy niña le enseñaron como se debe hacer estas prendas, además que en ese tiempo tiene recuerdos buenos de familia en la que todos trabajaban para sobresalir. Hoy tiene clientes fijos que siempre solicitan de su trabajo, y de aquellos que por recomendación solicitan también de sus servicios. Para el futuro desea renovar sus maquinas de coser. Es el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales e insumos para la elaboración de estas prendas, como: telas e hilos de colores.
texts.en: Raúl is 52 years old and lives with his wife and one of his 3 children in his own home. For more than 30 years he has made typical skirts of his region, such as pleated and striped ones, which are the designs most in demand. He does his work in a small workshop he has fitted out in his home, and works together with his wife and some family members at this activity. Without doubt there are times when he has more order, and sees it necessary to contract more work hands. He was taught to make these garments when he was very small, and he also has good memories of his family all working together to improve their circumstances. Now he has loyal clients that always seek his work, and others that seek his services by recommendation. In the future Raúl wants to repair his sewing machines. This is his second loan with MFP and he is very content knowing that he has financial support. He is also thankful to be part of his communal bank because all the members are people that he knows, and are responsible and supportive. With the loan he is seeking he will invest in the purchase of materials and supplies, such as fabric and threads of different colours, to make his garments.

loans.use: Purchase materials such as fabric and threads to make skirts.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es:
Doña Orbelina, es una señora D. 57 años D. edad, resiD. en Berlín, departamento D. Usulután tiene casa propia donD. vive con su hijo D. 16 años y su esposo, ella administra una tienda desD. hace más D. 20 años, lo inicio por sus propios medios, no tiene horario para atender el negocio ya que está situado en su casa D. habitación. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo en esta ocasión para la compra D. aceite, arroz, frijoles, cereales, gaseosas y gas, con este préstamo ella desea realizar una buena inversión al negocio, impulsándolo para que sea más competente para atender la demanda.
Tener un negocio fuerte, crecer como microempresaria son parte D. las aspiraciones D. doña Orbelina, así como también tener ingresos D. una forma estable para mejorar su condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Orbelina is a 57 year old woman who lives in Berlín, departament of D. Usulután. She owns her own home where she lives with her 16 year old son and her husband. She has run a store for more than 20 years. She started it on her own and has no set schedule to attend to the business, since it is at her house.   

She is asking for a loan at this time to buy oil, rice, grains, soft drinks and natural gas. She wants to make a good investment in her business with this loan, driving it to become more able to respond to demand. 

To have a strong business and to grow as a micro-business woman are a part of Orbelina's dreams. She also wants to have stable income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice, beans, grains, soft drinks and natural gas.

loans.name: Estelle

texts.fr: Estelle est née le 16 Septembre 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Estelle est mariée à un plombier, Lambert, et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Estelle vit avec sa famille au quartier Finagnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis vingt ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Estelle a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour se prendre en charge et nourrir sa famille, Estelle  vend du charbon de bois et également des cartes de recharge téléphonique depuis seize ans environs. Estelle s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. A l'approche des fêtes de nouvel an, Estelle sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer ses activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Estelle was born 16 September 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Lambert, a plumber, and is mother to four children, all attending (or having attended) school. For the past 20 years she has lived with her family in the Finagnon borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple shares responsibility for the various family expenses.

Estelle interrupted her schooling at secondary level. To take charge of herself and feed her family she has been selling charcoal and prepaid phone cards over the past 16 years. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace.

She is a former ALIDé client who reimburses her loans well. With approaching year-end festivities she is requesting a new loan from ALIDé, aiming to strengthen her activity and improve customer satisfaction.

loans.use: Buy sacks of charcoal and prepaid phione cards

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos vive en casa propia en la zona Limanipata, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno es menor de edad; Santos es peluquero y su esposa es  ama de casa, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene. Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos.

El crédito que solicita será utilizado en la construcción de un baño en su casa, pues hasta el momento no cuenta con uno y sería de mucha utilidad e higiene.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Santos lives in his own home in Limanipata, a neighborhood on the periphery of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has three children, one of whom is still a minor.  Santos is a hairdresser and his wife is a housewife.  He supports his family with his income.

This is the first time that Santos has applied for a loan.  He will use his loan to build a bathroom in his home since he doesn't have one right now.  It would be very useful and improve hygiene.

The socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies Santos to receive a loan.

loans.use: To build a bathroom in his home

loans.name: Touba Dabaye Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de TOUBA DABAYE est créé le 28 décembre 2010. Il vient de recevoir son premier financement avec CAURIE-MF. Il est composé de 36 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles sont unies par des liens de solidarité très solides.

Madame PENDA N. debout tout à fait à droite de la photo est responsable du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de  26 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge d'une de ses nièces. 

Elle fait de la broderie de draps de lit. Elle maitrise bien cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plusieurs années. En tant que paysanne elle fait aussi de l'agriculture. 

Son premier prêt avec CAURIE-MF lui permettra d'acheter des tissus et des fournitures de broderie afin de pouvoir faire l'extension de son activité

Son objectif est de soutenir son mai dans la prise en charge de la famille, de participer au payement de la scolarité des enfants et de renforcer son épargne
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois of TOUBA DABAYE was created on December 28, 2010. It has just received its first financing with CAURIE-MF and is comprised of 36 women from the same village. They are united by sturdy ties of solidarity.  

Ms. PENDA N. (standing at the far right in the photo) is the leader of the Banc Villageois. She is 26 years old, married, and the mother of four children to support. She also has one of her nieces in her care.

Ms. N. embroiders bed sheets. Having worked at it for several years, she is mastering this business nicely. As a peasant, she is a farmer as well. Her first loan with CAURIE-MF will enable her to buy cloth and some supplies for embroidery in order to expand her business.  

Her goal is to support her husband in supporting the family, to help cover schooling costs, and to bolster her savings.

loans.use: Buying fabrics and supplies for embroidery

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en:
Genelita A. is 44 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Cawa-Cawa, a part of Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte province on the Mindanao islands. Genelita runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Genelita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase materials for her store’s renovation. Genelita is requesting a new loan, her sixth from PMPC, of 7,000 PHP that will be used to purchase an additional variety of products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg I. is 32 years old and lives in Ijevan City with his wife and his two children.  Gevorg and his wife are accountants. In addition to his work as an accountant, in 2006 Gevorg started a workshop where he produces concrete slabs and stairs.  He sells most of what he produces to customers in Ijevan City, neighboring villages' building materials stores, and he also takes orders on site. 

Gevorg has a mixer, where he mixes sand, cement, and water. After mixing, he pours the concrete into special metal forms and then dries slabs in a natural way. Now Gevorg is asking for a 720,000 Armenian dram (AMD) loan to buy a dryer for the slabs, which will allow him to shorten the period of production time. Thanks to incomes from his cement block and slab business, Gevorg has been able to meet many of his family's financial needs.

loans.use: To buy a dryer for poured concrete slabs.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis, tiene 26 años de edad y tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad Urubamba del departamento de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Gladis se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía en la empresa LANANDINA, ella fabrica chompas, chalinas, chulos de lana de alpaca. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Gladis en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo lana de alpaca.  

Gladis pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gladis is 26 years of age and has two children.  She was born in the city of Urubamba of the department of Cusco and lives in the same city.  Gladis is dedicated to making artesan crafts as part of the LANANDINA enterprise.  She makes sweaters, scarves and ponchos from alpaca wool.  She has been dedicated to this work for four years and it goes well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  At this time, Gladis needs the loan to buy materials such as alpaca wool.   

Gladis belongs to the “Mainique” communal bank of the Arariwa Association and she is thankful for the opportunity offered to her through this medium.  She also promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials such as alpaca wool.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 29 years old and married with two children, ages 3 and 5. Jean Paul has been a motorbike taxi driver for three years. He transports people every day from 5am until 11pm.

Jean Paul has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy a new motorbike to help him. With any profit, he will pay school fees for his children  and save for his future.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Laureano Aparicio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua. El  Sr.Laureano Aparicio P. , se dedica  arduamente a laborar como agente de seguridad , dedicándose a esta labor desde hace diez años, es casado y con dos hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen.
Una de las necesidades que el  Sr. Laureano atraviesa hoy en dia es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que a tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora. Es por ese motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento y arena, Para realizar la mejora de  la vivienda realizando  la construccion de un muro en  su casa de habitación. 
Por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos. Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra, le proporcionara a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Laureano Aparicio P. works hard as a security guard.  He has been working in this job for 10 years, he is married and has 2 children whom he has to provide the necessary conditions for in order for them to grow.

One of the necessities Laureano comes across now and days is that he needs to improve his living conditions due to the bad condition it has been in.  This is why he has made the wise decision to initiate the improvements and the motive for approaching CEPRODEL to solicit a loan for the purchase of construction materials, like: stone, cement, and sand.  To realize the home improvement he will build a wall at his home.  By performing this home improvement, he will provide a better quality of life to his children.  It is important to stress that by performing this work, he will provide his family a decent home to live in with all the necessary conditions for his kids to grow.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like: stone, sand, and cement.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: Elvia tiene 43 años y estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria comenta que no termino sus estudios ya que sus papas no tuvieron el dinero suficiente para seguirla apoyando con los gastos de la escuela. Doña Elvia está casada con el señor Lemuel él se dedica a vender animales como borregos y vacas, ellos tienen 6 hijos pero nada más uno vive con ellos llamado Ricardo el cual trabaja con su papa y ayuda a vender los animales. Ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catalogo como cremas, cosméticos etc. También vende lencería para dama por catalogo y vende artículos de plástico para la cocina. Lleva con esta actividad aproximadamente 6 años, decidió emprender este negocio para ayudar con su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos ya que hubo un tiempo que todos estaban estudiando y tenían que pagar colegiaturas y rentas en otras ciudades donde estudiaban ellos. Doña Elvia está solicitando su préstamo para invertir en artículos de plástico para cocina, lencería y cosméticos para tener en existencia y no pedirlos por que es algo tardado los pedidos que realiza.
texts.en:
Elvia is 43 years of age and studied up to the second year of middle school. She mentions that she didn't finish her schooling because her mom and dad did not have enough money to continue supporting her with money for school expenses. Doña Elvia is married to Señor Lemuel who raises animals such as sheep and cattle. They have six children but only one of them lives with them, Richard, who works with his dad and helps sell the animals. She sells beauty products by catalog such as creams, cosmetics and so forth. She also sells lingerie for women by catalog and plastic kitchen items. She went into business approximately six years ago in order to help her husband pay the children's expenses because there was a time in which they were all in school and they had to pay school fees and housing costs in other cities where they were attending school. 

Doña Elvia is requesting her loan to invest in plastic kitchen items, lingerie and cosmetics in order to have them in stock and not have to put in orders, since the orders she places are somewhat delayed.

loans.use: to sell cosmetics and lingerie by catalog and also plastic kitchen items.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married. She and her family live in Pavlograd. Yelena runs a small retail business selling bed linens and sheets, as well as artificial flowers. She owns a kiosk at a local central marketplace. Yelena has been in this business for 2 years. She likes being self-employed and works hard to make her business successful and sustainable. 

Yelena’s business is the only source of income for the family. Yelena is requesting a loan of 9,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted artificial flowers for the " commemoration" days in Ukraine. They are several weeks after the Easter weekend when people go to the graveyards to remember their loved ones who passed away.  They decorate their graves with flowers and wreaths. Yelena is re-stocking her merchandise to meet the demand among her customers this season.

loans.use: to purchase assorted artificial flowers

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is a 41-year-old worker from the village of Badiauri, East Georgia. He is unmarried and lives with his younger brother and mother. 

Ivane is a worker for the Georgian Railway Company. Along with his regular job, Ivane and his brother are leading the farming activities of the family. In particular, they have 3 milk cows and 36 sheep. They sell traditional Georgian cheese and lambs on the local market. 

With the requested loan, Ivane plans to cultivate the family-owned plot and plant watermelon. He plans to sell the harvested watermelons locally to the retailers of fruits and vegetables. Part of the gained profit will be used for covering family everyday expenses and the other part will be reinvested in the dairy farm.

loans.use: to pay for cultivation of the land and watermelon seeds

loans.name: Videla

texts.es: Videla tiene 60 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo menor Jelmar D. 28 años y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad D. vida. Una D. las tiendas D. abarrotes más concurridas D. la ciudad D. Pucallpa, es la D. Videla, quien a partir D. las 6 D. la mañana empieza con la atención a sus clientes y no para hasta las 9 ó 10 D. la noche. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre recibe con una sonrisa a las personas que concurren a su tienda. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, sin embargo el tener que permanecer parada todo el tiempo afecta sus riñones, además desea también atender a su familia, pero sabe que es parte del sacrificio para salir adelante. Para el futuro  desea que su tienda crezca y se convierta en la principal D. su barrio. Por ello espera D. su apoyo con un pequeño préstamo para que pueda invertir en su negocio. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y esta segura D. poder pagar todas sus cuentas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una D. las socias más alegres y responsables. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Videla is 60 years old.  She is a very simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her beloved son, 28 year-old Jelmar.  She is prepared to work very hard to improve her quality of life.

Videla's grocery store is one of the busiest in the city of Pucallpa.  She starts serving her customers from 6 o'clock in the morning and doesn't stop until 9 or 10 o'clock at night.  She is a very cheerful saleswoman who always greets customers who come to her store with a smile.  She has been in this business for two years and what she most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers.  Having to stay on her feet all day affects her kidneys and she would like to be able to have time to look after her family but Videla knows that this is all part of the sacrifice she must make in order to get ahead in life.

In the future, Videla would like her store to grow and become the main one in her neighborhood.  For this reason, she hopes that you will support her with this small loan so that she can invest in her business.

This is Videla's second loan from MFP and she is certain that she will be able to make all of her repayments on time.  She is one of the most cheerful and responsible members of her community bank.  Videla will use the 800 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy more products with which to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store

loans.name: Dany Oswaldo
