texts.en: Dany lives in the town of Danli in southern Honduras. He has run a small grocery shop for the last three years, and also delivers eggs to local customers several days a week. Dany is requesting a loan of 16,000 HNL in order to buy merchandise for his small store.

loans.use: to purchase meat, cheese, eggs, fruits, vegetables, snacks, beverages, cooking oil, personal hygiene products and household cleaning products.

loans.name: Nelly Guadalupe

texts.en: Nelly is 43 years old and lives in the city of Ibarra in northern Ecuador. She is separated and lives with her three daughters: Jessica, 17; Diana, 15; and Adaluz, 9. Nelly is a person who likes to move forward with her life and pull herself up without fear of falling down. She is simply a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her children. Nelly is a seamstress who manufactures sportswear and clothing. She used to work at home, but with a previous loan she purchased a store. She is requesting this loan, her 10th, to buy fabric and materials to fulfill a large order of sports uniforms. She works alone, but her daughter Diana helps her in her free time away from school. Her past loans have helped her expand her business. She now carries more goods, has more supplies, and carries more colors and sizes. She has been able to buy more machines and has given economic stability to her daughters. Nelly's dream is to have a large factory and provide work for others. She also dreams of purchasing a home for her family, and that her daughters will not have the economic problems she has had in her life.

loans.use: to buy cloth to fill her orders for sports uniforms

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last three years. She is 34 years old and a single mother of three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She normally sells her produce at Njabini market.

In the future, Eunice hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Noel Agustin

texts.es: Noel Agustín él se dedica a la compra de mariscos, empezó este negocio con un hermano. El trabaja todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde pues tiene que levantarse temprano para alistar su bote y todas las herramientas necesarias para su trabajo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de motor, proporcionarle mejoras a su lancha y compra de combustible que está muy caro. Desea realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Noel Agustín is a seafood merchant; he started the business with his brother.  He works every day starting at 5am and goes until 6pm because he has to rise early to get his boat and all the necessary tools ready for work.

The loan he’s requesting is to buy an engine, to do some repair work on his boat and to buy fuel which is very expensive.  He hopes to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy an engine and to buy fuel.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina es originaria de una localidad llena de cultura ya que muy cerca de su casa se encuentra la zona arqueológica y también se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca. Cata como es conocida en su localidad tiene 35 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria y que ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios porque sus papas eran personas de bajos recursos y no tenían dinero para comprarle las libretas. Doña Cata se dedica a la venta de dulces y frituras desde hace 6 años, dice que ella esta pidió el préstamo a Fundación Realidad para invertir en la compra de dulces de diferentes sabores, chicharrones, sopas instantáneas, café, te, chicharrones preparados, refrescos, jugos y un poco de abarrotes ya que ese ha sido su sueño hacer una tienda de abarrotes. También tiene en su local unas maquinitas de juego de video donde los niños de su localidad van a divertirse un rato. Dice que decidió emprendes el negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su casa y también porque se quería sentir útil. Ella surte en diferentes tiendas de la población de Zitacuaro, la meta que tiene Catalina es seguir invirtiendo en abarrotes ya que dice que es un buen negocio y se le gana muy bien a los productos pero sin descuidar su negocio de los dulces ya que el local que tiene en su casa es muy amplio. Doña Catalina esta casada con el señor Juan el cual es chofer de transporte publico, ellos no tienen hijos pero el sueño de doña Catalina seria tener un bebe.
texts.en: Catalina is from a town rich in culture.  The archeological sites near her house are well known and there's also a butterfly sanctuary.  Cata, as she is know, is 35 years old.  She left school after the sixth grade because her family didn't have enough money for her to continue.  Dona Cata has operated a business buying and selling snacks and other merchandise for 6 years.  She is applying to Fundacion Realidad for a loan so that she can stock the business with merchandise that she will resell: fried snacks, instant soups, coffee, tea, soft drinks, juices, etc.  She wants to add a few grocery items because she wants to start a grocery business in the future.  She also has a few video games for the neighborhood kids.  She says that she decided to start the business to help her husband with household expenses.  She also wanted to do something that would make her feel useful.  She buys her stock from various stores in Zitacuaro.  Her goal is to continue building her grocery business because it's a good business and a profitable one.  She doesn't want to give up her snacks business, though, because she has enough space in her shop for both.  Dona Catalina and her husband, Sr. Juan, a bus driver, have no children but she would like to have a baby one day.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel tiene 48 años de edad vive con su esposo e hijos y es vecina de una comunidad ubicada en la Costa Pacifico Sur de Costa Rica, llamada La Palma de Puerto Jimenez, en la provincia de Puntarenas. Es una zona que ha crecido comercial y portuariamente, muy explotada ya que, poseen hermosas playas a su alrededor. Se da mucho lo que es la pesca, la agricultura y ganadería. Esta comunidad está llena de costumbres y actividades.

Desde hace varios años que Maria Isabel se dedica a trabajar por las ventas por catalogo para superarse cada día. Dice que desde que  ingreso a este negocio los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

En estos momentos lo que desea Maria Isabel es solicitar un préstamo por ¢100,000 (cien mil colones) para la compra de zapatos por medio de su catalogo, para así venderlos y obtener ganancia para incrementar su recursos económicos. Ella espera vender muchos productos para su familia y llegar a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.  
Dice que ha sentido el apoyo de su esposo y el beneficio que le hace a los vecinos de la comunidad.

Maria Isabel es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Raíces Capitales S.A,  razón por la cual dice sentirse  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 48 years old and lives with her husband and children. She is a resident of a community called La Palma de Puerto Jimenez, which is located along the southern Pacific coast of Costa Rica in Puntarenas Province. This area has taken advantage of the growing number of ports and commercial centers. The surrounding areas have beautiful beaches and most of the business activities involve fishing, agriculture, and livestock breeding. The community is full of customs and activities.

For the past several years, Maria Isabel has been selling shoes through catalogs in order to move forward each day. She says that the income from this business has been good since she has already been well-received in her community. The income she generates helps her family to get ahead.

At this moment, Maria Isabel is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 CRC so that she can buy shoes through her catalog in order to sell them and obtain more income to increase her financial resources. She hopes to sell many more products for her family so that she can have more income to improve their living conditions. Maria Isabel says that she has the support of her husband and the good will of the neighbors in the community.

She is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of Raíces Capitales, S.A. Maria Isabel is very grateful for the opportunity to access credit so that she can carry out her projects in life.

loans.use: to buy shoes through catalogs.

loans.name: Joe Ann

texts.en:
Joe Ann is 22 years old and married with two children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past four years, Joe Ann has been a farmer and grows a sort of palay (unmilled rice) to earn a living. She has been unable to escape from the inevitable plant devastation due to natural calamities and unfavorable phenomenon which collectively decreases her production. She joined GDMPC earlier this year. Joe Ann earns an approximate total of 10,000 PHP each month.

Joe Ann is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to reap a good harvest with her investment and apply appropriate pest-and-insect-killing fertilizer to boost growth and avoid the loss of capital. Joe Ann is planning to expand her business to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Teresa

texts.es:
Ana de 46 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que vende ropa desde muy temprano en la mañana. Desde que su esposo la abandono y se quedo con su hija pequeña ella decidió emprender su propio negocio para poder generar sus propios ingresos. 

En la actualidad vende pantalones, blusas, toallas a un valor muy económico para sus clientes. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con un préstamo para comprar pantalones, camisas, etc.  En el futuro quiere incrementar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old. She is a hardworking worman who sells clothes very early in the morning. Since being abandoned by her husband and left alone with a young daughter, she decided to start her own business to generate her own income.

Currently she sells trousers, blouses, towels all at very reasonable prices for her clients. She has many aspirations for her business which is why she wants to continue with a loan to buy trousers, shirts, etc. In the future, she wants to increase sales of her business.

loans.use: to buy trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Farhat Noreen's Group

texts.en:
A talented lady, Farhat Noreen operates a beauty salon at her home. She offers her customers makeup, facials and hair cutting services. Her customers are very satisfied with her work. They prefer getting services from her and avoid going anywhere else. 

She likes her profession very much and keeps herself updated about the latest trends.  

Besides her business, she also manages her household responsibilities efficiently. She takes care of her family and gives them the desired time. Her family respects her and loves her a lot due to her care for them. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her beauty salon business. With the loan, she will buy makeup items like mascara, eye shadows, lipstick and nail polishes, etc., and beauty products such as face creams and masks for her salon to produce better quality work and get good income.
 
She is confident that she will take her business to a more profitable position with the loan investment and improve the lifestyle of her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Farhat Noreen.

loans.use: To buy makeup items and beauty products for the beauty salon business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 35 years of age and married, with three children. Ruth owns & operates a business venture, baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.    Ruth needs a loan of WST1500 to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, baking powder and baking utensils.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Ruth joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ruth's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, baking powder and baking utensils

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 55 years old.  She is married and has 2 children. Virginia has a shop that sells coco vinegar and coconut wine. She has had this business for 4 years.  

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy  additional coconut wine and vinegar to sell in the market. Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Virginia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut wine to sell in the market

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen sews clothes to financially support her husband. Due to her high-quality work, she receives regular orders every month. She charges 150 PKRs per dress and uses that income to pay her children's school fees. She has a daughter and a son. Her son is in fifth standard while her daughter is studying in class ninth. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to the passengers. 

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, her husband will repair his rickshaw because its engine is creating a problem. 

She is very hopeful that after repairing his rickshaw, her husband will be able to provide better transport services to passengers and earn more profit.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has a food production business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling fish and making furniture. Gina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and utensils for her food production business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and utensils

loans.name: Angelina Katuu

texts.en: Angelina is married and has five children ranging from eleven to nineteen years.She describes herself as an understanding, active, and punctual woman. She runs a salon where she renders her services to local residents at Gataka in the Rongai Shopping Centre. Her beauty salon is faced with the problem of customers delaying their payments. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy braids and chemicals. In the future, Angelina wants to be a wholesaler and supplier of her beauty products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy braids and chemicals.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. His elder two children are employed, and his youngest one is a college student. He started his second-hand garment retailing business in 2005 by renting a counter in a market. Now that he running his business for a long time, he has gained many customers and trusted suppliers however, his suppliers aren't enough therefore, he's requesting 1,200,000 MNT to buy more used garments from Erlian.

loans.use: To buy more used garments

loans.name: Sylvia Mirembe

texts.en:
Soft and hard beverages is what this 29-year-old mother of 3 sells at her pub in Mubende. Sylvia Mirembe has been in this business for the last 5 years.
She says expansion is on the horizon.
At present, her monthly sales returns are to the tune of UGX, 500,000.
Farming is her other passion.
Sylvia Mirembe intends to use her loan to purchase more crates of beer, soda, and mineral water to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of beer, soda and mineral water to resell

loans.name: Absa

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme célibataire , mère d'un enfant qui vient d'entrer à l'école primaire cette année.Elle est employée comme vendeuse de pain dans une boulangerie. Elle exerce aussi pendant ses heures libres un commerce de draps, de nappes et de voiles pour femmes.Elle vit avec sa maman et un de ses trois jeunes frères. Ses activités lui permettent de prendre en charge toutes les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un prêt de 200 000f pour acheter des draps, des nappes et des voiles. Son ambition est de se lancer plus tard dans l'import et l'export de produits ménagers.
texts.en:
Absa is single and the mother of a child who started primary school this year. She is employed in a bakery, where she sells bread. During her spare time, she sells sheets, table cloths and veils for women. She lives together with her mother and one of her younger brothers. Her earnings allow her to take care of all her family´s living expenses.

Absa is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs so that she can restock on sheets, table cloths and veils, and thereby increase her business. She would eventually like to start an import-export business dealing in household products.

loans.use: to buy sheets, table cloths and veils for resale.

loans.name: Sara María

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 55 años. Vive junto a su esposo Glovio y sus dos pequeños hijos que están cursando la educación básica. Residen el recinto "Las Mercedes" ubicado en la parte rural de "Santo Domingo# que es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda su capital entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno. 

Junto a su esposo, Sara se dedica a la criar animales para luego venderlos. La jornada diaria es dura ya que en el campo hay muchas actividades que requieren fuerza física. Este matrimonio ha superado muchos obstáculos entre los cuales el más importante fue la llegada de una peste que mató casi a todos sus animales; sin embargo han sabido levantarse y continuar para así poder dar a su hogar lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Sara quiere invertir en comprar pollos ya que la demanda de estos se ha incrementado; hace dos años ella obtuvo un crédito con un grupo de emprendedoras en Fundación Alternativa, quien la ha calificado como una clienta puntual, y ahora ella vuelve por su segundo crédito, esta vez el crédito lo realizará junto a su esposo.

Sara siempre ha sido una mujer que supera obstáculos, y estamos seguros de que le irá bien con esta inversión y que podrá tener mejores ingresos como lo ha planificado.
texts.en:
Sara is a 55-year old woman who lives with her husband Glovio and their two children who attend school. They live in the neighbourhood of Las Mercedes in the rural area of Santo Domingo which is a canton in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, one of Ecuador’s most densely populated provinces. It attracts many visitors as there are several monuments in the capital city including the Monumento al Indio Colorado. Santo Domingo is a privileged canton because of its wonderful, hardworking and enterprising people. They work tirelessly to get on in life and always welcome tourists with open arms, keen to show them their wonderful culture and local sights.

Sara and her husband raise and sell animals for a living. Their daily work is hard as in the countryside there are always lots of chores which require a great physical effort. The two of them have overcome many obstacles including a disease which killed almost all their animals. However, they always picked themselves up and carried on so they could support their family properly. 

Sara wants to buy some chickens as the demand for them has increased. Two years ago she obtained a group loan from Fundación Alternativa. She paid her dues on time, and now she and her husband are looking for a second loan. She has always been a woman who could overcome problems, and we are certain that Sara will do well with this venture and achieve her goal of earning more money.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Lucila Giralda

texts.es:
Lucila Geralda tiene 53 años de edad es soltera, tiene 3 hijos vive con los hijos de 36, 26 y 18 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Lucila se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, líquidos, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podra arrendar más terrenos para poder sembrar y no tener inconvenientes. El sueño es poder comprar una casa.

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear por el campo.
texts.en:
Lucila Giralda, 53, is single and has three children; she lives with her children who are 36, 26 and 18 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “La Unión” communal bank is located in Recinto Aguas Frías which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  It’s dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and bean farming.

Lucila is a corn and bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales of farming products take place in Ventanas.

She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer and liquids.  With support from the loan he’ll be able to lease more land to farm problem-free.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house.  In her free time she enjoys going out into the countryside.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, liquids and fertilizer.

loans.name: Abduvakos

texts.ru: Абдувакос 54 летный мужчина города Исфара. Он женат и отец троих детей. Абдувакос живет вместе с матерью, женой и детьми. Его отец был пекарем, и научил Абдувакос как испечь лепешки. Сейчас Абдувакос решил идти по стопам отца, и более 10 лет он продвигает свою работу. Он печеть вкусные лепешки. У него имеется клиенты которые каждый день закажут Абдувакос испесть 100-200 лепешки. Еще Абдувакос имеет не большой земельный участок во даоре. Он занимается растениеводством. Абдувас готовил почву для посева урожай. Он хочет приобрести минеральные удобрение исемена кукурузу.   К сожалению, у него нет сумма денег для пртобретения необходимые срество. По этой причине Абдувакос обратился за кредитом. Абдувакос больше времени проводит в пекарне и поэтому его сфотографировали в пекарне.
texts.en:
Abudvakos is a 54 year old man from Isfara city. He is married and has three children. Abduvakos lives together with his mother, wife and children. His father was a baker, and taught Abduvakos how to bake flatbreads. 

Now Abduvakos decided to follow in his father's footsteps, and for more than 10 years he has been pushing forward with his work. He bakes delicious flatbreads. He has clients who order 100-200 flatbreads every day. 

Abduvakos also has a small plot of land in his yard. He cultivates crops. Abduvas prepared soil for sowing crops. He wants to obtain mineral fertilisers and corn seeds. Unfortunately, he does not have the money for obtaining the needed resources. For this reason, Abduvakos has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilisers and corn seeds.

loans.name: Los Quinuales - Concepcion Group

texts.es: Madeline de 23 años es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Al ver que el dinero no alcanzaba para hacer frente a los gastos de su hogar decidió alquilar un stand por el mercado. Su deseo mas grande es tener un minimarket.El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería de abarrotes al por mayor porque asi le sale mas barato y tener ganancias al venderlos. Pertenecer al banquito "Los Quinuales" le ha ayudado a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Se siente muy agradecida con las personas de Kiva por ayudar a cumplir sus metas. Madeline es la segunda que esta a la mano derecha con una chompa de color rosada con buzo negro.
texts.en:
Madeline is 23 years old is in a relationship and has 2 young children. Upon seeing that the money wasn't sufficient to cover the household expenses, she decided to rent a stand at the market. Her biggest wish is to have a mini-market.

She will invest the loan the purchase of wholesale groceries because they are sold at a cheaper price and she can make a profit selling them. Belonging to the "Los Quinuales" communal bank has helped her to have a better quality of life.

She is very grateful for the people of Kiva for helping her to accomplish her goals. In the photo, she is the second from the left-hand side wearing a pink sweater with black pants.

loans.use: to buy general wholesale groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia and her husband are engaged in the fishing business, like most people in Iloilo, Philippines. She and her family live in the town of Concepcion, in Iloilo. They have four children to raise ages; 15, 14, 7 and 6 months old. Virginia and her husband have been doing this business for four years. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fishing boat engine. In this way, she and her husband were able to improve their catch for their children’s education. 

Virginia’s goal in life is to see her children become professionals and have better lives.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fishing boat engine

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon O. is married and has 7 children.

Simon O. started a drug shop after selling 3 goats he had reared at home for three years. He got some profits and decided to divert to a drug shop business (buying and selling of human medicines).

This business is special in that it deals in the human medicine and is located in the village. Today, so many people are sick in the community such that the small health centers in the villages doesen't have enough medicine to give out to the patients. Most medical personels just recommend their patients to go and buy medicine in private drug shops, for the Govornment really stocks medicine in the rural heath centres.

But this bussiness is strategically placed deep in the rural area. Given a loan of $500, Simon plans to increase the stock by buying more medicines that is not in his stock and yet it is very much needed by the patients in the village. This will make this bussiness to earn more profit to pay the loan and increse the stock.This will fetch him enough money and profit that can help him in his family and refund of the loan.

He attended training on business skills organized by VEF and is very capable of using this loan well and repaying it in full.

loans.use: Buying of medicine for rural drug shop

loans.name: Yessy

texts.en:
My name is Yessy A. and I sell chains, earrings, rings, bracelets, ceramic and gold bangles, for women. I have had my business for 3 years and I have a good clientel as they appreciate the good quality of my products, as ceramic is very durable. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to have a wider variety of products and with the additional earnings, I will be able to feed my family and to give a dignified education to my two children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Yessy A. me dedico a la venta de cadenas, aritos, anillos, pulseras, esclavas de enchape de oro para damas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusto mucho la calidad de mi producto ya que el enchape es muy duradero, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor varidad de productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y darles estudios dignos a mis dos hijos.

loans.use: To purchase: necklace chains, earrings, rings, bracelets, bangles, and nail polishes.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a hairdresser and owns her own shop, Juliet's Hair Salon. She is a client of the Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH programme. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of necessary materials and creation of a workshop

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina V. C. is 48 years old, single, and has 6 children ranging from 8 to 18. She raises lambs to sell. She has bought a little bit of land to graze the sheep and to build a little shelter for them. She'll use this loan to buy another lamb to raise for later sale. This is her first loan with Friendship Bridge (and the first formal loan of any kind ever) and is thus a big step. Her dream is that her herd will grow and help support her family.

Catarina is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in Ixil.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase a lamb to raise

loans.name: Celia Catalina

texts.es:
CELIA CATALINA and her husband are artisans. He makes pants, shirts for boys, and he cuts the fabric which Celia needs for her embroidery. They also have in their home a small location where they sell thread, fabric and needles. She is part of the solidarity group called Libélula 2, along with Ms. Juana Sánchez Vázquez (artisan) and Ms. Pascuala Vázquez Montejo (artisan). All will invest their loans in the purchase of thread in bulk and in that way increase production.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

CELIA CATALINA junto con su esposo son artesanos, él hace pantalones, camisas para varones y corta la tela que Celia necesita para que lo borde. También tienen en su casa un pequeño local en donde venden hilos, telas, agujas. Forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Libélula 2 junto con doña Juana Sánchez Vázquez (artesana) y doña Pascuala Vázquez Montejo (artesana). Ambas con sus prestamos invertirán en la compra de hilo al por mayor y así aumentar la producción.

loans.use: HANDICRAFTS

loans.name: Delia Flora

texts.es:
Delia Flora is an enthusiastic and enterprising mother of three children. She has been separated from her husband for eight years and has been solely responsible for the well-being and safety of her children since then. Delia Flora attends to her grocery store from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m., and thanks to her charisma and variety of merchandise, her store has become one of the most visited in the area. This hard-working mother does artisanship in her spare time, an activity for which she is very well-known and respected by her neighbors. Delia Flora's wish is to offer her three children a better quality of life, and above everything, a profession. To make this a reality, she wants to expand her store and increase the variety of merchandise so the economic benefits that she obtains will better their quality of life. Let's help Flora achieve her dreams in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Delia Flora, es una entusiasta y emprendedora madre de tres hijos, está separada de su esposo hace ocho años y desde entonces vela sola por el bienestar y seguridad de sus pequeños; Delia Flora atiende su despensa desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche, gracias a su carisma y variedad de su mercadería ésta se ha convertido en una de las tienditas más visitadas de su zona. Esta laboriosa madre en sus horas libres también se dedica a la artesanía, actividad por la que es muy conocida y respetada por sus vecinos.El deseo de Delia Flora es ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus tres queridos hijos y sobre todo una profesión. Para hacer realidad esto ella pretende ampliar su tiendita y aumentar la variedad de su mercadería para que con los beneficios económicos que obtenga mejorar su nivel de vida.Hagamos que Flora lleve a cabo sus sueños en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Improving her store and purchasing a larger quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Hasanaga

texts.en: Two years ago Hasanaga started this business. He transports furniture with his truck for sale in furniture shops. Hasanaga is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children. He lives in Khachmaz town. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts for this lorry in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria E. is 30 years old, married and has four children. She lives in the town of Igbede in Lagos State, Nigeria, where she supports her family by selling clothing, renting out videos and CDs, and designing fashions. She has learned these trades over the past two years, but has been in business for herself since 1999. She has been a LAPO client for two years, and has applied for a new loan of $450 to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Kirangira West B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Edith K.. She is currently in the business of selling fruit and is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to sell. Edith is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a carpenter. She has 6 children ranging from age 8 to 22 and her children go to school. Each week, Edith makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost business. Edith has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300,000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Edith is joined in her small group by Tom N., Betty M., Irene L., and Madina N.. Tom N. has a business in catering and wants to purchase more raw food and cooking ingredients. Betty M. is currently operating a business selling bananas and wants a loan to boost business. Irene L. operates a farming business and wants to uplift business. Madina N. is currently in the business of sugar wax selling and is requesting a loan to add to the business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Laadi

texts.en: A. Laadi is a trader who sells beans, groundnuts and other foods. She is married to a commercial driver and has 3 children. She wants to expand her business and increase her sales. She is asking for $850 to enable her buy more beans and groundnuts to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis is a young worker who loves art, and therefore shapes his energy and dedication into each of his pieces. After much sacrifice Luis opened a store two years ago, and sells paintings and other artwork that he creates himself. He is very happy with his work and would like to increase his working capital. With this money he will improve his store as well as the quality and variety of the products that he sells to thousands of tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

LUIS, es un joven trabajador que ama con mucha fuerza su actividad artesanal y por esa razón plasma su esfuerzo y dedicación en cada uno de ellos; con mucho sacrificio ha podido instalar hace un par de años un pequeño espacio de venta continua en el que oferta pinturas y objetos fabricados por él.Esta muy satisfecho con su labor y desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para mejorar su establecimiento y la calidad y variedad de los productos que oferta a miles de turistas.

loans.use: Improve the quality and variety of the beautiful pieces that he sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a knitting machine and wool.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Mr. Manuel de Jesús is requesting a loan to invest in the improvement of his house, by plastering the walls and putting in a ceramic floor.

He has worked for 17 years and the director of the Rafaela Herrera school in the La Fonseca neighborhood, located 30 km from Nueva Guinea. He has three children, the oldest daughter is 20 years old and is in her third year of university study, his younger son is 14 years old and is in the fourth year of secondary education and his youngest son is 10 years old and in the fifth grade.

With a lot of effort, he has managed to provide for his children. His wife also works as a teacher and ,as such, contributes to covering the household expenses. His dream is that his children continue studying, having a decent home with better conditions, and job stability to continue providing for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Manuel de Jesús está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es repellar y ponerle la ceramica a la casa. Desde hace 17 años trabaja como director de la Escuela Rafaela Herrera en colonia la Fonseca a 30 km de Nueva Guinea. Tiene 3 hijos, la hija mayor de 20 años estudia su tercer año en la Universidad, su otro hijo tiene 14 años estudia su 4to año de educación secundaria y su hijo menor de 10 años estudia 5to grado. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante, su esposa trabaja como docente y aporta con los gastos familiares, su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: Plaster the walls and put a floor in his house

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
Jhon was excited about finishing a university career but his economic possibilities postponed this project. He currently works trading electronic appliances, merchandise which he brings from the city of Tacna and the neighboring country of Bolivia and sells in the Riconada mine with a significant profit margin. Thanks to the benefits that he receives he can contribute to the household expenses of his small house and in this way he compensates his dear mother for the love, education and good example that she always gave him. To continue with this business he requires an investment and he sees the need for a loan, money which he promises to pay back in the period mentioned.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Jhon tenía muchas ilusiones de concluir una carrera universitaria pero sus posibilidades económicas postergaron este proyecto, actualmente se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de artefactos eléctricos, mercadería que trae de la ciudad de Tacna y del vecino país de Bolivia ofreciéndolos en la mina Rinconada con un significativo margen de ganancia, gracias a los beneficios que obtiene puede colaborar con los gastos de la canasta familiar de su hogar y la refacción de su pequeña casa, de esta manera compensar a su querida madre por el amor, educación y buen ejemplo que en todo momento le brindó. Para continuar con este negocio requiere de una inversión, por ello, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar gentilmente un préstamo, dinero que promete rembolsar en el plazo mencionado.

loans.use: Investment capital for his appliance business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 10 and 8. She owns and has run a small beauty salon since 2001. Every day, she works from 9am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her work.

Janeth now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for expansion of her business

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.en: K. Hidoyat is a dynamic and ambitious 36-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. For 4 years she has had a small business processing dried fruit. Thanks to the quality of her products, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown. This allows Hidoyat to contribute significantly to the household and education of her children. Today Hidoyat requests $900 for the term of 8 months. She is going to use the loan for purchasing dried fruits for the purpose of processing and reselling them. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots

loans.name: Evelyn Brigida

texts.es: La señora Evelyn, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo en edad escolar, a quien mantiene y por quien trabaja con mucho esmero. Viven en una pequeña casa que comparte con su madre quien le ayuda en la alimentacion y los cuidados del niño mientras ella trabaja. Laboralmente la señora cuenta con un pequeño restaurante, dónde ella misma cocina y atiende a los clientes, este su pequeño negocio, es el unico ingreso con que cuenta para solventar todos los gastos familiares, además de los estudios de su niño. Es una persona muy responsable y cumplida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evelyn is a single mother. She has a school aged son who she supports and is the reason she works so hard. They live in a small house she shares with her mother, who helps feed and care for her son while she works. Work-wise, Mrs. Evelyn owns a small restaurant where she cooks and serves her customers. This small restaurant is the only source of income she has to pay for family expenses and her son's studies. She is very responsible and dependable person.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kitchen utensils

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 41 años, hace 22 años vive con su pareja, tienen 4 hijos, ella y su esposo trabajan juntos en la chacra. Isabel es la primera en madrugar en casa, se levanta a las 5.00 a.m para que prepare un nutritivo desayuno para que puedan soportar el trabajo duro de la chacra, cuando era soltera no se dedicaba mucho a la chacra porque su padre no le permitía, pero desde que tuvo su esposo empezó a trabajar, en inicios en chacras ajenas macheteando y por ello le pagaban. Pero después, ya con el tiempo empezaron a sembrar sus propios cultivos y notaron que les era más rentable. Su dificultad principal es la falta de dinero para transportar los mamones de plátanos, los cítricos y las yucas, no les queda otra opción de vender en sus chacras pero a menor precio. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita comprará plantas cítricas, además contratará peones para que a base de macheteo quiten los arbustos de su chacra y poder sembrar otros productos.
texts.en:
Isabel is 41 and has been living with her spouse for 22 years. They have 4 children, and she and her husband work together in agriculture. Isabel is the first to rise in the morning, getting up at 5 a.m. to prepare a nutritious breakfast so they can sustain the hard work of agriculture. When she was single, she did not work much in agriculture because her father would not allow her, but after she married her husband she started to work. In the beginning she was paid to clear other people's fields, but afterwards they started to plant their own fields and realized this was more profitable for them. The main difficulty is the lack of money to transport the bananas, citrus, and yucca, so they have no other option than to sell from the field at a lower price. This is the first loan she has taken with MFP. With the money she is requesting, she will buy citrus seedlings and will hire field workers to clear the brush from her field so she can plant more crops.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of citrus seedlings and to hire field workers

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan C., 43, is the mother of four children. The two eldest are married. Her third child is construction worker and the youngest, a daughter, is a garment worker. C. makes a living growing vegetables, which she sells three months after planting. She has been engaging in this business since 2005. Her husband, Mr. Phin Sarin, 48, is a local teacher. C. is requesting a $500 loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her husband to provide him with a means of transportation. The family lives in Pursat Province.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramón Timoteo Marin, de 30 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de  San Ignacio Misiones.,en pareja, con Teresa Lared, tiene 1 hija menor de edad. Mensualmente recorre varios kilómetros para distribuir su mercadería ya que es vendedor ambulante. Su pareja posee un negocio de mercería sobre la avenida principal de esta ciudad. 
 Solicitó de este préstamo en nuestra institución para comprar mercaderías para aprovechar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón Timoteo M. is 30 years old and lives in the city of San Ignacio Misiones with his partner, Teresa Lared, and has a young daughter. As a traveling merchant, he covers various kilometers monthly selling his merchandise. His partner owns a notions store on the main avenue in the city. He applied for this loan with our institution to buy merchandise to take advantage of the holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots, sheets, and housewares

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice S. is forty two years old.  She is married and has given birth to six children - three boys and three daughters.  One has completed junior high school while the rest are all in the basic and elementary schools.  

Her husband is a farmer.  He cultivates palm nuts in the community where they live.  Beatrice lives with her family in a family mud-house at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  

Offinso is farming and commercial town.  Most of the inhabitants are either farmers or trade in farm produce.  Very few people are in an official occupation.  

Beatrice deals in palm nuts.  She procures palm nuts from the farmers in her community and her husband’s farm.  She says that, at times, she travels to nearby villages to buy palm nuts at quite affordable prices.  She then sells in the local market.  She distributes the greater part to food vendors and palm oil producers in her community.  She has been in business for five years.  

She wants a loan to buy palm nuts on a large scale so that she can supply to more customers and also trek to nearby markets to do business and increase her profit margin.  She desires to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Mr Koffi A. est un jeune agriculteur de trente cinq (35) ans qui s’est finalement adonné aux cultures maraîchères faute de moyens financiers.  Son travail maraîcher marche très bien actuellement. Mr Koffi A. sollicite un financement pour augmenter sa surface cultivable, acheter des intrants afin de rendre son activité plus productive. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi A. is a young farmer, 35 years of age, who has come to devoting all his time to market gardening due to a lack of financial means. This work of his is currently going very well. He is requesting financing to increase his arable land and to buy fertilizers and the like, so as to make his work more productive. This will enable him to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gardens for growing produce for the markets

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Ana es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Ana junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para la cual cuenta con un horno artesanal, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de peones.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra y arena.
Los sueños de Ana son tener casa propia, comprar un terreno en la ciudad de Ayacucho y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Vilma is a member of the Brick Makers’ Community Bank in the town of Compania, where she lives. Compania is located about 40 KM from the city of Ayacucho, Peru. Ana, who is 23 years old, and her husband have one son. She and her husband have a small business making bricks, with an oven for baking the bricks. She has several assistants in this work. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 Peruvian Soles in order to buy the raw material – sand and clay – for making more bricks. Her dream is to grow her business in order to have her own house and to buy a piece of land in Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials - clay and sand

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Señor Julio Cesar G. tiene la edad 48 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Julio tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Don Julio es una pulpería y venta de hot – dog. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio ya que tiene la responsabilidad de la alimentación de su esposa, Julio esta muy contento con ambos trabajos. Es por eso que el propósito de Julio es mantener siempre activos a sus clientes ya que sin ellos su negocio no tendría éxito. Es por eso que siente la necesidad de acudir a un financiamiento con el objetivo de invertirlo en capital de trabajo como pan, salchicha, golosinas y granos básicos. Don Julio desea es obtener una distribuidora y además acondicionar su vivienda. la cantidad que solicita es de C$ 20.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Cesar G. is 48 and married. Don Julio has four children, all of whom work. He has a grocery store and also sells hot dogs. He has had this business for more than 22 years. He started it because he had the responsibility of supporting his wife. Julio is very happy with both jobs. Julio's goal is to always keep his customers coming back since without them his business wouldn't be successful. This is why he feels the need to seek financing with the objective of investing it in working capital like bread, sausage, candy, and basic grains. Don Julio hopes to find a wholesaler and also fix up his house. He is requesting 20,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina tiene 42 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 13 años. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica al bordado, esa larga trayectoria la ha mantenido gracias a su buena labor. Estos trabajos pueden durar hasta un mes, dependiendo de la complejidad de los diseños, lo que Rosalina produce servirá para las fiestas costumbristas de su localidad, donde las mujeres lucen faldas y chales con vistosos bordados. Para Rosalina este trabajo es un entretenimiento, el cual le permitió no descuidar la atención de sus hijos que hoy ya son personas mayores y están muy agradecidas a su madre por su protección y educación brindada. Para el futuro, Rosalina desea seguir dedicándose a esta labor porque no requiere de grandes esfuerzos físicos para realizarla. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a trabajar por el bienestar común de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de hilos de diversos colores y telas, que son los materiales indispensables para la elaboración de sus bordados artesanales.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a 42-year-old woman who lives in her own house with her husband and 13-year-old son. For over 22 years, she has been embroidering for a living. She has been in business for such a long time thanks to the fine quality of her work. It could sometimes take her up to a whole month to finish embroidering, depending on how complicated the designs are. Rosalina makes clothing for her community’s traditional festivities in which women wear skirts and shawls with bright and colorful embroidery. For Rosalina, this line of work is a form of entertainment. It has allowed her to care for her children, who are now mostly all adults and are very grateful to their mother for always protecting them and providing them with an education. In the future, Rosalina would like to stay in the embroidery business because it does not require great physical exertion. This is the second time she requests a loan from MFP, and she is committed to work for her microfinance institute’s well-being. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase fabric and thread in various colors, materials that are indispensable for producing handmade embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for embroidering

loans.name: Heab

texts.en: Heab B., 31, lives with his wife in the Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is a construction foreman and is able to make US$10 every day, while his wife Sim Sameth, 34, is a garment factory worker and makes US$2 per day. This couple has two young children. Heab B. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: Construction materials.

loans.name: Atsoupé

texts.fr: Née en 1957 à Adzralakopé dans la préfecture de Zio au Sud du Togo, Mme Atsoupé S. est mariée et a à sa charge neuf (09) personnes. C’est une femme qui ne connaît comme activité que l’agriculture, principalement la culture du mais et du manioc. C’est à travers cette activité agricole, qu’elle pratique depuis des années, qu’elle arrive à soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille. Actuellement ses terres cultivables sont très pauvres et nécessitent l’apport de fertilisants. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat des engrais et d’autres intrants agricoles. Cela lui permettra d’augmenter ses rendements et ses revenus agricoles.
texts.en:
Born in 1957 in Adzralakopé in the prefecture of Zio in the south of Togo, Mrs. Atsoupé S. is married and supporting 9 people. This is a woman who knows only agriculture, principally the cultivation of maize and manioc. It is through this agricultural business, that she has been in for many years, that she manages to help her husband support the family. Presently, her arable land is expended and needs the support of fertilizer. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy manure and other agricultural inputs. This will allow her to increase her yield and her agricultural revenue.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating maize and manioc

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: la Sra. Maria Leticia Q. tiene 39 años de edad, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de refrescos, agua y jugos. como esta ciudad de choluteca es muy caliente muchas personas compran este tipo de productos para quitarse la sed, ella tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, la cual queda en un punto muy estrategico ya que por ahi pasan muchas personas ya que queda cerca una estacion de buses. en estos momentos ella necesita comprar mas productos para tener mejores ganancias, ella piensa comprar otro refrigerador para poner mas refrescos. nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien y espera mejorar pronto su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Leticia Q. is 39 years old and makes a living buying and selling soft drinks, water and juices. Because her city of Choluteca is very hot, many people buy this type of product to quench their thirst. She runs her business out of her home, which is located in a very strategic spot because many people pass by it since it is close to the bus station. Currently she needs to purchase more products to increase her profits. She plans on purchasing another refrigerator to stock it with more drinks. She tells us that she feels very happy because everything is going well and she hopes to improve her business soon.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and juices in cans and bottles and bottled water

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. Y. buys her goods from Kumasi and nearby communities. She sells on a tabletop at the lorry station in the mornings and evenings. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She has been in business for five years.

Y. is 32 years old. She is married and has three children, all boys. All are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Y. wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Paskazia

texts.en:
Paskazia S. is married and is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur businesswoman. She runs a tailoring mart school at Yombo Buza ward in Dar es Salaam. She has five sewing machines and six students. They make different types of clothes for both men and women and also schoolchildren’s uniforms. The clothes made are sold and its income is used to expand the business and meet the daily needs of Paskazia’s family.

Paskazia has been running her business for seven years. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to extend the business by buying more sewing machines.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angeline is a widow, 43 years old, and she takes care of two children aged 16 and 19.

Angeline works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and employs one person to help her. She earns a monthly profit of 80,000 Rwandan Francs.

Angeline is requesting her first loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs from Vision Finance Company. With this new loan she hopes to purchase more charcoal to sell which will help her to earn more profit in order to pay school fees for her children and get more food for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school.  Mary sells bathroom slippers, underwear, plastic bowls ECT, and by hocking around Elmina, which he has been doing since2006. Her husband is a carpenter.  Mary uses her income to support the payment of school fess and utility bills. Mary will use the loan to purchase more of plastic bowls, bathroom slippers and others for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Mary plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more of plastic bowls, bathroom slippers and others for sale.

loans.name: Catarina Manuela

texts.es: Dona Catarina Manuela García Y. cuenta con 45 años de edad es casada vive conjuntamente con sus tres hijos y esposo actualmente se dedica a la artesanía en amarrado de jaspe por mas de cinco años prestando sus servicios como operaria según sus necesidades y la inquietud al mejoramiento de vida con una buena visión se acerco a las instalaciones de la Asociación Asdir para adquirir un préstamo, así poder crear su propio taller de tejeduría elaborando cortes típicos, por lo que también viendo la necesidad de poder mejorar sus ingresos mensuales, así poder darle a sus hijos una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Catarina Manuela García Y. is 45 and married. She lives with her three children and her husband. She currently makes handicrafts using “jaspe” (a weaving technique like tie-dye). She has been doing this work for over five years. Looking at her needs and her anxiousness to improve her life, she comes to the Asociación Asdir to get a loan. This way she will be able to create her own weaving shop and make typical clothing. She also sees the necessity to be able to improve her monthly income. That way she can give her children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material for handicrafts

loans.name: Maria Rocio

texts.es:
María  es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de Alta Gracia, es conviviente, tiene 28 años, tres hijos de 11, 5, 2 años, el mayor va a la escuela estatal y el de cinco años está en el nido.
María no pudo seguir estudiando por que salió embarazada y se puso a  vender  sandwichs en la puerta de su casa, empezó con una mesita y después de un tiempo se compró un "carrito sanguchero" (módulo con parrilla para la venta de sandwichs) de segunda, vendió por 8 años y hace un año María con sus ahorros y mucho esfuerzo a puesto una fuente de soda.
En Finca Perú, ella aprendió a invertir y ahorra de una manera eficaz, ha conocido un grupo de amigas las cuales le dan ideas de nuevos negocios. 
María necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, va a invertir en surtir su fuente de soda, compra de gaseosas, y materia prima para preparar postres y sandwichs.
El sueño de María es que su nuevo negocio de fuente se soda crezca y sus clientes aumenten.

loans.use: surtir su fuente de soda

loans.name: Modinat

texts.en:
Modinat is married with 5 children. She is 38 years old, and lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

Modinat sells yam flour. She has been in this business for the past 20 years. She hopes for a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more yam flour to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yam flour to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old. She is divorced with six children. At the moment, one is in school. She is a local manufacturer of palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts. The palm nuts are processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil. Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish, local soaps, and in pastries etc. Mary produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. Her production is on a small scale due to having inadequate capital to buy a machine for the processing.

Mary requests a loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and gallon containers to store the palm oil. She has been in business for 25 years while taking care of all her children and takes delivery of stock from the surrounding villages. She is the one with the scarf on her head in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy more palm nuts other foodstuffs

loans.name: Zulma

texts.en:
Zulma R. is 40 years old, has no children and is financially independent. She lives in Encarnacion.

Zulma owns a vendor stand from which she sells natural remedies and herbs. She has been running this business for several years and has built up a reliable customer base. She has been able to make good profit, have good savings and cover household expenses.

Zulma is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 Gs to buy more natural remedies of a higher quality. As summer nears, and the heat rises, her customers have higher demand for medicinal herbs for dehydration and heat stroke.

loans.use: To buy higher quality medicinals

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea M., 37 years old, is married and the mother of a teenage child, who attends secondary school. Chea M. and her husband are rice cultivators. In addition to their farm work, this couple sells rattan cupboards that they either weave or buy in bulk from other weavers. Chea M. is seeking a loan to purchase a piece of her neighbor’s farmland. She plans to plant different crops on this land to provide her family with additional income.

loans.use: To purchase additional farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell gari and tapioka

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith Duenas is a 53-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Maytubig, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and by pig fattening.

Judith’s husband, Renato, helps run the businesses. They have five children who are between 15 and 31 years of age. One of her children is currently going to school and helps in the business. Judith joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,400 from her business activities.

Judith is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and pig fattening businesses, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 17th loan in the amount of PHP 18,000, which she intends to use in her general store and pig fattening business.  Judith is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ponchita

texts.en:
Ponchita U. is a 51-year-old mother who always dreamed of happiness for her family. She has three children whose ages are from seven to twenty-five years old.

Even though Ponchita feels sad for her two eldest children who were in college but didn’t want to continue their education and are jobless at the present time, her love for them prevails and she realizes that she has to respect their decisions. Therefore, she decided to support them especially in their financial needs.

Just recently, Ponchita joined ASHI and now she is requesting a loan which she is going to use for starting up her own small business which is hog/pig fattening. Her loan will be used to buy a piglet and enough feed for four months. When is it mature and sold, she plans to buy another one by requesting another loan.

The proceeds will be used to support Ponchita’s children in addition to the allowance sent to her by her husband who works abroad as an Overseas Contract Worker.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and a piglet to raise and sell

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a mother of 2 children.  Her eldest is 21 years old.  She supports her family by raising ducks.  She now has 500 ducks available, and is working hard to expand her business.

She would like to request a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. of PHP 10,000.  She will use the loan to buy more feed for her ducks. She likes CEVI's services because they offer a low interest rate and insurance benefits.

loans.use: feeds

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
A Elmer lo caracteriza la sencillez, tiene 29 años y vive en su cómoda casa de material noble junto a su esposa Graciela y sus dos hijos, por quienes trabaja con esmero para facilitarle comodidades que el careció. 

Recoger sus granos de café es de gran satisfacción, pues ve que su trabajo valió la pena y se llena de entusiasmo para continuar. Lleva cultivando café y maíz hace 6 años, con el apoyo de operarios, mientras que su esposa también colabora con los gastos domiciliarios al administrar una tienda de comestibles. 
El progreso de esta joven pareja es evidente porque sus padres les heredaron terrenos donde actualmente construyeron su casa y plantaron frutos. Y como le gusta tener productos de calidad, Elmer recibe asesoramiento técnico de instituciones gubernamentales, quienes apuestan por el trabajo esmerado que realiza, ya que con el tiempo desea tener lo necesario para procesar sus granos y lograr un café de mejor calidad.
Junto a su esposa se han puesto de acuerdo que para los gastos domésticos se usan las ganancias de la tienda, mientras que los de la agricultura se ahorran para comprar una casa en la ciudad donde instalarán otra bodega y comprarán un carro para transportar personas y los productos de las chacras a los mercados.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, pero como conoce a los integrantes de su banco comunal, está feliz de pertenecer a un grupo tan integrado y responsable. Con los mil soles que solicita contratará operarios para que le ayuden a cosechar su café, además comprará costales y canastas que le faciliten la recolección de sus productos.
texts.en:
Elmer is characterized by his modesty. He is 29 years old and lives in a comfortable home made of solid materials with his wife Graciela and their two children. Elmer works diligently to provide his family with the amenities that they lack.

He grows coffee with great satisfaction because he sees that his work is of value and is thrilled to continue with it. Elmer has been growing coffee and corn for six years with the help of workers. Meanwhile, his wife manages the household expenses and operates a grocery store. The progress made by this young couple is evident because they have already constructed a house and planted fruit on the land they inherited from his parents. Since he enjoys producing a quality product, Elmer receives technical assistance from government institutions who invest in his hard work so that he will be equipped to process the coffee beans and achieve a better quality product.

Elmer and his wife have reached an agreement to use the earnings from their grocery store to cover the household expenses. This will allow them to save their income from farming to purchase a house in the city where they will open another store. They will also buy a car for transporting passengers and hauling their produce to the markets.

This is his first loan with MFP. As he gets to know the members of his Communal Bank, Elmer is happy to be part of an integrated and responsible group. With this loan of 1000 PEN, he will hire workers to help with harvesting his coffee. He will also buy bags and baskets to help with gathering of the coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire workers to harvest coffee & purchase bags and baskets for collecting coffee beans

loans.name: Luciana Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal LUCIANA, en su Secuencia 2, está formado por 10 clientes, todas mujeres, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. San Antonio, y algunas socias que viven en la zona  D. Villa Copacabana, las socias se dedican a la venta D. cosméticos, venta D. comida, atención D. eventos infantiles, tratamientos D. belleza. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron bien. También se lamento el fallecimiento D. una socia en el transcurso del ciclo. 

La Sra. Carmen Es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo D. la presidenta del banco, en cuanto a su actividad ella es Medico Fisioterapeuta, realiza trabajos a domicilios y en consultorios con médicos asociados realiza esta actividad hace 5 años, también se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos. El préstamo será destinado a la compra D. aparatos D. medicina.  Soltera sin hijos vive D. alquiler con sus familiares. En su banco comunal, ella se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

la Sra. Pamela Socia que asume el cargo D. tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta D. ropa y cosméticos en diferentes lugares ya sea en instituciones  se dedica a esta actividad hace 2 años, el préstamo esta destinado a la inversión D. capital. Soltera sin hijos, vive en alquiler con sus padres y sus hermanos.
Ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como compañera D. grupo.
 
La Sra. Soledad, Ha sido elegida como secretaria , se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. diferentes Empresas, también es procuradora (tramitadora). El préstamo esta destinado para la inversión D. capital en cosméticos.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y dinamicas y estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The LUCIANA communal bank is in its second loan cycle; it’s maD. up of 10 members, all women, who are neighbors in the San Antonio neighborhood (some live in Villa Copacabana). Some members sell cosmetics, others prepared meals, some are children’s party planners, others are beauticians. They repaid their previous loan on time. This cycle also included mourning for one of the members who died during this cycle. Carmen is the group representative and bank president. She is a medical therapist providing services both in customers’ homes and in clinics she’s associated with; she has been in this line of work for 5 years. She also sells cosmetics. She is single, has no children and rents with her relatives. She is responsible and punctual with her repayments. She will use the loan to buy medical equipment. Pamela is group treasurer. She sells clothing and cosmetics in various places like institutions; she has been in this line of work for 2 years. She is single and has no children; she rents with her parents and siblings. She was elected to this post because of the responsibility she has shown in the communal bank as guarantor and as a group member. She will use the funds to buy stock merchandise. Soledad is group secretary. She sells different brands of cosmetics and is also an expeditor. She will use the funds to buy cosmetics. All the group members are responsible, dynamic people who are very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, tiene 27 años, es soltera, es natural del Cusco y es Ingeniero Agrónomo. Su principal actividad económica es vender artesanía como por ejemplo carteras de material de lana, ella exporta sus productos a los países de Bolivia y Chile pronto va ha exportará a Brasil. Ya son 5 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nos cuenta con mucha tristeza que el negocio de venta de carteras ha disminuido pero se las ingenio para seguir vendiendo. Ella también se dedica a la confección de vestidos a pedido del cliente y los manda a la ciudad de Lima.  

Elizabeth es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo casacas. El anhelo de la socia es abrir una industria alimentaria en la ciudad de Quillabamba que esté encargada de la elaboración, transformación, preparación, conservación y envasado de los alimentos como por ejemplo el cacao y el café.
 
Elizabeth pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación y por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal y también se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 27, is single. She is from Cusco, and she is an agricultural engineer. Her main economic activity is selling handicrafts. For example, she sells purses made from wool. She exports her products to Bolivia and Chile. She will soon export to Brasil. She has been in this business for five years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. With much sadness, she tells us that the business of selling purses has decreased, but she manages to keep selling them. She also makes clothes that are ordered from customers, and she sends them to the city of Lima. Elizabeth is a hard-working and enterprising young person who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead. She helps her family with her daily efforts. She needs the loan to buy merchandise like jackets. Her wish is to open a food industry in the city of Quillabamba, which would be in charge of making, transforming, preparing, conserving, and packaging food like cacao and coffee. Elizabeth belongs to the Los Diamantes Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa. The communal bank has been operating during ten cycles. She says that she is happy and satisfied with the loan services, the savings, the training, and for the time the bank has been in existence. She is also grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it in the agreed upon time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like jackets

loans.name: Acela

texts.en:
Acela C. is from the village of Oranga Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old. Acela is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Acela owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising fish for sale. Acela has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Acela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Acela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Acela is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Acela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
She is a businesswoman in Hoima, Uganda, operating a retail shop and has been in business for ten years. She says it’s a profitable one because it has maintained her and the family of four people.

Her name is Joyce. She is married to a driver and has three children, a family with which she lives in a rented house. She says she would like to shift her business premises from the village to the main town where there are bigger clientele numbers.

This is Joyce’s second loan, intended to enable her to purchase sugar, posho (maize flour) and cooking oil to sell in her shop.
