loans.use: To purchase sugar, posho and cooking oil for her shop

loans.name: Abuk

texts.en:
Abuk A. is currently in the business of selling maize and cassava flour at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice to sell.  Abuk is 37 years old and married; her husband is a laborer. She has 3 children, who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Sergio Jeremias

texts.pt:
Sérgio Jeremias M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteiro e pai de 2 filhos de 12 e 02 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além dos filhos. 
Saiu de Maputo para Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida, trabalha permanentemente na empresa Mozal como motorista ha mais de 2 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.800.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, chapas de zinco e outros) para ampliar e melhorar a sua residência. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para mobilar a sua residência e oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Sérgio Jeremias M. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. He is single and is the father of 2 children, who are 12 and 2 years old. The oldest attends school. He only studied through the 8th grade and did not continue due to a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own house and does not support anybody else besides his children. Sérgio left Maputo for Boane in search of better living conditions. He is a permanent employee of the company Mozal and has worked there as a driver for more than 2 years. He does not have any employees and earns a salary of 5,800 per month, which he uses to pay for expenses. He even manages to save some in his bank account. He has never had loans with other banks. He found out about Hluvuku through colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is his 1st loan, which has a value of 25,000 MZN. He plans to use it to buy construction material (cement, stone, zinc sheets, etc.) in order to expand and improve his house. He promises to pay back this loan on time so that he can receive others. In the future, he intends to ask for more loans in order to furnish his house and and offer his family a more comfortable place to live.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, stone, zinc sheets, etc.)

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa M. is 34 and married with 6 children (ages 8 - 19).  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taamu for sale. (Ta'amu in Samoa is cooked and eaten as a root vegetable like taro.)  She has many years of experience in this business.  Epenesa needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or $146 per week) to improve her business.

In 2009, Epenesa joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Epenesa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:
 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her husband and children. A very talented lady, Nazia owns and operates a clothes selling business. She does this work to support her husband financially. He sells the clothes assortment to nearby areas. Once a month he travels to different cities, such as Faisalabad and Multan, which is famous for its textiles, to buy the assortment of cloth for her business.  

Her husband is an electrician by trade who operates a shop in the market where he repairs electric items and generates income for the family. Nazia and her husband both are very hardworking and manage their businesses effectively. Nazia has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy tools that will help him repair more electric items easily.
  
Nazia is very sure that this investment in her husband’s business will bring more profit for him and his standard of living will get better.

loans.use: To purchase tools to repair electric items

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a member of 'Mwiki Dreamers' in Faulu Kenya.  Through the group, she has managed to operate her butcher shop well and has employed three people.  She has been running the business for three years. She previously took out a loan of 30,000 KES to boost the business.  

Susan is also engaged in construction business.  Besides that, she earns extra income from the pool table which she rents out.  She has requested 65,000 KES to buy cows for slaughter.  She hopes to operate several outlets in the future.  She describes herself as a hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy cows for slaughter

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es: Carlos Miguel es mecanico y trabaja en su propio taller desde hace 1 año 2 meses. Tiene bastante experiencia aunque es joven. El empezo a trabajar desde los 12 años en un taller llamado San Cristobal hasta los 15 y luego trabajo en otro llamado Taller Mecanico Francis hasta los 18 años. Con los conocimientos que adquirio de la mecanica decidio empezar su propio taller en la casa de sus padres. El es soltero y vive con sus padres, tiene una hermana. Su anelo es especializarse en varios ramos de la mecanica y agrandar su local para tener un taller bien formado.
texts.en:
Carlos Miguel is a mechanic; he’s worked in his own shop for a year and two months. Although young, he has a lot of experience because he started working in a shop called “San Cristóbal” from the age of twelve to the age of 15. He then worked in a shop called “Taller Mecánico Francis” until he was 18. He decided to use the skills and knowledge he had acquired to open his own shop in his parents’ house. He is single and lives with his parents; he has a sister. His dream is to specialize in various branches of mechanics and to enlarge his locale so that he can have a well set up shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Madres Laboriosas Group

texts.es: Teresa tiene 33 años, además de 5 años lavando la ropa de otras personas trabajo que se da de manera esporádica, también tiene 2 años en la labor de empleada domestica,  ya desde hace ya 1 año que trabaja con Edaprospo, el cual le ayuda en la compra de su capital que son las telas con la cual hace las fundas para muebles en su pequeño taller, últimamente ah incursionado en la venta de productos Natura el cual le genera los ingresos que junto a la pensión que le da el padre de sus hijos, puesto que está separada, mas el dinero de el tallercito logra mantener a sus 3 hijos que aun tiene a su cargo. Ella espera poner un negocio de venta y repartición de gas, para esto necesita más capital pero sabe que lo conseguirá si sigue así, pues su grupo Madres Laboriosas son muy responsables y las 7 socias que lo conforman son amigas y se dan la mano para alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Teresa, 33, has been taking in laundry for over five years; this is sporadic work, though. She has also been employed as a domestic employee for two years. She has collaborated with Edaprospo for a year. Edaprospo helps her buy fabric with which she makes slipcovers for furniture in a small workshop. Lately she has started to sell Natura brand products which generate extra income that together with the support she gets from her children’s father (she is separated) plus the money from the little workshop allows her to support the three children she still has in her care. She hopes to open a gas distribution business but needs more capital to do so; she knows that she will accomplish this if she continues as she is going. Her group is “Madres Laboriosas” (Laborious Mothers) and they are a very responsible group of 7 members who are friends and give her a hand so that she can reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
La Sra. Marlene C. tiene 25 años, es de profesión peluquera ,tiene una hija de 3 años de edad de nombre Soledad, vive en la casa de sus padres donde tiene una despensa bien surtida desde hace más de 2 años, posee una buena cantidad de clientes. También posee una pequeña peluquería anexada a la despensa, donde atiende a una gran cantidad de clientes, más en los días viernes, sábados y domingos.
Nos comenta que gracias al primer crédito que retiró de la Fundación Paraguaya, ha logrado aumentar de manera progresiva la cantidad de mercadería puestos para la venta y de esa manera logró mejorar su calidad de vida  y de su familia, es por eso que día a día seguirá trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para lograr todos sus objetivos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como harina, arroz, bebidas en general, fideos, etc.
texts.en:
Marlene C. is 25 years old, a hairdresser, and has a 3-year-old daughter named Soledad. She lives in her parents house, where she has run a well-stocked store with a good number of customers for more than 2 years. She also has a small beauty salon next to the store, where she attends to a large number of clients, mostly on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. She says that thanks to her first loan with Fundación Paraguaya, she has been able to steadily increase the amount of goods she sells and in this way has improved her quality of life and that of her family. For this reason she will continue to work hard every day so that she achieves all her goals. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise, such as flour, rice, beverages, pastas, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, rice, beverages, pastas, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. is 28 years old, married and has two children who are six and three years old, respectively. His wife runs a food kiosk, which is also a source of income for the family. Joseph has been in the transport business for two years with a monthly profit of Kshs.10,500. The business is situated in Gisambay, Kisumu where motorbike transport is very much in demand.

He is applying for his first loan of Kshs. 30,000 from KADET LTD to buy a new motorbike to improve his transport services. He desires to save the profit generated and be able to provide for his family.

In the future, Joseph desires to own a Matatu [P.S.V] (a larger vehicle used to transport several people at one time) through KADET loans. He is very hardworking and determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy  a new  motorbike

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando B. is from the village of San Fermin, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 45 years old. Fernando is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Fernando sells motorcycle spare parts to the local community. Fernando has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Fernando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fernando is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Fernando from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Suth's Group

texts.en:
The four members who make up this group loan live in Preaek Ruessei village in Kandal province. Mrs. Suth M., 44, is the group leader who has been selected by the other members, each of whom will use their loan for different purposes. 

She and her husband, Mr. Yun Chor, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land which they use to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. He is also a construction worker. Now she has to face problems because her field has infertile soil and it is far away from an irrigation system. So, to improve production, Mrs. Suth M. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. She is a mother of three children, all of whom are students.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio de taxi, su esposo hace taxi en las diferentes calles del Cusco y ella se dedica a ama de casa y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quisiera tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Isabel, 31, is a member of the “MANOS JUNTAS” (Hands Together) communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with taxi services.  Her husband provides taxi services along various streets in Cusco and she’s a housewife.  Together they raise their children.  She would like to have a grocery store and is asking for funds for vehicle maintenance and repair.

She thanks all those who will share in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Santa Cruz Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Santa C., porque es el nombre de la comunidad. En la ciudad de Tehuacan en el estado de Puebla en México. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes. La sra. Ma. Araceli es la presidenta del grupo y de la cual se desarrolla esta historia, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos y también tiene una estética, que inició hace cuatro meses. Solicita el prestamo para la compra de articulos de belleza y asi poder tener más variedad en sus productos y tener mejor servicios para asi poder realizar mejor su trabajo. Tiene 39 años, estudió hasta el 3er año de secundaria. Es madre soltera y tiene en total 1 hijo varon de 13 años de edad.Sus clientes opinan que tiene buen servicio por su carácter, y su local está centrico y tiene buen ambiente ya que siempre los recibe con una sonrisa, además cuenta con lo necesario para satisfacer sus necesidades.Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente alegre porque va a poder cumplir con las espectativas de sus clientes.Quiere seguir apoyadose económicamente para salir adelante ya que su hijo requiere atención especial.
texts.en: This group is called Santa C. because it is the name of the community located in the city of Tehuacan in the state of Puebla in Mexico. The group is made up of 12 members. Mrs. Ma. Araceli is the group's president and this story is about her. She sells food and also has a beauty parlor which she started four months ago. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of beauty supplies in order to have more variety in her products and have better services in order to better carry out her work. She is 39 years old, and she studied until the 3rd year of secondary school. She is a single mother and has one 13 year old son. Her clients think that she provides a good service for her character and her premises are central and have a good atmosphere as she always receives them with a smile. As well, she has what is necessary to satisfy their needs. At the moment of requesting this loan she feels happy because she is going to be able to fulfill the expectations of her clients. She wants to continue supporting herself economically to get ahead since her son requires special attention.

loans.use: For the purchase of beauty supplies.

loans.name: Saliykan's Group

texts.en: Saliykan K. is the leader of this group. She is 45 and married. Her husband works in the hydro-electric station. She has a daughter, 17, who will graduates from school this year. Saliykan herself is engaged in cattle breeding. She started this activity five years ago with the initial investment 3,000 soms. By reselling cattle after fattening them, she makes 2,000 soms per month. Saliykan hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase cattle for breeding. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers, as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa, de 35 años, vive con su esposo Antonio (40), y también con sus cuatro hijos, juntos habitan su casa propia en el distrito de Quimbiri.Ella es el apoyo incondicional de su pareja, juntos se dedican a labrar sus campos  de café, cacao y plátano. Elisa se desempeña como agricultora hace bastante tiempo y en sus días libres se dedica a otros negocios, como por ejemplo la venta de variedad de frutas de la zona como: plátanos, mangos y frutas cítricas, también aprovecha la temperatura veraniega  para  preparar sus refrescos de frutas. Considera que la venta de frutas es muy rentable por que tiene mucha acogida de sus consumidores, y los primeros meses del año los considera desfavorables por la presencia de lluvias, y  las cosechas de sus plantaciones disminuyen y la venta de frutas escasea por los constantes  derrumbes que se producen en la vía de transporte. Con el tiempo piensa mejorar su puesto  de venta de  frutas  y comprar mostradores  para exhibir mejor su mercadería.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene  con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, además es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal.Elisa tiene planeado invertir  los mil soles solicitados, en la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería en frutas, para lograr satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Elisa, age 35, lives with her husband Antonio (40), and their four children. They live together in their own home in the Quimbiri district. She is her partner's unconditional supporter. Together they work their coffee, cocoa and banana fields. Elisa has worked as a farmer for a long time, and on her free days she does other businesses. For example, she sells a variety of local fruit such as: bananas, mangoes and citrus fruits. She also takes advantage of the summer temperatures to prepare her fruit drinks. She considers fruit selling to be very profitable because they are well-known by the customers. The first months of the year are considered to be unfavourable due to the presence of rain, and the harvests from their plantations diminish. The sales of fruit diminish due to the constant transportation breakdowns. With time, she wants to improve her fruit sales stall and buy displays to better exhibit her merchandise. This is her second loan with MFP, and she has the capacity to pay all of the quotas on time. Furthermore, she is one of the most active members in her community bank. Elisa plans to invest the requested 1000 soles in the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise in fruit, in order to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.use: She will purchase more fruit to stock her business

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. is a widow who takes care of five dependants. She sells kenkey (a fermented corn dish) and smoked fish at Elmina. Adjoa uses her income to provide for the well-being of her family. She will use her loan to purchase more fish to smoke and sell. Adjoa will reinvest the profits from her loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men T. D. is 45 years old and has two children who work. A farmer, she grows rice, onions, and potatoes in a field of 4500 square meters. She  uses these agricultural products to feed her family and to sell in a market in order to generate income. She has been a client since 2004, and she is always a good group leader. This year, she wants to expand her business by growing additional kinds of vegetables. She is requesting a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide in order to increase her crop productivity.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Yulduzkhon

texts.en:
Yulduzkhon is married with three children. She is a farmer from Tursunzade in Tajikistan. Growing up in this mostly agricultural region, she has learned many important things related to farming. She owns a greenhouse and grows different kinds of vegetables and has been in this business for 20 years. Yulduzkhon is seeking a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. She believes this loan will help her improve conditions in her greenhouses thus ensuring richer harvests and a higher income. 
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, as a key post along the Silk Road and site of the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only seven per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Leonor Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet pertenece al banco comunal “Los Solidarios” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Yanet, tiene 33 años de edad y tiene un hijo llamado Joaquin, ella nació en la ciudad de Cusco y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. 

Yanet trabajó en la empresa telefónica del Perú y ahora desea abrir una tienda de venta de celulares, ella y su familia tienen un negocio familiar de venta de artesanía, ellos venden y distribuyen en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado artesanía, Yanet en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar celulares y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Yanet belongs to the communal bank “Los Solidarios” ["The Ones with Solidarity"] of the Arariwa Association. She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule. 

Yanet is 33 years old and has a son named Joaquin. She was born in the city of Cusco and currently lives in the city of Urubamba. 

Yanet has worked for the Peruvian telephone company and now wants to open a cell phone store. She and her family have a family business selling handicrafts; they sell and distribute handicrafts in the city of Puerto Maldonado. At this opportunity, Yanet needs a loan to buy cell phones and other items.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and other items

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three school-age children. He's owned a bakery since 1995 and has 16 years of experience working as a baker. He prepares delicious fresh goods. He works hard to be able to pay for his family's expenses, especially for his children's schooling. He has obtained three Kiva loans and is an excellent client with payments on time. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase flour and gas for his bakery in order to increase his productivity. In the long term, he is planning to continue expansion of his business. He is positive about his future plans.

loans.use: to purchase flour and gas for his bakery.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rocio; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la crianza de sus hijos, la socia es ama de casa y su esposo trabaja en un hotel como guardián, la socia quiere comprar terreno en la provincia de Urubamba en el pueblo llamado Ayllupampa que queda a 10 minutos de la provincia de Urubamba. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar el terreno.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa". it is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Rocio. She is 29 years old and she is married common-law. She has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with the care of her children. She is a housewife and her husband works in a hotel as a security guard. She wants to purchase a plot of land in the province of Urubamba, in a village called Ayllupampa, located 10 minutes from the province of Urubamba. She requests this loan to purchase the land. 

She is happy to have this loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Eunice

texts.es: Eunice tiene 21 años de edad, comenta que ella nada mas estudio hasta tercero de secundaria porque se caso muy jovencita y por eso ya no continuo con sus estudios. Ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catalogo y ropa interior para dama también por catalogo, ella dice “ya empecé con este negocio como un juego porque cuando iba en la primaria me llevaba a escondidas de mi mama sus catálogos y se los ofrecía a las maestras para que me encargaran y si me encargaban productos de belleza y así empecé mi negocio y cuando iba en la secundaria les ofrecía los productos a mis compañeras de clase, después ya cuando me case me independice y me propuse emprender mi propio negocio y ahora también vendo ropa interior para dama”. Ella esta casada con el señor Manases y tienen un niño de 3 años de edad de nombre Moisés. También nos comenta que los días sábados y domingos vende atole y tamales oaxaqueños a sus vecinos y conocidos y aveces hace mole de guajolote pero que es negocio esta asociada con su mama ya que a ella le sale muy sabroso el mole. La meta que tiene Eunice es vender zapato por catalogo de diferentes marcas para vender un poco de todo.
texts.en:
Eunice is 21 years old.  She tells us that she only studied up to the third year of high school because she got married at a very young age and, for that reason, didn't continue with her studies.

Eunice sells beauty products and ladies' underwear through catalogs.  She says "I started this business as a game because when I was in elementary school I used to sneak my mom's catalogs into school and show them to the teachers so that they would order things from me and they would order beauty products from me.  This is how I started my business.  When I was in high school I used to sell the products to my classmates.  Later, when I got married, I became independent and decided to set up my own business.  Now I also sell ladies' underwear".

Eunice is married to Manases and they have a 3 year-old son called Moisés.  Eunice also tells us that on Saturdays and Sundays she sells atole (a corn-based hot drink) and Oaxacan tamales to her neighbors and acquaintances.  Sometimes she also makes 'mole de guajolote' (turkey in a spicy chili / chocolate sauce).  However, that business is in partnership with her mom since her mom's 'mole' sauce is very tasty.

Eunice's goal is to sell different brands of shoes through catalogs so that she sells a little bit of everything.

loans.use: to sell underwear and cosmetics through catalogs

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Orn C. is a 27-year-old fish vendor and the mother of two school-aged children. Every day in the early morning, Orn C. and her husband go to buy fish from the fishermen. They then hurry to bring their fish by motorbike to the market for resale. In addition, Orn C.’s husband uses his existing motorbike to pick up passengers for a fee.
Orn C. wants to guide her business more smoothly. She has a lot of regular customers who buy and eat her fish. She hopes to be able to generate extra income by using her Kiva loan to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell. She proposes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase a used motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fish and a used motorbike.

loans.name: Abdufato

texts.en:
Abdufato is married and has two children. Abdufato is a cheerful and nimble man. He works very hard. Abdufato has a great responsibility of caring for his family and he is the only breadwinner. His wife is a housewife. For more than 12 years, he has run his family’s bakery business, assisted by his two brothers. Abdufato would like to get a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase flour in order to expand his business. He is requesting his fifth loan, and he has a good credit history. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Julio Ronald

texts.es:
Julio tiene 30 años vive con su esposa e hijo en casa de su madre en el distrito Pacanga ubicado en la provincia de Chepén – La Libertad. La vida es tranquila en la pequeña comunidad donde Julio vive.

Desde hace 6 años Julio se dedica a la venta de carne en el mercado de su comunidad y este negocio le ha traído satisfacciones a él y a su familia. Es por ello que Julio desea invertir en el.

Él ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar carne adecuada para su comercialización. Julio sabe que esta inversión le será de gran ayuda en sus ventas y con ello podrá mejorar su economía y calidad de vida. Otra parte del crédito será destinada a adquirir bienes de uso personal  que su familia necesita.

Julio es un hombre responsable con muchos deseos de cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Julio tiene 30 años vive con su esposa e hijo en casa de su madre en el distrito Pacanga ubicado en la provincia de Chepén – La Libertad. La vida es tranquila en la pequeña comunidad donde Julio vive.

Desde hace 6 años Julio se dedica a la venta de carne en el mercado de su comunidad y este negocio le ha traído satisfacciones a él y a su familia. Es por ello que Julio desea invertir en el.

Él ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar carne adecuada para su comercialización. Julio sabe que esta inversión le será de gran ayuda en sus ventas y con ello podrá mejorar su economía y calidad de vida. Otra parte del crédito será destinada a adquirir bienes de uso personal  que su familia necesita.

Julio es un hombre responsable con muchos deseos de cumplir sus metas.

loans.use: Comprar carne y bienes personales.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sol Group

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes  es conviviente, tiene 4  hijos en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante  en la alcancía comunal “Mujeres D. Sol” grupo  conformado por 14 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Mercedes  trabaja desD. hace 7  años en la venta y fabricación D. D. filtros D. aspiradora es decir fabrica las bolsas que contienen las aspiradoras   este trabajo surge a raíz D. que   a su esposo lo despidieron D. su trabajo y tenían que mantener a sus 4 hijos es así que mercedes entro a  trabajar a una fabrica y ahí aprendió a fabricar bolsas para aspiradora, y como ella es una mujer  emprendedora inicio su propio negocio y gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos economicos sus hijos cuentan con educación y se ha comprado artefactos eléctricos, muebles etc. Su sueño D. Mercedes es vender a otros países y que su negocio siga creciendo, con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería para la fabricacionD. bolsas D. aspiradoras. Sabemos que Mercedes  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Mercedes has a spouse and four school aged children.  She is currently a member of the “Mujeres D. Sol” communal bank which has 14 members dedicated to various commercial activities.

Mercedes has worked for the last 7 years selling and manufacturing vacuum cleaner filters, that is to say, she makes the bags that vacuum cleaners have.  This work arose because her husband was laid off from work and they had to support their four children.  This led Mercedes to start working in a factory and that’s where she learned how to make vacuum cleaner bags.  Because she’s an enterprising woman, she started her own business and thanks to her effort and dedication has attained better income, her children are educated and she’s been able to buy appliances, furniture, etc.

Mercedes’ dream is to sell in other countries and that the business continues to grow.  In order to continue growing, Mercedes has requested a new loan to buy raw materials to manufacture vacuum cleaner bags.  We know that Mercedes will reach her goals with much work and effort and that Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to manufacture vacuum cleaner bags.

loans.name: Herlinda Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Herlinda Isabel es casada, tiene 27 años de edad, cursó el tercer año de educación básica, tiene 1 hijo que está estudiando, se dedica al comercio y a la tejeduría, inicio con la tienda gracias al apoyo de su esposo y lleva 1 año de experiencia. 

Decide solicitar un préstamo que ser vira para invertirlo como capital para la tienda que tiene para comprar más productos: golosinas, jugos, comida en lata, dulces, aguas gaseosa, etc. Esperan ver su negocio en el futuro más grande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herlinda Isabel is married and 27 years old. She finished the third year of elementary school, and has one child who is in school. She earns a living in business and with weaving. She started up the store thanks to the help of her husband and she has one year of experience. 

She decided to seek a loan which will be invested as capital for the store, as she must buy more products: snacks, juices, canned foods, sweets, soft drinks, etc. They hope to see their business grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with five school-going children. 

She has been practicing dairy farming for over five years. She wants in the next five years to have added to the number of her dairy cows so that she is able to live her dream of being financially stable and thus able to develop herself.

Jane is thankful to Faulu Kenya for training her on business management. This has helped her to grow her business. She wants a loan of 20,000 KES to buy animal feeds.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es:
Claudia tiene su propio negocio, una pulperia y venta de cosmeticos de Avon, con cinco años en las ventas. iniciando con  poco y con dinero propio. Su esposo labora como tecnico de servicio en una gasolinera.
Claudia es madre de dos hijos, pues su vision es poder dar lo mejor  a sus pequeños,es por tal razon su objetivo es aumentar de capital, para vender mas productos, e introducir ropa nueva para la captacion de clientes nuevos.
Este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic,que gracias al financiamiento logro comprar mas productos. Y con este nuevo prestamo sera para la compra de ropa de niños, ropa  interior de dama y varon, productos para el cabello, sandalias estilo masaya, una variedad de cosmeticos en vanidad, pintura de labio,shampoo, desoorante, brillo de labios,perfumes, compra de productos coca cola, jugos, productos lacteos y granos basicos. 
Lo que espera obtener ventas altas ya que, se le hara mas facil, vender sus productos nuevo por contar ya con clientela.
texts.en: Claudia has her own business, a pulperia [small grocery store] and she has also been selling Avon cosmetics for five years. She started with very little and with her own money. Her husband works as a service technician at a gas station. Claudia is the mother of two children. Her goal is to be able to give her little ones all the best, which is why she aims to increase her capital, to sell more products, and to add new clothing to capture new customers. This is her second loan cycle with AFODENIC. Thanks to her last loan, she was able to buy more products. She will use this new loan to buy clothing for children, undergarments for women and men, hair products, "masaya"-style sandals, a variety of cosmetics, lipstick, shampoo, deodorant, lip gloss, perfumes, Coca Cola products, juices, dairy products, and basic grains. She hopes to obtain higher sales so that it will become easier to sell her new products because she will already have customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains with 40% of her loan and new clothing and cosmetics with the rest

loans.name: Maria Lorena

texts.es:
María casada, su esposo agricultor, sus hijos estudiantes. Ella trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace tiempo, su proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de la casa, ha tenido dificultades ya que se ha enfermado. Ha realizado pequeñas mejoras.
Solicitad el préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, rejas, laminas de acero, pintura de aceite entre otros materiales para reparar el portón y el suelo de la entrara. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a su seguridad y comodidad que obtendrá.
texts.en:
María is married. Her husband is a farmer and her children are students. She has worked for a private company for some time. Her project is to improve the infrastructure of her house. She has had some difficulties because she has been sick. She has already made some small improvements.

She requested this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, bars, steel sheeting and oil-based paint, among other materials. She will use the materials to repair her gate and the flooring in her entryway. 

She is grateful for this financing and for the support for the safety and comfort that she will have as a result.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Karina Mariuxi

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso que se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karina, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  8 y 7 años  de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual se desplaza cinco días a la semana por toda la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes,  también vende en su  casa cuando sus clientes lo deseen, deja a crédito  y cobra cada dia sábado. Tiene siete años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella empezó con el primer crédito que le dio la institución por lo cual está muy agradecida.

Este crédito lo va emplear para ir Guayaquil a comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal 7 años  y le gusta por la buena comunicación que hay entre las socias y el banco. 

Su sueño es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Bienestar y Progreso Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado in Montecristi canton, which is well known nationally and internationally for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts. It is the place of famous straw hats.

Here we meet Sra. Karina, who is 30, married and has two children, 8 and 7 years old. They attend school and her husband is a tradesman.

She is a housewife who sells clothing of all kinds. She goes door to door five days a week throughout the town, offering her goods to customers. She also sells from home when her clients desire, providing credit and collecting payments every Saturday. She has been running this business for 7 years and began it with her first loan from this field partner, for which she is very grateful. 

Karina will use this loan to go to Guayaquil to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, T-shirts and children’s clothes. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 7 years and likes it because of the good communication that exists between the members and the bank.

Her dream is to provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Otgonoyun

texts.en:
Otgonoyun is 46 years old and lives with her sister and two children in a house in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. Her son will soon be a college freshman. 

Otgonoyun operates a sewing business. She started her business in 2004 and she operates her business at her home. 

Her daily income is sufficient to cover all the relevant costs and bring some profit. She manages all the management tasks and duties. She is gradually expanding her business. 

She is a diligent and responsible woman who says, "My business is going well after receiving a loan from the bank. Thus, I want to expand my business." 

She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and cloth for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials and cloth.

loans.name: Jesus Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Jesus Manuel esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo terminar las recamaras que son para sus hijos. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para realizar los gastos escolares que tiene de sus hijos que son pagar lo inscripción, compra de los útiles escolares que son (cuadernos, carpetas, libros, plumas y lápices). Ya que no cuentan con el dinero necesario para realizar estos gastos. 
Planean pagar el crédito con una parte del  sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de carga pesada,  ya que su esposa la señora Cordelia  se encarga de atender y cuidar a la familia. 
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida y educación de sus tres hijos, esperan contar con su cooperación en este préstamo.
texts.en:
Señor Jesus Manuel is grateful for your cooperation in his earlier loan, with which he was able to finish building bedrooms for his children.

He is requesting a loan now for his children's educational expenses, paying for registration and buying school supplies (notebooks, folders, books, pens anad pencils), as he doesn't have the money necessary to cover these expenses.

He plans to pay back the loan with part of the salary he receives from his work as a heavy goods vehicle driver, as his wife, Señora Cordelia, is responsible for taking care of the family.

They want to improve their quality of life, and provide education for their children.  They hope to have your cooperation in this loan.

loans.use: to cover educational expenses for his children.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Маленькая дочь Анны попала в больницу. На лечение ушло много денег, которые Анна брала из бизнеса. Теперь ей нужен кредит, чтобы пополнить товарные запасы. Анна хочет купить сезонную джинсовую одежду, как мужскую, так и женскую. 

Предыдущий кредит помог Анне увеличить товарооборот и получить дополнительную прибыль. Анна взяла наемного работника, который торгует 2 дня в неделю. Т.о. у Анны появилось больше времени, чтобы проводить с малеькой дочерью. Анна по-прежнему хочет открыть в магазине отдел по торговле одеждой, но возможно она сделает это с помощью следующего кредита.
texts.en: Anna's small daughter ended up in a hospital.  Anna spent a lot of money, taken from the business, on her treatment.  Now she needs a loan in order to increase her merchandise inventory.  Anna wants to buy seasonal men's and women's jean clothing.  Anna's previous loan helped her to increase her goods turnover and make an additional profit.  She hired a worker, who sells twice per week, and now Anna has more time to spend with her small daughter.  Anna still wants to open a clothing sales department at a store, but will likely do this with the help of her next loan.

loans.use: to expand an assortment of warm jean clothing

loans.name: Darwin Nain

texts.es:
Darwin de 28 años, un hombre trabajador que ha sabido cómo ganarse la vida.
Inicio su negocio hace dos años. El brinda el servicio de taxi amigo y haces expreso a personas específicas. Su actividad las inicias desde las 7:00am hasta las 12:00pm.
Su dificultad es la competencia y la delincuencia del país.
El solicita este préstamo para el mantenimiento de su vehículo, la compra de llantas y accesorios como: radio, retrovisores.
Su sueño es terminar las construcción de su vivienda y sus aspiraciones es tener un buen vivir.
texts.en:
Darwin is a hard-working 28-year old who has done his best to earn a living.

He began his business two years ago. He provides taxi services and serves as a driver for specific people. He begins work at 7:00 a.m. and works until 12:00 p.m.

His challenges are competition and the level of crime in the country. He applied for the loan for car maintenance. He will buy new tires and other items like rear-view mirrors and a radio. His dream is to finish building his home, and he aspires to have a good life.

loans.use: car maintenance and purchase tools for his taxi

loans.name: Honoria

texts.en: Honoria lives near the public market in her town of Centro Southeast, Solana. About 10 years ago, she took advantage of an opportunity to open a store where she sells food and products people use every day such as soap and shampoo. She now earns an income of PHP 3,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, milk, coffee, instant noodles and canned goods to sell in her store. This will allow her to expand her business and increase her sales. Honoria is 56 years old, married and has two grown children. Her goal for the future is to increase her profits and save money that she can use to meet future expenses.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 41 years old.  She is a single mother of one six-year-old child.  Rachael sells clothes and has been in this business for six years.  She earns KES 6,000 a month from the business.

This is her first loan from Kiva partner KADET.  Rachael will use the loan to purchase more clothes for resale.  She will reinvest the profits she earns into her business.  Rachael's dream is to own a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Munkhjargal

texts.en:
Munkhjargal is a 27-year-old young entrepreneur who lives with her mother in the outer "ger" district, a district without basic infrastructure in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her mother is retired, so she stays at home while Munkhjargal supports her family by operating a business selling accessories and cosmetic products. She has been doing this for the last four years. 

Now she has 4.5 million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. Besides operating her small business, she studied at local medical institute. She said about her business: “To sell cosmetic products and accessories is very important in winter, spring and autumn, because there will be a lot of traditional and international holidays.”  

So she is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more products for the upcoming season. Her goal is to improve her business as well as to make a better living condition for her mother.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products for upcoming season.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 33-year-old modest lady from Nyalenda estate, a populous low income estate within Kisumu city. She is married to Maurice and they have two children ages 5 and 2 years.

Mercy sells second hand clothes, a business she has been in for the last eight years. She joined KADET LTD when the need for micro-credit arose, and she is now taking her first loan, which she will use to buy more stock of clothing for sale.

She will use her profits to buy a piece of land and she dreams of owning her business premise in the near future.

loans.use: To buy stock of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely and her husband are farmers who live happily in a village. They have owned and managed a rice farming business for almost eight years, usually earning a profit of PHP 23,000 every harvest season. They plan to increase their yields and income to continuously send their children to school and satisfy their daily basic necessities. Although farming is difficult to manage, they have the strong faith and determination to achieve their goals. They have the patience to endure the hardships and difficulties they encounter in life.

Nely is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs required for rice farming. She and her husband believe that their patience and sacrifices will bear a fruitful harvest and that all their plans will become successful someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson presidente del grupo del Banco comunal “Gedeón II”, perteneciente a la comuna de La Pintana.
Se dedica a la prestación de servicios telefónicos, ya que repara y vende celulares, además de accesorios. Desde hace 6 años.
Comenzó con este rubro desde que su hijo le enseñó el oficio, por lo que está muy orgulloso y agradecido.
Nelson tiene un puesto en la feria, que cuenta con la pertinente patente de trabajo y su horario es de martes a domingo.
Comenta que cuenta con una extensa cartera de clientes que lo prefieren debido a la excelente entrega de servicios, además que Nelson garantiza su trabajo, por lo que sus clientes quedan conformes. 
Nelson además cuenta con un taller que habilitó en su propia casa, por lo que ahí se dedica a ordenar sus productos y repararlos. 
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes distribuidoras, principalmente donde encuentre los precios más convenientes, por lo que se dedica a cotizar. 
Sus metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido en el centro de otra comuna, que le permita expandirse con su negocio.
Con el crédito comprará insumos para su negocio, principalmente repuestos y accesorios de celulares. 
Comenta que hace poco tiempo, compró un vehículo que le permitirá  trasladar su mercadería, además comenta que su esposa también cuenta con un local en la feria. Por lo que le permitirá economizar con el traslado de ambos. 
Nelson vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 23, 19 y 4 años, además de un bebé de 8 meses de edad.
Sus sueños y motivaciones son seguir desempeñándose en su negocio, ya que esto le permitirá brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Nelson está muy agradecido de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además de las capacitaciones impartidas de manera integral en la institución, ya que ha aprendido a organizar la contabilidad de su negocio de mejor manera. 
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que son muy unidos, solidarios y comparten además diferentes actividades e intereses, por lo que Nelson también se siente muy cómodo y considera al grupo como una segunda familia. 
La Pintana es una comuna ubicada al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile), en la región Metropolitana. Se caracteriza por ser una comuna con altos índices de pobreza, donde más de un 10 por ciento de los habitantes vive en situación de indigencia. Por lo anterior, la autoridad local (municipalidad) se ha preocupado de desarrollar variados programas sociales enfocados a aportar al  mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de sus habitantes.
texts.en:
Nelson is president of the communal bank "Gedeón II" which belongs to the Pintana community.  He has a phone services business where he repairs and sells cell phone, as well as accessories.  He has been in business for six years and started it because his son taught him the trade, so he is proud and grateful.

Nelson has a stall at the fairgrounds so he has the necessary work permit, opening Tuesday through Sunday.  He says he has an extensive list of customers who prefer his services because of the excellent delivery time.  Nelson guarantees his work so his customers are always happy.  He also has a workshop set up in his own home where he orders the products and works on repairs.  He buys his merchandise from different dealers, mainly from those who give him the best prices.  His business goal is to open a shop in the center of another community so he can increase business.

He plans to use the loan to buy supplies for his business, mainly cell phone repair parts and accessories.

Not too long ago he bought a vehicle to transport merchandise and since his wife also has a stall at the fairgrounds, this allows them to save on transport costs. 

Nelson lives with his wife and four children, ages 23, 19, 4 and 8-months.  His goal is to continue working so he can provide his family with a better quality of life.  He is grateful for the opportunity he is being given by Fondo Esperanza, allowing him to invest in his business.  He also is grateful for the training received at the institution, since he has learned how to improve his accounting.

In the communal bank he belongs to he says the members are very united and supportive, and share different activities and interests.  Nelson is very comfortable with the group which he considers to be his second family.

La Pintana is a community located south of Santiago (the capital of Chile), in the Metropolitana region.  It is a poverty-stricken area where over 10% of the population is homeless.  The local authority (municipality) has developed several social programs focused on improving the local people's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his business, mainly cell phone spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Gladys K.

texts.en: Gladys is 37 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married with five children between the ages of 12 and 19. All of them are attending school and live at home. For the past twelve years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new designs of costume jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 72-year-old man; he is married and has five children. He rears livestock in Kangemi. Peter has been in the business for 26 years now and gets a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This will be Peter's third loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more dairy livestock. With the profit that he will get he wants to diversify in farming. 

In the future he wants to be able to expand his business and sustain his family by improving their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more dairy cows

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a single woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 39 years old and has three children are still in school.

Evelyn has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 12500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a widow with three children.

She started her business through her meagre funds after getting business training organized by Village Enterprise Fund. Her business has picked up very much because of her quality work on the hair of her customers.

Given a loan of $500, she plans to buy electric hair drier, chemicals and hair food oil, hair clips, shampoo, hair dyers and an air fan.

loans.use: Buy Supplies

loans.name: Elisa Marina

texts.en:
My name is Elsa O. and I make and sell pork and chicken tamales. I have had my business for 5 years and I have a good clientel as my products are purchased for parties, reunions, and special get-togethers. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to increase sales. With the additional earnings, I will be able to remodel the store and to hire a woman to help me in the production of the tamales, I will also be able to continue to support my family and to give a dignified education to my children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Elsa O. me dedico a la produccion y venta de nacatamales ded cerdo y pollo, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que mi producto lo vendo para fiestas, reuniones y encargos especiales, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi lugar de trabajo y contratar una muchacha para que me ayude con la produccion de los nacatamales asi mismo mantener a mi familia y darles un estudio digno a mis hijos.

loans.use: To purchase platain leaves, pork, chicken, flour, rice, olives, raisins, water, salt, spices, butter, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rosedanie

texts.en: Rosedanie A. L. is a street vendor in Tou-du-Nord, Haiti ,who sells cosmetics and hygienic products from a stall she sets up next to a local park. On top of running her business, Rosedanie raises her daughter who is able to attend school. This loA. will allow Rosedanie to increase her stock and start a new business selling gasoline to mainly motorcyclists who serve as public transportation in the narrows streets throughout the city. NOTE: Rosedanie is a member of A. Esperanza solidarity group. She and her business represent nine other micro-entrepreneurs who are members of the same solidarity group. Each members will receive a share of this $1,200 loA. to develop their respective businesses. The cost of living in Haiti is such that Esperanza is able to fund 10 entrepreneurs who must make each payment together. If one person is unable to pay, the other members must make up the difference before any payment will be accepted. The community of 10 entrepreneurs have gone through Esperanza´s business training courses and have demonstrated their commitment and aptitude for receiving a loA. to expand their business. Rosedanie and the other members are responsible for working with one another as a social support network throughout the loA. repayment and business development processes.

loans.use: Purchase soap, shampoo, perfume, cosmetics, toothpaste and various other hygienic products

loans.name: Gulshen

texts.en: A. Gulshen Hasan kizi is a businesswoman from Varkhankend village of the Saatli region. She is a Mekhsetian Turk refugee and she has a small farm.  She has a family consisting of an invalid husband and two children. It is very difficult to feed the family. Currently she has two cows and one calf on her farm, but the milk produced is not enough to feed the family. She has a clientele and there is demand for quality milk. She decided to meet this demand by receiving credit and she applied for 800 USD credit to purchase 1 more milking cow.

loans.use: Going to purchase 1 more milking cow

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en: Munavvar N. is 50 years old and has a secondary-level education. He is married and has 6 children. Munawar grew up in a poor family and always loved cars. He participated in a driving course and worked as a driver in an organization where he drove a truck. He has a lot of experience with driving. Nowadays he has his own truck and provides a transferring service. He transfers sand and crushed stone for building purposes. This kind of activity has a big demand among local habitants. The truck needs repair so Munawar needs money to buy a new engine. For the loan amount of $1000, Munawar is going to buy a new engine for his truck and provide his services for local habitants. He is going to pay off the loan amount over 12 months.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his truck

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Mrs. Suong E., age 50, is a housewife with seven children. Several of her children work in garment factories, earning $70 per month each and others of her children are still students. Her husband works producing palm sugar and fishing, earning about $7 per day in revenue. To make palm sugar, he climbs up the palm tree to tap the sap. He then boils the sap to produce sugar and sells it in the market.

Mrs. Suong E. would like to borrow $1,200 to purchase additional tools to increase the quantity of palm sugar that her husband can produce, thereby increasing their income and financing their children’s education.

She is pictured with her husband in their home.

loans.use: To purchase tools to aid in the production of palm sugar.

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Mr. Ezequiel studied junior high, and when it came to choose which vocational shop he would like to take during those three years, he chose sewing, because he enjoyed sewing very much. Even though at home they told him that sewing was work for women, he decided to move ahead with his joy for sewing and started his business buying a sewing machine. His enjoyment and dedication to this activity has taken him to become recognized for his great work in this sector, and the necessity of supporting his family keeps him with the idea of continuing to invest in his business to be able to offer a better service to his clients and improve his profit.

This is why he is requesting a loan for US $325, which he is willing to pay in a period of 6 months. This money will be used to buy more cloth, embroidery, and other materials he used to be able to create the clothes his clients like so much. With your help Ezequiel will be able to support his children and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

El señor Ezequiel curso la educación Secundaria, al momento de escoger que taller le gustaría llevar durante esos 3 años, eligió la opción de corte y confección. Ya que a el le gustaba mucho coser, auque en su casa le decían que ese trabajo era de mujer, el decidió llevar adelante su gusto por la costura así que inicio su negocio comprando una máquina de coser y empezó, el gusto y dedicación a esta actividad lo ha llevado a ser reconocido por su gran trabajo dentro de su sector, y la necesidad de mantener a su familia lo mantiene con la idea de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para dar mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejores ganancias.

Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y el dinero le servirá para poder comprar más telas, bordados, y otros materiales que utiliza para poder fabricar esas prendas que tanto le gustan a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ezequiel podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su familia.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to expand his business (Comprar mercancía para crecer el negocio)

loans.name: Noël

texts.fr:
Mr Noël L. is 43 years old and is a married and father of one (1) child. Having grown up in a poor family, he quickly had to quit school and instead started training as a shoemaker. Without the financial means to start this endeavor, he is asking for a $500 credit to initially rent a workshop space and the second time to acquire leather and other materials and supplies to be able to make and sell shoes and bags. This will enable him to improve his family's living conditions and to increase his production so that he can meet the needs of his customers.

Agé de 43 ans, Monsieur L. Noël est marié et père d’un (1) enfant. Issu d’une famille pauvre, il a vite quitté les bancs de l’école et s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage de la cordonnerie. Manque de moyen, il sollicite un crédit de $500 pour dans un premier temps loyer un atelier et pour un second temps acquérir d’autres matériels et fournitures et de cuire intrants de la fabrication de chaussures et sacs pour la commercialisation. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie familiale et accroître le rendement de ses activités afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Lease of a workshop and purchase of leather for shoe making

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Mai Thị D., 35 years of age, has been a member of the TYM Fund for 7 years. Her main occupation is running a general store business. She started with a modest loan of 60USD for purchasing small amount of goods for her stand, which was on a walkway at the edge of the market. After awhile, she feels comfortable with the weekly repayment routine and gradually increases the loans’ size. Now she has a small store at her own house. The monthly income is 80USD. She would like to take out a loan of 375USD to prepare her store for the coming Tết.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Mai Thị D., 35 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 7 của Quỹ Tình thương. Công việc chủ yếu của chị hiện nay là kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa. Khi mới tham gia vào Quỹ chị chỉ dám vay mức 60USD mua một số lượng hàng nhỏ. Nơi bán hàng của chị là vỉa hè ngoài chợ. Sau khi quen với cách hoàn trả tuần và nhận thấy cách hoàn trả này phù hợp với mình chị D. tăng dần mức vốn vay. Đến nay chị D. đã mở được quán bán hàng tạp hóa ngay tại gia đình. Thu nhập hàng tháng từ cửa hàng khoảng 80USD/tháng. Hiện nay chị muốn vay 375USD để mua thêm hàng kinh doanh trong dịp Tết.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cereals and grains to resell

loans.name: Fatuma's Group

texts.en: Fatuma O., Siza M., and Jane L. make up the Upendo group. They have been together as a group for one year. Fatuma runs a shop in the Tabata area that sells food. They are requesting a loan to help them expand their business selling food items.

loans.use: Expand food sales

loans.name: Nati's Pendeza Group

texts.en:
Nati is 46 years old and is married with 4 children. She has been a clothes seller since 1994. Every day, Nati works from 7:30am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Nati now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in chicken sales, clothing sales, charcoal sales, and tailoring.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Born on 31 December 1975 in Amégnran, Mr. Adama H. is married and has eight (8) children. His bakery is his source of income, and is highly sought after by many women because he is the sole breadmaker in his area. This high income business allows him to meet the needs of his family and especially the education of his children.

To strengthen his capital base and better satisfy his clientele, he is asking for a loan. This will serve to stock a large quantity of wheat flour. The realization of this dream will allow him to maintain his clientele and to enlarge it. Thus, his income will increase, allowing his family to flourish.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 31 décembre 1975 à Amégnran, monsieur Adama H. est marié et père de huit (08) enfants. Ayant pour source de revenu la boulangerie, il est sollicité par beaucoup de bonnes femmes car il le seul fabricant de pains dans sa localité. Cette activité très génératrice de revenus lui permet de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille et surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants.

Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit. Ceci servira au stockage en grand nombre de la farine de blé. Ce rêve réalisé lui permettra de maintenir sa clientèle et d’en avoir d’autres. Ainsi, son revenu augmentera, source de l’épanouissement de sa famille.

loans.use: To obtain a supply of wheat flour

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is a young, working mother in a family that is employed in clothing sales. In her free time, she provides domestic cleaning services. Her desire to improve the quality of both her life and the lives of her two beloved children motivated her to seek a loan in order to increase her clothing sales inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Ana, es una trabajadora y joven madre de familia que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, y en sus ratos libres ofrece servicios de limpieza integral a domicilio.El deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus amados hijos y de brindarles bienestar para su pleno desarrollo la motivan a solicitar un préstamo para incrementar la oferta de sus prendas de vestir.

loans.use: Increase product inventory

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin H. was born in 1954. He is married and has 3 children. Mr. H. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan-Kalbadjar, and he has settled in Khirdalan town. Fifteen years ago he started his business of making and selling mouldings. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy the supplies that are necessary for making the mouldings.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making mouldings

loans.name: Francoise

texts.fr:
Born January 13, 1978 in Porto-Novo in Ouémé County, Mrs. Françoise A. is married and the mother of 2 children, Enock and Pascaline, ages 10 and 6 respectively, and in fourth grade and first grade. She sells fried coco yams on the roadside. She is requesting this loan so as to meet increasing customer demand.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 13 janvier 1978 à Porto-Novo dans le département de l'Ouémé, dame A. Françoise est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, Enock et Pascaline respectivement âgés de 10 ans et de 06 ans et en classe de CE2 et CI au cours primaire. Elle vend de l'igname frite au bord de la voie. Elle sollicite ce prêt afin de répondre à la hausse de la demande de ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 sacks of coco yams and 5 tins of vegetable oil

Achat de 10 sacs de tubercules d'ignames et de 05 bidons de huiles végétales.

loans.name: Holmurod

texts.ru: Бердиев Холмурод проживает  в городе Яван. Занимается животноводством. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Хочет получить кредит и использовать его для того , чтобы купить корову. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Занимается купле продажей крупно рогатого скота уже 10 лет.
texts.en:
Holmurod B. lives in the city of Yavan and raises livestock. He is married and has five children. He wishes to take out a loan and use it to buy cows. He will repay the loan over the course of twelve months. He has been in the business of buying and selling large-horned cattle for ten years.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, la señora Marta Isabel Rios se dedica al negocio de venta de comestibles como lo son platanitos, fritanga, tacos, papas,etc.

El negocio lo inició vendiendo poco pero a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo ha mejorado su situación gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha permitido obtener la materia prima para elaborar sus productos. Por esta razón es que hoy en día una vez más acude a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el crédito para la elaboración de sus comestibles y asi ofrecerlos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of Leon, Mrs. Marta IsabelRios is dedicated to the business of selling groceries like plantains, tacos, potatoes, etc.

She started the business selling a little, but over the years that have passed, she has improved her situation thanks to the support given by Ceproden, which has permiteded her to obtain the raw materials to make her products. For this reason, today she once again comes to Ceproden with the purpose of obtaining a loan to make her groceries and so offer them to the community.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials for her products

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 61 años, es casado, vive con su esposa y su hija. Él es agricultor, sus padres le enseñaron al  cultivo de las chacras desde que era muy niño, le ha muy bien en la agricultura, el cuidar las plantaciones de plátanos  y cítricos es muy delicado hasta que formen fruto. Cuando consiguen derribar con los hongos que se forman producen buen fruto. En tiempos de verano llegan a tener un buen precio los tanyelos y naranjas. La mayor dificultad es mientras que están en proceso de formación los frutos, los hongos denominados “cogotera” los atacan, empiezan amarilleando las hojas y terminan pudriendo los tallos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo. Con el dinero comprará el insecticida de nombre sulfato de cobre con cal, que le costara en un aproximado 300 soles cada uno, pero lamentablemente esto no le alcanzará para una hectárea completa.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 61 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughter. He’s a farmer, and his parents taught him farming starting at a very young age. He has done very well in agriculture, the care of the banana and citrus plantations requires a delicate touch until the fruit are formed. The fruit produce well when he is able to eradicate the fungi that form. In summer they are able to get a good price for tangerines and oranges. The greatest difficulty is that while the fruit are in the process of forming, the fungi known as “cogotera” attack, begin to yellow the leaves, and end up rotting the stems. This is the first time he has requested a loan. With the funds he will buy copper sulfate with lime insecticide. Each container will cost about 300 soles [US$100], but unfortunately this will not be enough to cover a complete hectare.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy insecticide for his farm

loans.name: Améza Mawussé

texts.fr:
