Madame V. A. est née le 10 mars 1974 à Lomé. Elle vit dans le quartier d’Agoè Logogomé un quartier de lomé. Elle est divorcée de son mari Mr GUMEDZUE Kwaku Tovienyekpo qui est instituteur, ils ont deux (02) enfants. Madame V. A. a une boutique dans son quartier dans laquelle elle fait du commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle a démarré ce commerce depuis 1998.
Elle sollicite un crédit de 300000F pour pouvoir varier et agrandir son commerce avec dix (10) cartons de sardines, dix (10) cartons de riz GINO et six (06) cartons de savons.
texts.en:
Ms. V.-A., born on March 10, 1974 in Lomé, lives in the Agoè Logogomé district there. She is divorced from her husband Mr. Kwaku Tovienyekpo GUMEDZUE, a school teacher. They have two children. Since 1998, Ms. V.-A. has had a shop in the district where she does commerce in groceries. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to diversify and expand her commerce with 10 boxes of sardines, 10 boxes of GINO rice, and 6 boxes of soap.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El sr Lucio V. es casado con 57 años de edad posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesaria de un hogar es de la Ciudad Itapua Poty de profesión maestro de obra albañil independiente y dueño de una pequeña granja ventas de cerdos, leche, huevos, verduras. El cliente cuenta con 10 años en rubro lo que le permite contar con buenos clientes he ingresos según referencias y visita realizada al cliente se ha verificado excelentes obras de construcción como casa particulares y la Municipalidad de Itapúa Poty. 
Es una persona muy sacrificada además posee una granja cuidado por el y su cónyuge. Tienen 3 hijos en España quienes fueron a buscar mejor vida y que también le envian remesas.

El cliente solicito la suma de 5MM a un plazo de 12 meses para inversión ampliación de vivienda, mejoramiento infraesctrura de la granja como de compra de cerdos madre y para engorde para generar otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Lucio V., age 57, is married and has a comfortable home in Itapúa Poty city. He is a skilled builder and also owns a small farm that sells pigs, milk, eggs, and vegetables. Lucio has 10 years of experience in excellent construction projects, such as private homes and Itapúa Poty’s municipal center. He is very selfless; along with his building he and his wife take care of their farm. They also receive some support from their 3 children who went to Spain looking for a better quality of life. Lucio asks for 5MM PYG, to be repaid in 12 months, to invest in expanding his home and buying young pigs for the farm, which will generate additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding house and purchase of pigs for farm

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina, vive en la avenida Luís Fuentes de la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en la casa de sus padres. Actualmente se encuentra estudiando una carrera profesional en la universidad Estatal.


Tiene una pequeña tienda que da hacia la calle en la cual instaló su negocio de llamadas telefónicas y venta de tarjetas de teléfonos, con lo cual financia sus estudios. 


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mayor cantidad de tarjetas, así mejorará sus ingresos

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Cristina lives in Luís Fuentes Avenue, in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto. She lives in her parents' home, and is currently studying a professional degree at the state university. She owns a small shop facing the street, where she runs her business offering phone calls and selling phone cards. With this business she is able to fund her studies. The loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of phone cards in order to increase her income. This is her first loan with Impro. They have evaluated her application and classified her as suitable for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase phone cards

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr: Agée de trente huit (38) ans, Mr Dodji D. est un conducteur de taxi moto qui ne travail pour son propre compte. Marié et père de famille, c’est à partir des revenus tirés de la conduite de taxi moto qu’il arrive à faire face aux dépenses de sa famille. Aujourd’hui il désire travailler pour lui-même en achetant sa propre moto et sollicite pour cela un financement. Ce crédit lui permettra d’être financièrement indépendant et de pouvoir s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Dodji D., age 38, is a motorbike taxi driver who works for someone else. He is married and a father with a family. Earning an income from driving a moto taxi is how he is managing to deal with family expenses. Today, he would like to work for himself by buying his own moto and is requesting financing to do so. This loan will enable him to be financially independent and to take care of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Lila es soltera, tiene 28 años y 1 hija, Lila vende filetes que ofrece a diferentes tiendas, puestos, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Ica. Además Lila es agente vendedora de una empresa.
Lila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de filetes y conservas.
Lila sueña con ampliar su empresa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lila is a member of the communal bank, Brisas. Lila is single and she is 28 years old. She has a daughter. Lila sells steaks, which she offers to different stores, stands, and markets. She acquires her products from the city of Ica. Lila is also sales associate for a company. Lila needs a loan of $325 (1,000 Soles) in which she will invest to buy steaks and canned foods. Lila dreams about expanding her company and of providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy steaks and canned foods

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine Y. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beer to sell. Christine is 40 years old and married. Her husband is an agricultural worker. She has three children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowering the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights. They also deliver legal services through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  membres du groupe Sindiya ont en moyenne 47 ans et   5 enfants. Le groupe est composé de 4 veuves et de 4 femmes mariées polygames. Toutes ces femmes vivent dans le quartier bamanan kin de Kirango Markala (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles font le commerce  de poisson sous toutes ses formes (frais, fumé et séché) et se sont connues à travers cette activité au marché et des liens de mariage car leurs maris viennent d’une même famille.
Pour promouvoir leur petit commerce ces femmes de la même grande famille se sont organisées pour intégrer le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire,  après avoir bien remboursés les prêts précédents.
Ce prêt servira à acheter, 600 kg de poisson dont une partie sera séchée avant la revente, une tonne d’oignon dont une partie serait conservée pour la période hivernale (moment de hausse du prix) et 10 sacs de facoye (plante sauvage utilisée dans les sauces surtout au nord du Mali). Elles se ravitaillent en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger à Kirango et en condiments à la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou. Les poissons sont revendus à Ségou, Boussin, Cinzana gare et Konobougou ; les condiments sont revendus en détail au marché de Kirango à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisée essentiellement dans l’entretien des enfants et  l’épargne. 
Elles ont pour ambition  d’acheter des bœufs et des matériels agricoles  pour faire la riziculture.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group Sindiya average 47 years of age and 5 children each. The group is composed of four widows and four married polygamous women. All these women live in the Bamanan Kin district of Kirango Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali). The women do commerce in fish in all its forms (fresh, smoked, and dried), and they known one another through this work at the marketplace and through ties of marriage, since their husbands come from the same family.

To promote their small business, these women of the same large family have organized themselves to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their fourth solidarity loan following the repayment of the preceding ones.

This loan will serve to buy: 600 kg of fish (a portion will be dried and then sold), a tonne of onions (a portion would be retained for over-wintering when prices go up), and ten sacks of facoye (a wild plant used in sauces especially in northern Mali). The supplies of fish are gotten on the banks of the Niger River in Kirango, and the condiments are gotten at the weekly fair of Diamarabougou. The fish are resold in Ségou, Boussin, Cinzana Station, and Konobougou. The condiments are sold retail at the Kirango marketplace to customers composed primarily of women.

The group members each intend to realize an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA per month that will be used essentially in caring for the children and in building up savings. Their ambition is to buy oxen and agricultural supplies to grow rice.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Various goods

loans.name: Yahyokhon

texts.en:
R. Yahyokhon was born in 1981. Married and a family man, he works in agriculture. The income he makes from selling agricultural products enables him to manage his household expenses. But today the profit from agriculture has decreased considerably and it is difficult for him to meet the needs of his family. To make his agricultural business more productive again, Yahyokhon is asking for a loan of $650 USD to buy seeds and fertilizer and thus increase the productive capacity of his land. This will improve the living conditions of his entire family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Ivan

texts.es:
Ivan es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Ivan es soltero, tiene 23 años y vive con sus padres, Ivan se dedica al procesamiento de cereales en harinas, actividad que realiza en el horno de sus padres, sus ventas los realiza de acuerdo a pedidos. Ivan estudia administración de empresas en la universidad y en asociación con otras personas tiene una academia de música.
Ivan necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo cebada.
Los sueños de Ivan son fortalecer la academia de música con métodos innovadores y culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ivan is a member of the community bank of Tulipanes. He is 23, unmarried, and lives with his parents. Ivan uses his parents' oven to process grains into different kinds of flour, which he sells according to the orders that he receives. He is a college student, and studies business administration in addition to belonging to an unofficial musical academy. Ivan needs a loan of 1500 soles which will be invested in the purchase of barley. His dreams are to strengthen the musical academy with innovative approaches and to graduate from college.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of barley

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr: O. Anne-Marie est née vers 1953 à Ouidah, une ville historique du Bénin dans le Département de l'Atlantique. Anne-Marie est veuve et mère d'un seul enfant qui a été à l'école. Anne-Marie a appris dès sa petite enfance à vendre de la tomate fraîche. Après son mariage, Anne-Marie s'est mise à son propre compte dans la même activité mais pour une courte durée. En effet, Anne-Marie a plutôt préféré vendre de céréales. Anne-Marie vendait des céréales au marché de GBEGAMEY, un des marchés locaux de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Anne-Marie continue de vendre aujourd'hui encore de céréales mais à son domicile au quartier GBEDAGBA. Anne-Marie a déjà eu deux crédits de ALIDé pour renforcer son capital. Anne-Marie sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé pour développer son activité et s'approvisionner en maïs, farine de manioc et haricot.
texts.en:
O. Anne-Marie was born in 1953 in Ouidah, a historic town in Bénin in the Atlantique Department. Anne-Marie is a widow and the mother of one child who went to school. She learned from childhood how to sell fresh tomatoes. After her marriage, Anne-Marie went out on her own in that same business for a short time. In fact, however, Anne-Marie found that she preferred selling cereals. She sold cereals at the market of Gbegamey, one of the local markets of Cotonou, economic capital of the Republic of Bénin.

Anne-Marie still continues to sell cereals, but out of her house in the Gbedagba neighborhood. She has already had 2 loans from ALIDé to bolster her working capital. She is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to develop her business and stock up on maize, manioc flour, and dried beans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 5 sacks of 100 kg of maize, 1 sack of 50 kg of manioc flour, and 50 kg of dried beans

loans.name: Mayling Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Mayling Auxiliadora M. G., Juana Isabel Pérez y Ligia de los Angeles F. G..

El grupo solidario Mayling, es originario de la ciudad de Masaya de la comarca de Quebrada Honda, de forma general se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras en el M. de Masaya y de Tipitapa.
Las tres miembros tienen mucha confianza entre ellas, son vecinas y se unen para la compra de algunos productos y así logran mejores precios. 

Doña Mailing Auxiliadora es soltera, no tiene hijos pero ella trabaja para poder tener su casa y ayudar a sus padres, se dedica  la venta de frutas y verduras, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre y desde hace dos años ella es independiente en su negocio, inicia sus labores desde tempranas horas de la madrugada y termina hasta las tres de la tarde, espera cumplir sus metas y después casarse. Ella  se propone pagar los créditos con mucha puntualidad y animar a las integrantes para salir adelante, ella es la coordinadora del grupo. 
Doña Juana Isabel Pérez, es casada , sin hijos y es muy trabajadora, ella vende también en el M., tiene muchos clientes porque es muy conocida. Su meta es de mejorar su vivienda y dejarla como ella quiere, para cuando sea mayor tenga comodidades y con el crédito ella piensa seguir invirtiendo para tener mas clientes y mayores ventas.
Doña Ligia de los Angeles F. es una joven madre de un hijo, casada, comerciante de frutas, ella compra en el M. de masaya pero vende al detalle en el M. de Tipitapa, tiene un horario de trabajo pesado, inicia sus labores a las tres de la madrugada y llega a su casa hasta las seis de la tarde.

Las integrantes expresan que han tenido buenas ganancias con los créditos obtenidos, estos los invierten en temporadas que saben que hay demanda y buen precio.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Mayling Auxiliadora M. G., Juana Isabel Pérez and Ligia de los Angeles F. G..
The Mayling solidarity group is from the city of Masaya in the Quebrada region of Nicaragua. They generally sell fruits and vegetables at the Masaya and Tipitapa markets.
The three members have a great deal of confidence in each other. They are neighbours and all go in on the purchase of some products to get better prices.
Mayling Auxiliadora is single and does not have any children, but she works in order to maintain her home and help out her parents. She sells fruits and vegetables, a business she learned from her mother, and for two years now she has run it on her own. She starts working in the early hours of the morning and finishes at three in the afternoon. She hopes to achieve her goals first and then get married. She is committed to being punctual in her repayments and to encourage the group members to succeed. She is the group’s coordinator.
Juana Isabel Pérez is married without children. She is very hard-working and also sells in the market. She has many customers because she is very well-known. Her goal is to make improvements on her home to have it just the way she likes it for a comfortable retirement. She plans to invest the loan in her business in order to gain new customers and make better sales.
Ligia de los Angeles F. is a young, married mother of one. She sell fruits. She purchases her stock wholesale in the Masaya market and then sells it retail in the Tipitapa market. She has a heavy work schedule starting at three in the morning. She returns home at six in the evening.
The group members say they have made good profits with previous loans and are using these to purchase popular seasonal produce that they can get for a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables wholesale to sell retail

loans.name: Paola Rosa

texts.es:
la sra. PAOLA ROSA L. A. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un negocio  de venta de ropa, calzado, lociones, implementos para ocaiones especiales, etc. Este negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio Abajo de esta ciudad, opera bajo el nombnre de "PAOLA DREAMS".
Paola tiene 10 años de estar al frente de este tipo de actividades que con el esfuerzo diario que hace, ha podido mantenerse y cubrir sus gastos condicionales.- es importante mencionar que Paola inicio con este tipo de comercio, venta de ropa de manera ambulante y gracias al esfuerzo pudo montar su negocio en un lugar fijo hace 3 años, donde ha podido tener una buena clientela que la han generado muy buenos ingresos para su vivienda, su familia y su propio negocio.
Es casada y tiene 43 años, se siente muy feliz porque gracias a su exfuerzo y empeño ella a logrado que sus hijos  se hicieran profesionales, actualmente  solo tiene un hijo que depende economicamente de ella.
Es Importante mensionar que todo lo que ahora ha logrado se debe a mucho esfuerzo, siempre soño con 
tener su propio Local y ahora ya lo tiene.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paola Rosa L. A. is dedicated to her business of selling clothing, footwear, lotions and items for special occasions and etc. This business is located in Barrio Abajo in the city and goes under the name of “Paola Dreams.”

Paola has been at the helm for 10 years at this type of activity which requires much daily effort. She has been able to manage and cover all her personal expenses, which is important to mention for Paola for this line of work. She sells casual clothing and is thankful to have started her business in a fixed location 3-years ago, where she has gained a good client base and has generado good profit for her home, her family and for the business.

Mrs. A. is 43-years old and is married. She feels very happy because of her efforts and she pledges to see her children become professionals and actually, she has one daughter that is already completely independent from her.

It is important to measure all the things now with much effort to always dream to have the right location and the right time for everything.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pants, casual shirts and blouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more laboratory equipment

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en: Ayo is 35 years old and married with two children. She has a patent shop where she sells medicine. She has been in this business for the past five years. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more medicine to sell and to add sales of frozen meat.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and frozen meat to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Concepción es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y madre de 6 hijos, ella estudio primaria incompleta (2 do grado), y  vive  en la parcialidad de Jamachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, Dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado ovino.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Concepción is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesús de Nazareth”, which is located in the central village of López in the District of Ilave, Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. Sra. Concepción has a 2nd grade education and lives in the parish of Jamachi. She started working with Manuela Ramos 6 months ago. Her first loan in the amount of 500 soles was used as capital to buy sheep. She is requesting another loan in the amount of 500 soles that will be invested in the purchase of additional sheep. Sra. Concepción hopes to continue working. She enjoys her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. sells salt; she goes to the market to buy it in large quantities and sells it in smaller quantities at Elmina near the new market. Efua has no educational background. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a teacher.

Efua has been selling salt in the market since 2000. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and apartment rent. Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of salt to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of salt to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Jadat, es separada, actualmente tiene dos hijos solteros D. 38 y 30 años que viven con ella.
Maria se fue a trabajar a Iquitos por un buen tiempo, pero regreso a Lima por que falleció uno D. sus hijos. Ella empezó a vender especerías como ambulante en un mercado, esto lo hizo por un año, hasta que consiguió alquilar un puesto en el mismo mercado, ahora trabaja todos los días hasta las 6 D. la tarD.. 
DesD. que esta en Finca encontró un gran apoyo gracias a los préstamos, ha podido surgir nuevamente esta mas tranquila económicamente.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 1400 soles, para especies y D. abarrotes arroz, azúcar, fideos.
El sueño D. Maria es poner en su casa una tienda, pero todavía tiene que ahorrar un poco mas.

loans.use: Maria es socia del Bancomunal Jadat.

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Amparo de 56 años de edad, vive en Villa Venezuela en la capital de Managua, soltera y con cuatro hijos que procreo  los cuales son mayores de edad, y le apoyan económicamente, su oficio es la costura el cual aprendió desde joven y ha sido su medio de trabajo con la experiencia ha logrado coser fino, hacer modelos modernos, y captar su clientela, lleva 16 años en las costura el cual da gracias a Dios por que pudo criar a sus hijos y poderlo ver crecer ya que su costura la hace en su casa, hace sabanas, fundas con bordados, vestidos para niñas y vender a si como la costura que sus clientes llegan hacerse. Con este crédito invertirá en la compra de tela, bordados y aprovechar la temporada a si como hacer un pequeño inicio del muro para lograr mejor seguridad de su vivienda a muchos esfuerzo hizo su casa mitad piedra y tablas pero su casa propia que espera poder hacerla toda de concreto a futuro. Agradece a la institución por los beneficios que ha dado para prosperar en su costura.
texts.en:
Amparo is 56 years old and lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood in Managua. She is single and has four adult children who help support her economically. She works as a seamstress which she learned as a young girl. Through many years of experience she has learned how to sew high quality garments and modern styles and gained a clientele. She has 16 years experience sewing and thanks God that through this job she was able to raise her children and watch them grow up because she ran her business out of her home. She makes sheets, embroidered covers and pillowcases, dresses for girls, and other orders made by clients. With this loan she will purchase fabric and embroidery and take advantage of the season. With the profits she hopes to begin building a wall around her home to offer better security. Her home is currently made half of stone and half of wooden boards, but it is her own home and she hopes to build it with concrete in the future. She is thankful to the institution for the assistance and benefits she has received for her sewing business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and embroidery

loans.name: Ronald Isaías

texts.es: Ronald Isaías G. H. reside en la colonia Fátima del departamento Chalatenango junto a su madre doña Juana. Ronald tiene tan solo 20 años de edad con un sentido de la responsabilidad bien marcado, ya que lleva a cargo su negocio y los gastos que asume del hogar. Ronald se dedica a la crianza de pollos, la cual lleva muchos procesos de cuido de los mismos como, vacunarlos, que su concentrado sea de buena calidad y la cantidad necesaria, encerrarlos a ciertas horas para que no sean devorados por animales, entre otra cosas. Ronald ya ha ganado experiencia en la crianza de los mismos y es por ello que solicita un crédito, ya que ahora está dispuesto a comprar una mayor cantidad de pollos y para generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ronald Isaías G. H. lives with mother Doña Juana in the Fátima subdivision of the department of Chalatenango. For being only 20 years old, Ronald is known for having a sense of responsibility. He manages his own business and takes charge of the household expenses.

Ronald raises chickens and handles the numerous duties that are required to take care of them such as vaccinating them, inspecting the feed to ensure it is of good quality, acquiring a sufficient amount of feed, housing the birds at certain hours to prevent them from being devoured by other animals, as well as other tasks. He is already experienced in this business, so he is requesting a loan so that he can buy more chickens in order to generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more chickens for his poultry farm

loans.name: Siempre Unidas De La Alborada Group

texts.es:
DALILA A. A. D. C., TIENE 68 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA Y TIENE 4 HIJOS MAYORES D. EDAD. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO “SIEMPRE UNIDAS D. LA ALBORADA” JUNTO CON 9 SOCIOS MUY EMPRENDEDORES Y ENTUSIASTAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. COMAS.
ELLA TIENE UN NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. EDREDONES, QUE OFRECE A SUS FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS Y COMPRA SU MERCADERÍA D. ACUERDO A LOS PEDIDOS QUE RECIBE.

LA SRA. DALILA INICIÓ CON ÉSTE NEGOCIO CON EL DESEO D. APOYAR EN LOS GASTOS D. LA CASA, ES ASÍ QUE CON UN PEQUEÑO AHORRO D. CIEN SOLES, ADQUIRIÓ SÁBANAS Y FRAZADAS, LOS QUE FUE OFRECIENDO, Y POCO A POCO FUE AUMENTANDO SU MERCADERÍA Y TAMBIÉN SUS CLIENTES.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO APOYAR ECONOMICAMENTE A SUS HIJOS EN EL LOGRO D. SUS CARRERAS PROFESIONALES.
LE AGRADARÍA MUCHO, PODER AMBIENTAR UN ESPACIO EN SU CASA E INICIAR SU TIENDA D. VENTA D. EDREDONES, SABANAS,  FRAZADAS Y MÁS.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN MERCADERÍA PERO TAMBIÉN EN LA COMPRA D. PANETONES PARA APROVECHAR LA CAMPAÑA NAVID.ÑA.
texts.en:
Dalila A. A. is 68 years old, is married and has 4 grown children. She is part of the "Siempre Unidas D. la Alborada" group along with 9 very enterprising and enthusiastic members, who are residents of the Comas District. She has a business that sell quilts, which she offers to family members and friends, and she buys her merchandise in accordance with the orders that she receives. Dalila began this business from a desire to help with household expenses. And so with a small savings of 100 soles, she acquired sheets and blankets, which she then sold. Little by little she increased her merchandise and also her customers. Through her work, she has been able to support her children economically in the success of their professional careers. It would please her a lot to be able to set up a space in her house and start a store for selling her quilts, sheets, blankets and more. She will invest the requested loan in merchandise but also in the purchase of Christmas pastries, in order to make the most of the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy A. is from the village of Barandias, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Joy is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Joy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & essentials in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Joy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Joy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en: Dorjsuren is 26 years old and lives with his parents in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. He and his parents live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called a “ger”. Dorjsuren operates an electronic appliance repair business both in his town and in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He began his business in 2003 after graduating from technical school with a degree in electronics repair. When he first started his business, he worked out of his home; however, he soon earned a good reputation amongst his customers and a steady income that allowed him to move into a store. He has plans for his business in the future, including growing his Ulaanbaatar branch so that he can attract new clients. He says, “I am planning to get married next year, so I need to save some money for that.” Dorjsuren is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to purchase appliance parts for his business.

loans.use: Purchase appliance parts

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
Ifeoma owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 45 years old and is a widow with four children. Her youngest child is 14 years old.

Ifeoma hopes to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell

loans.name: Donald Miguel

texts.es:
El    Señor Donald Miguel García A., Labora como  Comprador en el Teatro Nacional Rubén Darío,                                                                                                                                                                                                  el es casado  tiene cuatro  hijos a su cargo y  estos se encuentran en edad escolar, ha trabajado cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL durante cinco año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cuatro crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de  materiales de construcción como: piso y cemento para du casa de habitación.
Donald dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su casa de habitación, por lo que ahora cuenta con una casa mas segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Donald Miguel García A. is a buyer for the Rubén Darío National Theater. He is married and has four, school age, children under his care. He has had four loans with CEPRODEL over five years that he has used to make improvement on his home. The funding requested now will be used to buy building materials, like flooring and cement, for his home. Donald stated that thanks to loans from CEPRODEL he has been able to make improvements to his home to the extent that now he has a safer home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make home improvements.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 40-year-old married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has two children and her oldest child is only 17 years old. Adelaida works hard to be able to support her family financially. She also wants to sustain her children’s education.

Adelaida started farming in 2000 and plants rice crops on her farm. She is now preparing her land for planting and she hopes to have an abundant harvest. She applied for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI which, she said, would truly help her achieve her goal to have an abundant harvest. She will use the loan to acquire farm supplies like the fertilizer that she needs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like fertilizer

loans.name: Myanzi Twekembe Group, Mityana

texts.en: B. Perusi, pictured as well in the bottom left, is a part of and the leader of her lending group in Mityana. She is a widow with children most of whom have already completed school. She also takes care of orphans, most of them her grandchildren. Perusi is a business lady and a matooke (steamed green plantain) and beans seller from Myanzi.  She has ten years of business experience. Her businesses are doing well and this is due to the fact that she is so cooperative with her community members. She works hard to ensure that she continues to educate her grandchildren and for them to have good health and a better standard of living. She has her own plantation from which she gets her produce for sale and with the loan that she hopes to get she plans to improve her gardens by buying fertilizers and paying her workers. She is grateful because she has been able to pay school fees for her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay workers on her farm.

loans.name: Sylvie Dansivi

texts.fr: Née en 1954 à Grand-Popo au Bénin, L. Sylvie Dansivi  est mariée à DOSSA Benjamin, un menuisier. Le couple à cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. La famille vit à Godomey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi, depuis quinze ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Sylvie Dansivi   n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Sylvie Dansivi prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, accompagnée de différentes sauces) de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Sylvie Dansivi  fait ses provisions. Sylvie Dansivi  a obtenu une fois déjà, de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien remboursé. La clientèle de Sylvie Dansivi  s’accroît un peu plus chaque jour et Sylvie Dansivi  n’arrive plus à tous les satisfaire. Sylvie Dansivi  sollicite donc un deuxième prêt afin de reconstituer son stock de produits et de pouvoir mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1954 in Grand-Popo, Bénin, Sylvie Dansivi L. is married to Benjamin Dossa, a carpenter. The couple has five children, some of which are in school. For 15 years the family has lived in the Godomey area of the city of Abomey Calavi. Together, they take care of the various family expenses. Sylvie Dansivi has never been to school. To meet their needs and the needs of their children, she prepares and itinerantly sells food (corn dough accompanied by various sauces). Sylvie Dansivi does her shopping at Dantokpa, an international market of Bénin. Sylvie Dansivi has already had one loan besides the one from Alidé, and has repaid. Her customers increase a little more each day and she can no longer satisfy all of them. Sylvie requests a second loan to build up her stock and to better respond to the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn and fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Marina C. M., tiene 47 años de edad vive en el Barrio Camilo Chamorro, es madre soltera de 4 hijos los dos mayores, son independientes y los otros actualmente estudian la primaria, ella trabaja como supervisora de ventas en un conocido supermercado.

El solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, con el propósito de realizar una división en su casa, que le ofrezca mejores comodidades para la familia y la privacidad necesaria para habitar en una espacio de respeto a su persona, espera se le brinde un apoyo económico, debido a que ella es una mujer sola que todos estos años ha librado una lucha constante, para mantener a sus hijos en una ambiente digno dentro de sus limitantes económicas.
texts.en:
Ruth Marina C. M., 47, lives in the Camilo Chamorro neighborhood; she is a single mother of 4 children, two adults and two in elementary school. She is a sales supervisor at a well-known supermarket. She is asking for funds to buy building materials to build interior walls in her house that will provide increased privacy and comfort for her family. She hopes the loan will be approved because she is a woman alone who has struggled constantly all these years to support her children in a proper home within her limited economic capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juan Gustavo

texts.es:
Juan tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero vive con su madre en vivienda propia. Juan se dedica 
a brindar el servicio de transporte en su vehiculo propio una mototaxi la cual 
adquirió hace 3 años, en la cual ya posee experiencia en el negocio y buen trato a sus 
clientes. Juan tiene el sueño de construirle su vivienda a su madre ya que por el 
terremoto ocurrido tuvo serios problemas, en la actualidad ya han construido una parte 
con el bono otorgado por el gobierno pero falta darle algunos acabados para que así su 
madre se sienta cómoda y segura en su vivienda. Juan solicita el crédito para las 
mejoras de la vivienda de su madre.
texts.en:
Juan is 43 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in their own home. Juan is dedicated to providing taxi services in his own vehicle, a mototaxi which he acquired three years ago. He already has experience in this business and he treats his customers well. Juan has a dream of being able to build a home for his mother and him since some serious problems have occurred since the earthquake. Currently, they have already built a part with the bond granted by the government but it failed to provide some finishing touches so that his mother feels comfortable and safe in her home. Juan is requesting a loan to improve his mother's house.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel T. is 34 years old and lives with her husband in an apartment in Dornogobi province, Mongolia. Her husband, Mongolhuu, operates a transportation business in Zamiin-Uud, south of Dornogobi province. They purchased their current apartment with a mortgage loan from the Golomt bank, and they have been using their profits to repay the loan.

Narangerel operates a knitting business in her town. She provides services that change the design or repair the wool and cashmere products for her customers besides knitting her own products. She started her business in November 2009 with another employee whom she hired at the rented workplace. Even though her business is seasonal, orders for her summer clothes are increasing. Therefore, she has recently taken out a contract to rent a larger workplace in order to expand her business and operate it during the whole year.

Narangerel is an open and industrious person who has good communication skills. She says, “Currently, my business operation is based on my customers' orders. I have been planning to hire two more employees and train them in order to sell goods at the counter. We are ready to operate the business continuously if we can buy thread for summer clothes from Beijing, China.” She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more wool and cashmere as well as thread for summer clothes which is currently the most important thing to her.

loans.use: To purchase wool, cashmere and thread for summer clothes

loans.name: Sak

texts.en: Mrs. Sak N. is living in Preak Ta Ong Ti Bei village in Kandal province and she is 63 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Thav Chhiek, are mango sellers in the local market. Since their business is going well, they want to expand it. So to improve her business, Mrs. Sak N. is asking for a loan to buy more mangoes to resell.  With this business, they support two children. One of her children is helping the parents and the other is a jeweler. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes to resell

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La señora Justina se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, viaja a la feria de Putaja que se encuentra a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho y compra los animales, en algunas oportunidades los engorda en su casa para tener mayores ingresos, también cría cuy y gallina, sus productos los vende en los mercados de la ciudad, Justina tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando. Justina pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Vida y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro, tiene proyectado comprar un carro con sus ahorros. Su préstamo sera invertido en la compra de cerdos para engordarlos. Justina sueña con tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Señora Justina is dedicated to the buying and selling of livestock. She travels to the outdoor market in Putaja that is located 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho to purchase the animals. Sometimes she fattens them at her house to have a greater income. She also raises guinea pigs and chickens. She sells her products in the city markets. Justina has 4 children that are in school. Justina belongs to the New Life Communual Bank and what pleases her the most is the incentive to save. She is planning to buy a car with her savings. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of hogs to fatten. Justina dreams of having a store.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hogs to fatten for market

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, casada y tiene 3 hijos de las cuales comparte su vida a lado de dos de ellos y de su esposo en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la preparación y venta de comidas, desde entonces los platillos que prepara son los más solicitados por sus clientes, logrando aumentar sus ingresos económicos. Por otra parte, también trabaja alquilando sombrillas para la temporada de verano, eso hace que sus ganancias aumenten un poco más. En tanto su esposo es albañil, lo que le ha permitido edificar su casa, lleva 8 años trabajando en el rubro de la construcción y ahora planea techar y terminar de construir su vivienda. Olga se siente muy contenta con los logros que tiene y que pronto podrá vivir en su casa cómodamente. Por lo tanto espera se concrete de techar y dar los acabados que le falta y de ese modo mejorar su calidad de vida y de toda su familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para continuar de construir su casa, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente. Con éste crédito que solicita, piensa comprar bolsas de cemento y arena para terminar de techar.
texts.en:
Olga is 44 years old and a hard-working mother. She is married and has 3 children. She lives with two of them and her husband in their own house. She prepares and sells food. The dishes she cooks are the most demanded by her clients, and so she has managed to increase her income. On the other hand, she also rents out parasols during the summer season, which helps boost her profits a little bit more. Her husband is a builder, which has enabled him to build their home. He has been working in the construction sector for 8 years and he’s now planning to roof and finish their house. Olga is very happy with these achievements and the fact that she will soon be living comfortably in her own home. She is looking forward to the improvements in her and her family’s quality of life once the house has been roofed and finished. This is her first loan with MFP. She is aware that the amount will enable her to continue building her home, and she is committed to making all payments on time. With the loan money she plans to buy concrete and sand to finish the roofing.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of concrete and sand to roof her house.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Marly  Luz O. es una persona muy responsable y esto es porque desde que su papá murió siendo aún niña, con sus hermanas vio a su madre enfrentar con responsabilidad este reto de educarlas como personas de bien.  Ella desde que estaba en el bachillerato practicó el hábito del ahorro, pues con el poco dinero que su mama le daba para la merienda, lograba  juntarlo  para comprar productos que luego vendía  entre sus compañeras de clase y obtenía su utilidad, práctica que hoy también realiza  y que le permitió iniciar y sostener  el  negocio de vender mercancía variada;  ella comenta que  con lo que le da su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar  ella ahorra y esta es justamente la base de su capital de trabajo que ha fortalecido la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo , mediante créditos y ya tiene alrededor de 7 años de estar vinculada  a esta organización. El negocio de Mary Luz consiste en conseguirle a sus clientes las mercancías que ellos necesiten en la línea de jabones, cremas dentales, papel higiénico, adornos, accesorios, papelería  que exhibe en una pequeña vitrina y  que vende de contado y  de otras mercancías como cosméticos, ropa que suele  dársela a sus clientes para que le paguen a plazos de acuerdo al plan concertado. Mary Luz prefiere clientes que trabajen en empresas, para no tener dificultades con la recuperación de su dinero, porque dice  que “si una persona no trabaja no tiene de donde sacar para pagarle”. Desde que inició en la Fundación su capital de trabajo se ha incrementado y el beneficio de la utilidad de su negocio se refleja en que ha mejorado su vivienda, que  antes estaba en proceso de construcción y ahora ya luce muy adecuada, de igual manera ha comprado un computador para que sus niños estudien y está validando el bachillerato, mientras su esposo trabaja en un restaurante, para sacar entre los dos adelante a su familia. Mary Luz cuenta que tiene una hermana que la acompaña en todos las innovaciones que le  hace a su negocio, pues ella tiene una capacidad creativa maravillosa para envolver regalos, hacer arreglos acordes a cada situación  y la ha ayudado, como cuando Mary Luz se inventó vender a los niños pequeñas sorpresas que incluyeron premios y les dejò este negocio una  muy buena utilidad.  En la actualidad Mary solicita un crédito a la Fundación para comprar mercancía variada y prepararse para venderla el día del amor y de la amistad, porque quiere en su negocio exhibir pequeños detalles bien empacados, que llamen la atención : Cosméticos, cuadernillos, cintas, papel de regalo, adornos, ganchos y accesorios.
El sueño de Mary es hacer de su negocio un gran almacén, donde pueda atender más efectivamente a sus hijos de 3, 8, 10 y 11 años de edad,  desde su hogar y no salir tanto donde sus clientes;  y este es justamente su gran desafío, porque tiene muchos afanes generados por la forma de desarrollar su negocio, pero quiere seguir siendo independiente y construir junto a  su esposo una familia exitosa de la mano de Dios.
texts.en:
Marly Luz O. is a very responsible person. This is because her father died when she was still a girl; she and her sisters saw how her mother responsibly faced the goal of teaching them to be good people. Ever since she was in high school she has practiced the habit of saving. She got together the little bit of money her mother gave her for a snack and bought products that she later sold to her classmates. She got a profit, and she continues to do so now. This allowed her to start and sustain her business of selling varied merchandise. She comments that she saves from what her husband gives her to cover the household expenses. This is indeed the base of her working capital, which the Funcación Mario Santo Domingo has strengthened through loans. She has been involved with this organization for around seven years. Mary Luz’s business consists of getting her customers the merchandise they need like soap, toothpaste, toilet paper, decorations, accessories, and stationery that she displays in a small showcase. She sells these products for cash. The other merchandise like cosmetics and clothes she usually gives to her customers, and they make payments according to the agreed upon plan. Mary Luz prefers customers who work in companies so that she does not have difficulties recovering her money. She says, “If a person does not work, they do not have the means to pay her”. Since she started in the Fundación her working capital has increased, and the beneficial profit from her business is reflected in the improvements made to her house. The house was previously under construction, and now it looks good. In the same fashion she has bought a computer for her children to use in their education, and she is pursuing a high school degree. Her husband works in a restaurant so that between the two of them they can get their family ahead. Mary Luz says that she has a sister who joins her in all of the innovations she makes to her business. She has a marvelous creative capacity to wrap presents and make arrangements for each situation. She helps her. For instance, when Mary Luz came up with the idea of selling surprises that included prizes for small children, it made this business very profitable. Mary is currently requesting a loan from the Fundación to buy varied merchandise to sell for Valentine’s Day. She wants her business to display small items with good packaging, which will call attention to them. She will buy things like cosmetics, small notebooks, ribbons, wrapping paper, decorations, clips, and accessories. Mary’s dream is to make her business a great store. Then she would be able to take care of her children more effectively at home and not have to leave so much to see her customers. Her children are 3, 8, 10, and 11 years old. That is precisely her great challenge. She is very eager to develop her business. However, she wants to continue being independent. Together with her husband she also wants to build a successful family in Gods’ hands.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy varied merchandise like cosmetics, small notebooks, ribbons, wrapping paper, decorations, clips, and accessories in preparation for Valentine' Day sales

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz V. is from the village of Brgy. Nagcuartelan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Luz is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Luz owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luz is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Luz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El señor Hernán M. es una persona humilde vive en su comunidad Huayllapujru en la Provincia Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba.

El señor Hernán M. vive con su familia tiene un hijo es una persona joven con ganas de mejorar sus ingresos, su casa es de adobe (barro) con techo de paja el interior tiene revoque de barro, la actividad principal de Hernán M. es la agricultura. Produce papa, haba y cereales su producción es temporal  ósea que produce una vez al año. El préstamo que ha solicitado es para los insumos agrícolas como ser abono de gallina, semilla de papa y haba, esto con el objetivo de incrementar más su producción agrícola y mejorar sus actividades económicas.

El trabajo lo realiza es solo, en algunos casos con la ayuda de sus vecinos, los cuales lo consideran una persona sumamente trabajadora. Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar algún día las condiciones en las que vive, que lamentablemente son muy precarias.
texts.en:
Señor Hernán M. is an unassuming man who lives in the community of Huayllapujru, in the province of Tiraque, Cochabamba department. He lives with his family. His son is a young man who would love to increase his income. Their house is made of adobe with a thatched roof and the interior is plastered with mud. Hernán grows potatoes, beans, and cereal crops according to the season, so he harvests each crop once per year. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy agricultural supplies such as chicken fertilizer, seed potatoes and beans, in order to get better harvests and increase his income. Generally Hernán works alone, but sometimes he enlists the help of his neighbours who consider him a hardworking person. His greatest dream is to one day improve the conditions in which he lives, which, sadly, are very poor.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty K. is a businesswoman who trades in cosmetics at Gbongo Market in Bo. Betty is married and has three children. All the children are in primary school. She assists her husband greatly in taking care of the home, especially with the schooling of the children.

Betty has a very good credit history in one of the solidarity groups. She needs a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leone Leones to help her stock her shop as she has more customers this season. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane C. is from the village of Damusag. She is 36 years old. Maryjane is single. To make a living, Maryjane owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maryjane has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 200 PHP a day.

In 2007, Maryjane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maryjane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maryjane is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional inventory and increase her working capital. This loan is  Maryjane's seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template which lets Field Partners continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim A. is a successful entrepreneur, father and dedicated husband. He has two children who are giving him the strength to work hard. Rasim began a small grocery store many years ago with a little capital he saved. He was assisted by his wife who helps him serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery has become more popular. He is asking for a loan of 1000 Azerbaijani manats so that he can expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba M. is married and has seven dependents. Aba buys bags of charcoal and sells them in small quantities at Abura. Her husband is a farmer. Aba uses her income to help her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. Aba will use the loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to save to educate her dependents.

loans.use: purchase more bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 38 years old. Jovelyn is married and has two young children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns & operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aside from farming, she also grows pigs for fattening. She hopes for her piggery to grow more. 

Jovelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Skylane Jean

texts.en:
Skylane Jean M. is from the village of Barangay Ibung, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old. Skylane Jean is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Skylane Jean joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es: Serafina, de 46 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fabián de 43 años y sus 2 hijos menores Dina de 21 y Tabita de 14 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La tienda de abarrotes de Serafina es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 7 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal de su barrio. Este el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mas provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Serafina is 46 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home with her husband, 43 year-old Fabián, and her two dependent children, Dina who is 21 and Tabita who is 14.  Her children are her main motivation to continue working hard.  Serafina's grocery store is one of the busiest in her neighborhood.  Her great charisma and the kindness which she shows her customers have made hers the most popular store in her neighborhood.  Her customers don't hesitate to shop with her from very early in the morning since they know that her store is the first one to open and the last to close.

What Serafina most likes about her work is chatting with her neighbors about what is happening in the neighborhood.  She has been in this business for 7 years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is staying in her store all day since she has to serve all the time if she doesn't want her sales to fall.  In the future, she is hoping that her business will grow and that she will become the main store in her neighborhood.

This is Serafina's first loan with MFP.  She knows that if she makes her repayments on time she will be able to access another loan more easily and without inconveniencing her community bank where she is well liked by the rest of the members.  She will use the 1,000 nuevos soles she is requesting to buy more provisions for her grocery store and thereby increase her stock.

loans.use: To stock her store with various products

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus cinco hijos en el caserío Hualtaco del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con ganado ovino y vacuno, los cuales cría en un ambiente ubicado en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta en base de pastos naturales y cuando estos alcanzan un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es la más importante fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta, gracias a ella ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. 

Actualmente desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de estos animales y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Julia, 47, is married living with her husband and five children in Hualtaco which is in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area in Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She has cattle and sheep that she raises in her back yard.  She feeds them natural grasses and when they reach ideal development she sells them to merchants who tend to come by the area where she lives.  This activity is her most important source of income.  Thanks to it she is able to help her husband, who is a farmer, to support the family.

She wants to acquire nutritionally balanced feed to improve the growth of the animals and earn higher income from their sale.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa, for a 1500 new sol loan that will help her meet this goal.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness D. is divorced and has one child. Agness sells palm oil, vegetable cooking oil and other foodstuffs at Takoradi market. She takes care of her family with the income she makes from her sales. Agness is asking to use the loan to purchase food items to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agness plans to save towards the education of her child.

loans.use: To purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 59 years old and married. He lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. His adult children have married and moved out, but Eduardo takes care of one grandchild. Twenty-one years ago, Eduardo’s wife encouraged him to start his own business renting out washing machines. Currently, Eduardo rents washing machines by the hour to his neighbors and other people who need this service. Apart from this business, he also raises and sells chickens. Eduardo’s wife mainly takes care of the house but occasionally she helps in the business as well. 

Eduardo has requested a loan of $1,000 USD to buy chickens and chicken feed. His goal is to expand both of his businesses and buy two more washing machines. Eduardo hopes that in the future his family will help him with his businesses.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Jappo Liggueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité JAPPO LIGGUEYE est créé le 09 décembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration de son Banc Villageois? Il est composé de 16 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont nouées par des liens d'amitié et ont comme dénominateur commun le culte du travail. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de TOUBA SERAS 2

Madame SEYNABOU N. debout à droite de la photo, vêtue de grand boubou orange est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la garde d'un enfant qui lui est confié par des proches.

Elle est éleveuse. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle achète des moutons qu'elle engraisse pendant 5 à 6 mois pour les revendre dans le marché ou dans son quartier

Avec son nouveau crédit elle pourra au moins acheter deux moutons qu'elle va emboucher

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels, de renforcer son épargne et son activité
texts.en:
The Jappo Liggueye solidarity group was created on December 9, 2008 at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois of Touba Seras 2, to which it belongs. The group is composed of 16 women from the same neighborhood. They share ties of friendship, and are also bound by the cult of work. 

Mrs. Seynabou N., standing at the right of the photo and wearing a large orange robe, is the head of the group. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children who are still in her care. She also has custody of another child entrusted to her by relatives.

She is a cattle breeder who practices sheep fattening. She buys sheep to fatten over a period of five to six months for resale at the market or in her neighborhood.

She will use her new loan to buy at least two sheep for fattening. Her goal is to be able to support herself, strengthen her business, and bolster her savings.

loans.use: Buying a ram

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Mrs. Lilian L. is 60 years old, married and has six children. She lives in Mitazan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. With a desire to help her husband, she ventured into bread-making and snack sales, starting up with capital of only PHP 1,000. Her primary customers are her neighbors, friends and co-members of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. 

Mrs. Lilian L. joined the co-op in order to avail herself of their credit facilities. She was thankful to Paglaum MPC that her purpose of obtaining additional capital was realized. She is now applying for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy ingredients for snack and viand sales.  She dreams of owning a parcel of land someday.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack and viand sales

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 48-year-old married man with six children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For 20 years, he has worked in retail shopping.  His initial capital was 2.000.000 shillings and his current working capital is 15.000.000 shillings. He has challenges of bad debtors and his dream is to diversify into farming. William is seeking this loan to clear land for farming.

loans.use: To clear land for farming

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre y padre para su hijo y vive en la ciudad del Cusco.  Su trabajo empieza a las 6 de la mañana colocándose en una esquina estratégica, de paso frecuente de personas, puede ser la esquina de una agencia de viajes interprovinciales, cerca a un centro de educación intermedia; la canchita deportiva del barrio. A medio día desaparece y ya la tenemos nuevamente a las 5:30 a 6 de la tarde, nuevamente con su carrito botando fumarolas y aromas. Ya son 3 años que trabaja en la venta de jugos hechos de quinua y manzana y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Ana María en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo manzana, azúcar y quinua. 

Ana María pertenece al banco comunal “Sol de Oro” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ana María is 38 years old and assumes the role of both mother and father to her son. She lives in the city of Cusco. Ana María begins her work at 6am at her business located on a strategic corner where many people pass through. Nearby are an interprovincial travel agency, an intermediate school, and a small neighborhood soccer field. She takes a break at noon and then reappears between 5:30 and 6pm with her small cart producing wonderful smells and aromas. Ana María has been selling juices made of quinoa and apples for three years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy supplies such as apples, sugar, and quinoa.

Ana Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol de Oro” (Golden Sun), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity being given to her and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for making juices.

loans.name: Tamuyoneh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very please to present to you members of the “Tamuyoneh” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 2,400,000 Sierra Leonean leones for the entire group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Melrose K. is the leader of this group. Melrose was born in the southern city of Bo about 39 years ago. Melrose is married and has 4 children – 3 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. 

Melrose sells foo-foo (fast food made out of cassava roots), palm-oil and cassava. She has been running this business for 5 years now. With the help of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above mentioned foodstuffs in larger quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy foo-foo, palm-oil, and cassava in bulk

loans.name: Belisario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Belisario; el tiene 56 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el realiza servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Belisario is a member of the "Siempre Unidos" (Always United) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Belisario is 56 years old, married, and has 3 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his transport business.  Belisario provides a taxi service.  He works from 6.00am to 3.00pm and, through his work, he gets his children ahead in life.  Belisario would like to improve his taxi service and is requesting this loan to have maintenance work done on his car.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on his car

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa N. is from Mfuom, which is near Abura town in Ghana’s Central Region. She is married to a farmer and they have seven children. To help her husband pay for the utilities and their children’s school fees, she makes a living selling palm oil. 

The palm oil is extracted from the palm fruit (as shown in the photograph). Adjoa has been in this business for six years and she is now keen to grow it further. She plans to use the loan from Kiva to purchase more palm fruit to extract more oil for sale. Adjoa intends to save up the anticipated extra earnings for her children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to extract more oil for sale

loans.name: Artak

texts.en: Artak M. is 37 years old, and lives in Geghamavan village with his extended family, which includes his parents, wife and three school-aged children. He used to work in a machine-building plant, but has since 1998 made a living by breeding livestock and farming. His wife and his parents help him -- and thanks to their joint efforts they raise cows, sheep and a pig while also growing potatoes on their farm. Artak is applying for his third loan from Nor Horizon, for 700,000 AMD, to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Vilma joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
