loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha  es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Trenzas de Oro” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Martha cuenta con educación secundaria.
Desde hace un año que trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales menores.  Nos cuenta que también se dedica a la venta de tejidos como: mantas, chompas, chalecos y combustible.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, aumentará al capital de su negocio y  comprará tres paquetes de lana, dos cilindros de combustibles (petróleo y gasolina).  En el negocio trabaja sola ya que su esposo realiza servicio de mototaxi.
Su sueño es crecer más en el negocio y tener una casa bonita.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the communal bank "Trenzas de Oro," located in the Llave district of El Collao province in the department of Puno.  She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children.  Martha has a middle school education.

Martha has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for a year.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles, which she invested in her business buying and selling small animals.  She tells us that she also has a business selling knitted items such as blankets, sweaters, vests, and that she also sells fuel.  

With this new loan of 800 Peruvian soles, she will increase the working capital in her business and buy three packages of wool and  two cylinders of fuel (petroleum and gasoline.)  She works alone in her business, since her husband works as a moto- taxi driver.

Her dream is to have her business grow and to have a pretty house.

What she likes most about the communal bank are the meetings and making her payments.

loans.use: to buy three packages of wool and two cylinders of fuel (oil and gas)

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar es una mujer alegre y  trabajadora D. 62 años D. edad, vive en una comunidad rural y pequeña ubicada a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, esta comunidad pertenece al distrito D. Monsefú y es una zona donD. predomina la agricultura y la crianza D. animales. 

Pilar vive con sus dos hijas mayores que la apoyan con los quehaceres del hogar y las actividades agrícolas que Pilar desarrolla desD. hace 15 años. Ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno, ubicado en su misma comunidad, donD. siembra maíz cada 6 meses para luego venderlo a los comerciantes chiclayanos, quienes son sus clientes fijos.

Pilar necesita comprar fertilizantes y abono para sus cosechas y es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1200 nuevos soles, que le servirá para llevar a cabo esta actividad. Además Pilar cría un ganado ovino al que le tiene mucho cariño y trata con cuidado, sus ovejas también necesitan D. alimento balanceado para su buen desarrollo y por eso parte del crédito será destinado a eso.

Pilar tiene muchos deseos D. crecer en ambas actividades, pero lo que más quiere es contar con un pequeño establo para cuidar adecuadamente a sus ovejas. Pilar es una clienta conocida para nuestra entidad, este es su noveno crédito y ella se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Pilar es una mujer alegre y  trabajadora D. 62 años D. edad, vive en una comunidad rural y pequeña ubicada a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, esta comunidad pertenece al distrito D. Monsefú y es una zona donD. predomina la agricultura y la crianza D. animales. 

Pilar vive con sus dos hijas mayores que la apoyan con los quehaceres del hogar y las actividades agrícolas que Pilar desarrolla desD. hace 15 años. Ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno, ubicado en su misma comunidad, donD. siembra maíz cada 6 meses para luego venderlo a los comerciantes chiclayanos, quienes son sus clientes fijos.

Pilar necesita comprar fertilizantes y abono para sus cosechas y es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1200 nuevos soles, que le servirá para llevar a cabo esta actividad. Además Pilar cría un ganado ovino al que le tiene mucho cariño y trata con cuidado, sus ovejas también necesitan D. alimento balanceado para su buen desarrollo y por eso parte del crédito será destinado a eso.

Pilar tiene muchos deseos D. crecer en ambas actividades, pero lo que más quiere es contar con un pequeño establo para cuidar adecuadamente a sus ovejas. Pilar es una clienta conocida para nuestra entidad, este es su noveno crédito y ella se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes y alimento balanceado.

loans.name: Ketly

texts.es:
Ketly, de 25 años es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. El negocio al que Ketly se dedica, es la venta de gallinas y patos, a los cuales tiene bien alimentados y cuidados. Su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado Bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa, donde tiene muchos clientes y el dinero que obtiene de sus ventas es muy bueno.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, ya que los cría con mucho cariño, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera de clientes. Para el futuro, planea incursionar en el negocio de Transporte. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y responsable. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará alimento para sus animales menores, ya que sabe que tiene que tenerlos bien alimentados, si quiere recibir un buen precio por ellos.
texts.en:
Ketly is 25 and is very friendly and hard-working.  He lives in his parents’ home, and he is willing to work very hard to improve his quality of life.  He has a business selling hens and ducks, for whom he feeds and cares for very well.  His stand is located in the Bellavista market in the city of Pucallpa, where he has a lot of customers.  He makes good money from his sales.

What he likes most about his job is feeding his animals, since he raises them with a lot of care.  He has had this business for 1 year.  He thinks the most difficult part of his job is being at his stand all day waiting for customers.  In the future, he plans to start a transportation business.  This will be his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  He knows that he has to make his payments on time, and he is willing to do this.  He is a very happy and responsible member of his communal bank.  With the 2,000 PEN he is requesting, he will buy feed for his animals, since he knows that he needs to keep them well-fed if he wants to receive a good price for them.

loans.use: to buy feed for his animals

loans.name: Urmat

texts.en:
Urmat is 53, widowed, and she has five children. Urmat is a very persistent, honest and optimistic woman who strives hard to provide her children with everything they need.

She is engaged in a cattle breeding business, which she started three years ago with the initial capital of 10.000 KGS. Today she has one milk cow (which allows her to get an income from selling milk products) and one calf at her farm.  

Urmat has applied for a loan of 50.000 KGS to purchase another milk cow in order to raise her milk sales and obtain new customers. These investments will help her to support her children and give them a good education. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase another milk cow.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 51 años de edad, el es casado y tiene 2 hijo a su cargo , el reside en casa propia  en donde habita con su familia, su casa esta ubicada en la campiña sector 4 en un caserío llamado la  matanza en el deparatmento de Piura

Fernando se dedica  a la actividad de trabajo de campo como obrero (agricultor), cultivando fríjol de palo y con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a la economía de su familia. El ya cuenta con más de diez años dedicándose a esta actividad y debido a ello conoce mucho del manejo de cultivos.

Fernando esta solicitando un préstamo a  Edpyme Alternativa d 1500 nuevos soles para que realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, de esta manera contara con mayor seguridad y comodidad en su hogar, además quiere comprar una refrigeradora la cual utilizará par el mantenimiento del fríjol de palo.

 Fernando es conocido en la zona donde vive, cuenta con clientela conocida 
la ayudara a obtener una mejor condicion de vida    cliente es conocido en la zona de trabajo, y cuanta con clientes
texts.en:
Fernando is 51 years old, married, and has 2 children.  He lives in his own home with his family.  His house is located in La Campiña, sector 4, in a village called La Matanza in Piura state.  

Fernando is a farm worker.  He grows pole beans and the money he earns from this activity allows him to improve his family's financial situation.  He has been doing this work for over 10 years and knows a great deal about managing crops. 

Fernando is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa  for 1500 New Soles which he will used to make some improvements to his house so that it is safer and more comfortable.  He would also live to purchase a cooler which he will use to store the pole beans. 

He is well known in the area where he lives and has regular customers.  This loan will help him improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 40 years old and lives in West Point, Liberia. She is married and went to school, finishing the 4th grade.  Her husband is a mechanic servicing motorcycles.  They have two children aged 26 and 19, both of whom have finished school.  

For more than 20 years Olive has been cooking and selling dried plantain chips from a table in front of her house.  Her biggest worry is the lack of customers and the small amount that each one spends.  Her mother showed her how to run her own business.  She is proud that the business enables her to get money to look after her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more food for her business.  In the future, she plans to build up some savings

loans.use: to purchase more food for her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from livestock & a restaurant. Edna is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her furniture-making business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for furniture making.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo de cuarenta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de ropa en el lugar de su residencia últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues la ropa que vende es de muy buena calidad y claro a un buen precio, tiene diferentes tipos y estilos faldas cortas y largas, vestidos, pantalones, trajes de niño, calcetines entre otros, todo para hombre o mujer; Consuelo es una mujer de trabajo siempre esta activa y con ganas de estar adelante de la competencia se levanta desde muy temprano a vender pues tiene el lema de a quien madruga Dios le ayuda, con ese pensamiento positivo quiere surtir mas el negocio para que crezca es por eso que le solicito a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, camisetas, pantalones, blusas, ropa interior etc. Así siempre estará a disposición de las necesidades de los clientes. Consuelo tiene la confianza que así lograra darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 40, lives with her life partner and three children in her own house.  She sells clothes from home and has lately acquired quite a large clientele because the clothes she sells are of very good quality and, of course, very good price.  She has a variety of styles and types: short and long skirts, dresses, pants, children’s outfits and socks, among others, for both men and women.

Consuelo is a woman who works; she’s always busy wanting to stay ahead of the competition.  She rises very early to sell because she feels that God help she who rises early.  With this positive attitude she wants to better sort her business so that it will grow and this is why she’s asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy t-shirts, pants, blouses, underwear, etc. so that she’ll always be able to meet customer demand.  Consuelo trusts that she’ll be able to provide her family with a full life this way.

loans.use: ropa interior to buy clothes.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia nació en la provincia de Urubamba en la comunidad de Racchi y tiene 40 años de edad,  ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. 

Actualmente, Emilia vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la agricultura por lo tanto siembra cebada, trigo, maíz y otras cosas más, ella vende sus granos secos los días sábados en el mercado de Cusco y los días miércoles en el mercado de la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tambien se dedica a la ganadería. 

En esta oportunidad Emilia requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado. 

El Banco Comunal “Qorihuayrachina” se reúne cada treinta en la comunidad de Racchi de la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Emilia was born in Urubamba Province in the community of Racchi.  She’s 40 years old, married and has four children.

Currently, Emilia lives in the same community where she was born and where she carries out her various economic activities.  She’s a barley, wheat, corn and other products farmer.  She sells her dry grains on Saturdays in the Cusco market and on Wednesdays in the Urubamba market; she also raises livestock.  On this occasion, Emilia needs the loan to buy cattle.

The “Qorihuayrachina” communal bank meets monthly in the community of Racchi, Urubamba Province, Cusco Department (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone as well as for its traditional “Inty Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and a father of three children.

Farhat has been an owner of a fabric shop since 2008, selling a selection of fabrics such as wool, linen, silk, cotton and bridal fabrics. He has good experience in this field, a deep understanding of the local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2500 loan in order to redecorate his shop and to purchase a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop and to purchase a generator.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, vive por la comunidad Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales también labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas. Su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora que laboran día a día para salir adelante.

La Señora María tiene 37 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 19, 18, 17 y 12 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo no se encuentra en el país ha migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo para sacar adelante a su familia, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y como pasa en casa cría y vende animales como cuyes y gallinas.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para iniciar con esta actividad. 

Su meta es tener  más variedad de animales para la cría.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Yanaturo.  She lives in the community of Yanaturo in the city of Cuenca, a place where the people work in agriculture, raise animals, and also work in the city in a variety of occupations.  The people of this place are friendly, courteous and hardworking, and they work each day in order to get ahead.

Maria is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children who were born into the marriage.  Her children are 19, 18, 17 and 12, and they are all in school in the city.  Her husband is outside the country; he has migrated in order to seek better work opportunities to provide for his family.  The family lives in their own home.

Maria devotes her time to caring for her children and she also has a business at her house raising animals to sell such as guinea pigs and hens.

She is taking her 3rd loan through her communal bank, which she will invest in the purchase of pigs to raise.

Her goal is to have a greater variety of animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 41 years old. She is married and has 2 children.  Alicia manufactures bamboo furniture. She has had this business for 9 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy bamboo, varnish and nails. Alicia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Alicia hopes to improve her business and to have a furniture shop.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like bamboo, varnish & nails

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia moves around in the vicinity of Elmina to sell slippers and cloth. She is married to a farmer and together they live with their four children. Her husband is a farmer. Emelia assists her spouse in taking care of her children. Emelia will use the loan to obtain slippers and cloth for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emelia plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to obtain slippers and cloth for resale.

loans.name: Kimakina Group

texts.en:
Alfred is the facilitator of the Kimakina group. Alfred and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alfred takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Alfred had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alfred was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alfred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Alfred will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kimakina group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Alfred is pictured with his group members and the person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 10 to 30 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail store where she sells home products. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy shopping centre. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be increased cost of goods when buying them. She will use this loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to add stock of home products. Her business goal is to expand her business and increase the stock within 5 years.

loans.use: To add stock to the retail store.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert simply lives in their community with his wife and three children. He is 46 years old, an industrious husband wherein he manages his farming business for more than ten years. This is their source of income where he usually gets the expenses used in the education of his three children. So he wants to improve more his business. For this reason, he is asking a loan amount P25,000 to purchase corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers that would be used in his corn field in order to yield a better crop by the next cropping season. 


He hopes to gain much crops to provide the needs of his family. Through his hard work and patience to work every day in his business, he knows that there is hope for him to achieve better living.

loans.use: purchase corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis es chofer propietario afiliado en uno de los sindicatos de choferes en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito es para la compra de ítem de- trabajo para el sindicato, pues es un requerimiento para poder trabajar y estar al amparo del sindicato. José Luís  es divorciado y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en casa de su hermana  ubicada en  la zona  de Villa Nueva Potosí  de la Ciudad de La Paz. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con el crédito otorgado ya que- le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y así ayudar a su familia. Es la primera vez que trabaja con kiva.
texts.en:
José Luis is a driver/owner affiliated with one of the city of La Paz’s taxi driver syndicates.  The loan is to buy a work item for the syndicate because it’s a requirement to be able to work and be sanctioned by the syndicate.  

José Luis is divorced and has four children.  He lives in his sister’s house located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Nueva Potosí zone.  He is very satisfied with the granted loan because it will help him increase his income and thus help his family.  It’s the first time he’s worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a work item required by his taxi syndicate.

loans.name: Sansao

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, de 26 anos de idade fez a 9ª classe. Vive maritalmente na casa própria. E pai de 2 filhos Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe e dois sobrinhos que vive com ele em sua casa consegue poupar 1.000.00mt na sua conta bancária, pois tem tido trabalhos extras de mecânica.
 É  seguranca na Empresa G4S em turnos no periodo da manhã das 7:00h as 17:00h e no periodo da noite das 17:00h as 7:00 do dia seguinte estando a operar a mais de 6 anos auferindo mensalmente um valor que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra.este e seu quarto emprestimo na hluvuku no valor de 18.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar(cimento, ferros , barrotes e chapas de zinco) para concluir a cobertura da sua casa.
Prtende  futuramente adquirir um minibus para tranportar passageiros.
texts.en:
Sansao was born in the District of Namaacha. He is 26 years old and finished ninth grade. He lives with his partner in his own home. He has two children, and financially supports his mother and two nephews, who live with him. He saves 1,000 meticals a month in his bank account, as he gets extra work as a mechanic.
He works as a security guard in the company G4S, taking the 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. shift one day and the 5 p.m. to 7 a.m. shift the next. He has worked there for more than six years and uses his salary to cover household expenses and the construction on his house. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 18,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, iron, beams, sheet metal, etc.) to finish roofing his house.
In the future, he'd like to buy a minibus to transport passengers.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, iron, beams, sheet metal).

loans.name: Marilenis Alcira

texts.es: Marilenis, nuevamente se decidió a adquirir otro préstamo debido a la buena atención de nuestra institución y porque invertirá en su negocio y comprara la materia prima que necesita como: panes, mortadela, carne, pollo de esa forma forma podrá tener mejores ingresos y mas clientes. Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron a mantener siempre su clientela y ha mejorado mucho en sus ingresos lo cual le ha permitido ayudarle a su familia en las necesidades básicas.
texts.en: Marilenis again decided to get another loan because of our institution's good service, and because she will invest in her business and buy the ingredients she needs, such as bread, mortadella, meat, and chicken.  In this way she will have better income and more customers.  The previous loans helped her keep her customers, and she has improved her income a lot.  This has allowed her to help her family with basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy bread, mortadella, meat, and chicken.

loans.name: Thom

texts.en: Ms. Thom is taking out a loan for her daughter Thuy who is a student at Bac Ha Technology College. She is a second-year student. With the hope to be an accountant, she is studying accounting. After graduation in 2012, she hopes to works for a company near her house. Currently, her tuition fees are due. Therefore, Ms. Thom wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to pay the tuition.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOPE NABY a été crée le 09 juillet 2011, les femmes membres du groupe sont toutes des commerçantes et se sont organisées par affinité et voisinage. 

Fatoumata la responsable du groupe est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 03 autres qui lui sont confiés par des proches. Elle est âgée de 56 ans.

Elle fait du petit commerce de produits alimentaires Elle gère une petite cantine où elle vend sa marchandise (épices, des oignons, poivre etc.)  Elle mène cette activité depuis 02 ans. elle debout sur la photo habillée en blanc.

Elle se s'approvisionne en marchandise au marché central de la ville

Son prêt lui servira à augmenter et diversifier la quantité de ses produits alimentaires pour accroître son niveau de revenus.

Elle soutien son mari dans la gestion de dépense quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
The Sop Naby group was created on July 9, 2011. The group members are all shopkeepers. 

Fatoumata, the group leader, is married, mother of six children, and has three others in her care. She is 56 years old and sells food products. She runs a little canteen where she sells her merchandise. She has practiced this activity for two years. She is standing up in the photo, dressed in white.

She obtains fresh supplies in the city's central market.

Her loan will be used to increase and diversify the quantity of food products in hopes of making higher profits.

She helps her husband in the management of the family's expenses.

loans.use: Acheter des épices, poivre, oignons etc..

loans.name: Dulbar

texts.ru:
Дилбар женщина в возрасте 44 лет, замужем имеет 2 прекрасных детей. Она мечтает что бы ее дети получили высшее образование как она  и нашли хорошую работу. Ее знакомые и близкие не имели возможность получить образование. Ее сын мечтал поступить в зарубежные университеты, но это дорого и очень далеко от дома. Дилбар считает что местное обучение не так уж плохо, потому что стоимость обучения низкая по сравнению за границей,но в будущем она планирует перевести своего сына   в другой ВУЗ. В настоящий момент университет в который  поступает ее сын  будут выбирать на конкурсной основе среди выпускников средних специальных и высших учебных заведениях, учившихся по очной форме обучения.
Считает, что приобретённый кредит сможет устранить его трудности. Выражает благодарность «Кива» за содействие и огромную роль в его жизни.
texts.en: Dulbar is a 44-year-old woman who is married and has two beautiful children.  She hopes that her children will be able to get a university education like her and find good jobs.  None of her friends or acquaintances has ever had the opportunity to get an education.  Her son dreams of studying abroad, but money would be an issue as well as being far from home.  Dulbar thinks it's possible to get a quality education in Tajikistan, and at a lower cost than abroad, but her son has plans to eventually transfer to another university all the same.  The university he's currently applying to will select among on-site students from both secondary as well as other post-secondary schools on a competitive basis.  Her son feels that this loan will make the process easier for him, and gives his thanks to Kiva for their help and for the big role they'll play in his life.

loans.use: pay for university

loans.name: Fancy

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Fancy, a mother of four from Litein, a remote town in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past 14 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also runs the only diesel posho mill in her village. Fancy is a go-getter, and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed one of them “Kipara,” meaning no feathers on the head.

Fancy wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Fancy will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. She is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Fancy dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Ma. Emelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Emelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Emelyn is 45 years old and has five children whom are still in school.

Ma. Emelyn has a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. Ma. Emelyn requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Ma. Emelyn has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
This description was written by Moses Onyango, a representative for Kiva and Village Enterprise Fund in Uganda.

She got a grant of $100 from Village Enterprise Fund. She started by buying chicken and selling them right away. Most people have known his business so a number of them came to her to buy chickens.

She can now buy and sell between 30-90 chicken in a day with a great profit. The market is very open for her since most Ugandans keep Chicken for raising money whenever, need arises for other basic needs, sickness, Journey etc.

She sells the chicken mostly to families who come to buy from this poultry and some times she takes to the market where she is able to meet customers of different categories from different places.

There are three (3) basic ways of preparing chicken in this region, it can be through deep frying it, boiling with soup, and roasting but basically there are only two common ways and that is boiling with soup and the other one is roasting.

Families keep their live chickens through free range poultry system where the chickens are left to move freely all over the compound without restriction. But some times they also cage them especially for modern poultry keepers.

She has attended business training and he is capable of handling the loan and paying back.

loans.use: Buy chickens in bulk

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella has a laundry where she provides washing and drying services. Bella started her business by borrowing 200 dollars from the loan sharks to buy a washing machine. In the beginning she only provided her services to friends and neighbors. Now she offers washing, drying and renting of washing machines for her clients' homes. She would use this loan to buy the clothes dryer she needs to keep up with demand for her services. She is confident that with this new tool her business will grow.

Bella is 44 years old. She has 3 children; one of her children is currently in school. She depends on the business to support her family. Bella is confident that this loan will give her family economic security and allow her to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Bella tiene una lavandería donde presta servicios de lavado y secado de ropa. Bella empezó su negocio prestando un dinero a los chulqueros (loan sharks) de 200 dólares para la compra de una lavadora. Al principio solo prestaba servicio de lavado a amigos y vecinos. Ahora ella ofrece servicio de lavado, secado y alquiler de lavadoras a domicilio. Bella usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar una secadora que necesita para atender muy bien a la demanda. Ella tiene la seguridad que con esta nueva herramienta de trabajo su negocio va ha tener un crecimiento. Bella tiene 44 años, esta unida tiene tres hijos uno de ellos estudia. Ella depende del negocio para apoyar a su familia. Bella tiene la confianza que este préstamo le dará seguridad económica a su familia y permitirle adecuar su vivienda.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a new washer

loans.name: Aipopo

texts.en: Aipopo supports herself and her family by weaving traditional Samoan mats.  In the traditional Samoan household, there is little, if any, furniture and mats are an important part of daily life.  Mats are spread out on the floor of the traditional, open structured Samoan house (fale) and used to sit on for family gatherings and meals as well as village meetings.  Aipopo is one of the Samoan women that keeps the tradition of mat weaving alive; she uses all local, natural materials such as palm and other leaves (taiga laufala) to make her mats.  Aipopo is able to sell mats to local villagers for family use as well as to make fine, large mats for export to America.  Abroad, Aipopo’s mats can command high prices.  Aipopo is seeking a loan so that she can purchase the materials necessary to continue to make fine Samoan mats for export.  A loan to Aipopo not only helps her provide for her children, but also supports the traditional Samoan craft of mat weaving.

loans.use: Buy materials for weaving traditional mats

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro has been able to support his family in an honorable way by preparing and selling tamarind candies and pulps in the city of Reynosa, Tamaulipas. He is married and he has a son. In order to improve the quality of his products, he wants to buy a labeling machine to put labels in the containers of his products. He needs a loan of $925 to increase his production and sales. Alejandro has put a lot effort in developing his business, he would like to keep growing as a micro-entrepreneur and with your help this could be possible. By buying the labeling machine he will be able to cover the growing demand of his products. Alejandro and his family are sincerely grateful of your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace cinco años Alejandro se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pulpas y dulces de tamarindo en la ciudad de Reynosa, Tamaulipas, con este oficio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia honestamente, él es casado y tiene un hijo. En busca de mejorar la calidad de sus productos ahora desea poder adquirir una ensambladora de etiquetas para adherir los envases y poder incrementar su producción y ventas, para lo que necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares. Alejandro se ha esforzado mucho para desarrollar su negocio, y desea continuar creciendo como microempresario y con tu ayuda será posible, al adquirir la ensambladora podrá cubrir la creciente demanda de sus productos, él y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy equipment for his job

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Mohira I. is 39 years old. She is married with two children. Her husband works in the Russian Federation and her children go to school. Mohira has a business grinding and selling meat.

She has been the client of MicroInvest since 2004 when she rented refrigerators. After receving her first $70 loan, Mohira bought meat wholesale, sold it, and began to make profit. Eventually, she was able to purchase her own refrigerator. Currently, her sales increased to $300. In the future, she hopes to increase her sales and purchase a personal meat grinder.

Translated from Russian to English by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Исмоилова Мохира – 39 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Муж уехал на заработки в РФ, дети учатся в школе. Вот уже 6 лет она занимается производством и продажей фарша.

Клиентом в МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала 2004году, тогда она брала в аренду холодильник, и её активы составляли 70$. После получения займа и целевого использования, она стала покупать оптом мясо, приобрела холодильник. Сейчас её активы возросли до 300$. В будущем хочет увеличить активы и приобрести мясорубку.

loans.use: Increase her sales and purchase a meat grinder

loans.name: Heab

texts.en:
Mrs. Heab T., age 41, sells fruit in the market, earning about $4.75 per day in revenue. Her husband works as a mechanic, making about $7.30 per day in revenue. They have three children, two of whom are students and one of whom is becoming a monk.

In order to expand her husbands business to meet customer demand, Heab would like to borrow $1,000 in order to buy a stand for her husband to run his business out of. A location closer to customers will increase income for the family, providing greater financial security and financing their children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a mechanic's stand.

loans.name: Virginia Candelaria

texts.es:
In spite of her young age, Virginia is a hard-working, responsible girl. When she was little, she worked at selling kitchen condiments, and through such small activities, she’s tried to somehow bring income to her home to help with the most urgent expenses. Currently, with support from her dear father, she decided to set up a modest Internet café to serve the community, hoping that her beloved family would find economic stability and that she could pay her tuition. She is avidly studying obstetrics in her town's university. This exemplary young woman’s wish is to bring good service and convenience to her customers; to do this, she is requesting a loan that she will use for the annual maintenance on the computers so that her customers can continue to enjoy their benefits. She is committed to repaying your noble help in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Virginia, pese a su corta edad es una muchacha muy laboriosa y responsable, desde muy pequeña se dedicó a vender condimentos de cocina y a través de estas pequeñas actividades trataba de aportar de alguna manera ingresos económicos a su hogar para solventar los gastos más urgentes.Actualmente con el apoyo de su querido padre decidió instalar y brindar en su humilde hogar el servicio de Internet a toda su comunidad, con el fin de que su querida familia encuentre estabilidad económica, y sobre todo satisfacer los gastos que le demanda sus estudios superiores de Obstetricia que muy ávidamente sigue en la universidad de su ciudad. El deseo de esta ejemplar joven es brindar un buen servicio y comodidad a sus clientes, para esto solicita un préstamo que utilizará para otorgarle el mantenimiento anual a sus máquinas a fin de que puedan estar muy bien para que sus clientes sigan gozando de sus beneficios, comprometiéndose a retornar tu noble apoyo en un lapso de seis meses.

loans.use: Maintain computers to keep them functioning smoothly and problem-free

loans.name: Umi

texts.en: Umi is 33-year-old woman who sells vegetables at her small shop and earns about US$ 5 per day. Previously, she sold food, but that business did not run very well, so she would like to concentrate on vegetable sales in the future. Her husband, U., sells foods and only earns a small income. Umi is requesting a loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business selling vegetables

loans.name: Antonia Tereza

texts.es:
Mrs. Antonia Tereza, being 72 years old, continues to be a very hardworking woman and being very dedicated to her business. Even though she only got one year of schooling she always wanted her 7 children to be better than her. Therefore, she always supported them in their studies. Now, her children are older and don't depend on her any more. Mrs. Antonia is currently living in the Caserío de Piscopampa in the Mache district, Otuzco province in La Libertad state.

She's been selling batteries, aluminum, lamps, firewood, etc. for 40 years. She started at a smaller town called "Campo Bello". She worked there for a while, but then she met her husband and he took her to Caserío de Piscopampa. She continued her business at her new hometown. Now she also purchases and sells fresh cheese. She purchases it at the different farmhouses and then sells them to visitors. She also offers her products at the Trujillo city.

Mrs. Antonia belongs to the "Women at Work" communal bank. She got her first S/. 300.00 loan from this bank, which she used to purchase fresh cheese and batteries. With the new loan of S/.3,000.00, which she will pay back in four months, she will purchase 8 batteries, 7 kilograms of aluminum, 7 petromax lamps and 15 loads of firewood.

Her biggest dream is to have a little cart to transport merchandise to the city of Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Antonia Tereza a sus 72 años de edad sigue siendo una señora muy trabajadora y empeñosa en su negocio. Aunque solo estudió un año siempre quiso que sus 7 hijos fueran mejores que ella, es por eso que siempre les apoyó en sus estudios. Ahora sus hijos ya son mayores y no dependen de ella. Actualmente vive en el Caserío de Piscopampa, distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. Hace 40 años que se dedica a la venta de baterías, lámparas, aluminio, leña, etc. Ella empezó en el poblado menor de Campo Bello, ahí estuvo por un tiempo, pero conoció a su esposo y la llevó a vivir al caserío Piscopampa. En este lugar continúo con su negocio. Ahora también se dedica a la compra y venta de cuajada, ella compra en los diferentes caseríos y los vende a los visitantes y también ofrece sus productos en la ciudad de Trujillo. La señora Antonia pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres de Trabajo”, aquí obtuvo un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 y con ese dinero compró cuajada y baterías. Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará 8 baterías, 7 kilogramos de aluminio, 7 lámparas petromax y 15 cargas de leña. Su mayor sueño es tener un carrito para transportar mercadería a la ciudad de Trujillo.

loans.use: Purchase batteries, aluminum, lamps, etc.

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es:
Cosme is a producer with ample knowledge of pineapple production. For 40 years, he has dedicated himself to this activity, working all day in the field, cleaning the pineapple plants, planting new sprouts, fertilizing with seeds so that they reproduce healthily and, with insecticides, eliminating animal pests like fungi that grow with humidity. The whole pineapple harvest process requires much investment. The cost of maintaining various plots of land is high. As a result, Cosme is requesting a loan so that he may complete the production of one plot of pineapple and sell them to the surrounding communities that consume this fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

"Cosme es un productor con amplios conocimientos en la producción de piña, lleva 40 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, trabaja todo el día en el campo limpiando las plantaciones de piña, sembrando nuevos retoños, abonando con semillas para que se reproduzcan sanas y eliminado con insecticidas las plagas de animales como hongos que se producen por la humedad. Todo el proceso de la cosecha de piña implica de mucha inversión, los costos de mantener varias manzanas de tierra es alto, es por eso que el señor solicita un préstamo para poder terminar de producir 1 manzana de piña que esta por dar fruto y así comercializarla a las comunidades aledañas que consumen dicho fruto. "

loans.use: Buy seeds for fruit, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William E. is a trader who sells clothing materials, ladies' dresses, creams and other things. His wife is also a trader and has 3 children. He wants to increase his sales to meet the increase in demand but lacks adequate funds. He is asking for $725 to buy more stock for his business to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his business

loans.name: Anifa

texts.en:
Anifa is 27 years old and is married with two children. Anifa owns a small shop, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm in her shop and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Anifa now hopes for a loan to buy more shop inventory (soap, cereals, oil and juice).

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat U. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is divorced and has 3 children. Saodat is the sole bread winner for the family and to earn a living she sells shoes and clothes at a market in Dushanbe. She has been managing her clothing business for the last 15 years. In order to expand the number of items she offers at her clothing stand Saodat needs to take out this loan. She hopes this investment will help her increase her sales and her income which is necessary to support her growing children. Saodat is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Уронова Саодат проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Разведена и имеет 3 детей. Она одна без чьей-либо помощи обеспечивает свою семью. Работает на рынке города Душанбе. Торгует обувью и одеждой. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Это поможет ей увеличить доход , который так необходим ее детям. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Expansion of inventory

loans.name: Bechir

texts.en:
Bechir, 25 years old, lives and works in Saida South, Lebanon, where he owns a small bakery shop that specializes in selling "Manakish," the famous Lebanese "pizza" that everybody has for breakfast. Previously, Bechir received a $1,000 loan from Al Majmoua which he used to buy a new oven for his business. He now has the opportunity to enlarge his business and is requesting another loan of $1,000 to purchase fixed assets such as a dough mixer, new stands, some tables and chairs.

Bechir is a young but very responsible man who wants to make sure he can provide the best for his wife and his child.

loans.use: To purchase a dough mixer, new stands, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Maria S.. She is married and has three children, ages 3 and 6.

In 2008, Maria established her grocery business. She opens her business six days a week and 11 hours a day. Maria requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk.. In the future, Maria plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stock.. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is "genge." A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk.
